analyzed: tat dhyātvā avāṅmukhaḥ tūṣṇīm āsthitaḥ smi mahānasam
translated: Remembering that, I remained silent with a downcast face in the kitchen.

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva anyat pratijñātam yat vadāmi iha bhāmini
translated: Listen to another vow that I am making now, O beautiful one.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: āśvāsayan hi pāñcālīṃ bhīmasena uvāca ha
analyzed: āśvāsayan hi pāñcālīm bhīmasenaḥ uvāca ha
translated: Indeed, Bhimasena spoke to Panchali, consoling her:

original: dhig astu me bāhubalaṃ gāṇḍīvaṃ phalgunasya ca
analyzed: dhik astu me bāhu balam gāṇḍīvam phalgunasya ca
translated: Shame on the strength of my arms and on Phalguna's Gandiva,

original: yat te raktau purā bhūtvā pāṇī kṛtakiṇāv ubhau
analyzed: yat te raktau purā bhūtvā pāṇī kṛta kiṇau ubhau
translated: Since your hands, which were once red, have now become calloused.

original: tad adya mānutapati yatkṛtaṃ na mayā purā
analyzed: tat adya mā anutapati yat kṛtam na mayā purā
translated: That now burns me, what I did not do before.

original: dyūte na nidhanaṃ bhīru kurūṇāṃ pāpakāriṇām
analyzed: dyūte na nidhanam bhīru kurūṇām pāpa kāriṇām
translated: O timid one, the Kurus, the perpetrators of evil, will not meet their end in gambling.

original: sabhāyāṃ sma virāṭasya karomi kadanaṃ mahat
analyzed: sabhāyām sma virāṭasya karomi kadanam mahat
translated: I will create a great carnage in Virata's assembly hall.

original: tatra me kāraṇaṃ bhāti kaunteyo yat pratīkṣate
analyzed: tatra me kāraṇam bhāti kaunteyaḥ yat pratīkṣate
translated: There, the reason why the son of Kunti is waiting appears to me.

analyzed: athavā kīcakasya aham pothayāmi padā śiraḥ
translated: Or I will crush Kichaka's head with my foot,

analyzed: aiśvarya mada mattasya krīḍan iva mahā dvipaḥ
translated: Like a great elephant playing, intoxicated with the pride of sovereignty.

original: apaśyaṃ tvāṃ yadā kṛṣṇe kīcakena padā hatām
analyzed: apaśyam tvām yadā kṛṣṇe kīcakena padā hatām
translated: When I saw you, O Krishna, struck by Kichaka with his foot,

analyzed: tadā eva aham cikīrṣāmi matsyānām kadanam mahat
translated: At that time, I desired to create a great carnage among the Matsyas.

original: tatra māṃ dharmarājas tu kaṭākṣeṇa nyavārayat
analyzed: tatra mām dharmarājaḥ tu kaṭākṣeṇa nyavārayat
translated: But Dharmaraja restrained me with a sidelong glance.

original: tad ahaṃ tasya vijñāya sthita evāsmi bhāmini
analyzed: tat aham tasya vijñāya sthitaḥ evā asmi bhāmini
translated: O beautiful lady, knowing that, I remained silent.

original: yac ca rāṣṭrāt pracyavanaṃ kurūṇām avadhaś ca yaḥ
analyzed: yat ca rāṣṭrāt pracyavanam kurūṇām avadhaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: The exile of the Kurus from their kingdom and the slaughter,

analyzed: suyodhanasya karṇasya śakuneḥ saubalasya ca
translated: of Suyodhana, Karna, Shakuni the son of Subala,

original: duḥśāsanasya pāpasya yan mayā na hṛtaṃ śiraḥ
analyzed: duḥśāsanasya pāpasya yat mayā na hṛtam śiraḥ
translated: and the wicked Dushasana - that I did not cut off their heads,

original: tan me dahati kalyāṇi hṛdi śalyam ivārpitam
analyzed: tat me dahati kalyāṇi hṛdi śalyam iva arpitam
translated: burns me, O blessed lady, like an arrow stuck in the heart.

original: api cānyad varārohe smariṣyasi vaco mama
analyzed: api ca anyat varārohe smariṣyasi vacaḥ mama
translated: And moreover, O beautiful lady, you will remember my words,

original: puṇye tīre sarasvatyā yat pratiṣṭhāma saṃgatāḥ
analyzed: puṇye tīre sarasvatyāḥ yat pratiṣṭhāma saṃgatāḥ
translated: when we met on the sacred banks of the Sarasvati.

analyzed: tatra aham abruvam kṛṣṇe pūrva kleśān anusmaran
translated: There, O Krishna, remembering my past sufferings, I said,

analyzed: na ca aham anugaccheyam dharmarājam yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: I will not follow Dharmaraja Yudhishthira,

original: dhanaṃjayaṃ ca pāñcāli mādrīputrau ca bhrātarau
analyzed: dhanaṃjayam ca pāñcāli mādrī putrau ca bhrātarau
translated: nor Dhananjaya, O Panchali, nor the brothers, the sons of Madri.

original: kṛtvaitāṃ ca matiṃ kṛṣṇe yudhiṣṭhiram agarhayam
analyzed: kṛtvā etām ca matim kṛṣṇe yudhiṣṭhiram agarhayam
translated: Having made up my mind thus, O Krishna, I reproached Yudhishthira,

original: paruṣaṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā mama dharmātmajas tadā
analyzed: paruṣam vacanam śrutvā mama dharmātmajaḥ tadā
translated: and Dharma's son, hearing my harsh words,

original: hrīmān vākyam ahīnārthaṃ bruvan rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: hrīmān vākyam ahīna artham bruvan rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: the modest King Yudhishthira, speaking words of deep meaning,

original: sarvān anvanayad bhrātṝn muner dhaumyasya paśyataḥ
analyzed: sarvān anvanayat bhrātṝn muneḥ dhaumyasya paśyataḥ
translated: And the sage Dhaumya looking on, he followed all his brothers.

analyzed: mā rodīḥ rājñi lokānām sarva āgama guṇa anvite
translated: Do not weep, O queen, who are endowed with all the qualities of learning.

analyzed: rakṣitavyam sadā asmābhiḥ satyam apratimam bhuvi
translated: Truth, which is unequalled on earth, should always be protected by us.

original: anunīteṣu cāsmāsu anunītā tvam apy uta
analyzed: anunīteṣu ca asmāsu anunītā tvam api uta
translated: And when we have been appeased, you too have been appeased.

original: mā dharmaṃ jahi suśroṇi krodhaṃ jahi mahāmate🔽imaṃ ca samupālambhaṃ tvatto rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: mā dharmam jahi suśroṇi krodham jahi mahāmate  imam ca samupālambham tvattaḥ rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: O you of beautiful hips, renounce anger, O you of great intelligence.

original: śṛṇuyād yadi kalyāṇi kṛtsnaṃ jahyāt sa jīvitam
analyzed: śṛṇuyāt yadi kalyāṇi kṛtsnam jahyāt sa jīvitam
translated: If king Yudhishthira were to hear this reproach from you, O fortunate one, he would give up his life entirely.

original: dhanaṃjayo vā suśroṇi yamau vā tanumadhyame
analyzed: dhanaṃjayaḥ vā su śroṇi yamau vā tanu madhyame
translated: Or, O you of beautiful hips, or Dhananjaya, or the twins, O you of slender waist,

analyzed: loka antara gateṣu eṣu na aham śakṣyāmi jīvitum
translated: if they were to go to another world, I would not be able to live.

original: dharmaṃ śṛṇuṣva pāñcāli yat te vakṣyāmi bhāmini🔽sukanyā nāma śāryātī bhārgavaṃ cyavanaṃ vane
analyzed: dharmam śṛṇuṣva pāñcāli yat te vakṣyāmi bhāmini  sukanyā nāma śāryātī bhārgavam cyavanam vane
translated: Listen to dharma, O Panchali, O beautiful one, what I shall tell you.🔽The daughter of Sharadvan, named Sukanya, followed the son of Bhrigu, Chyavana, in the forest,

analyzed: valmīka bhūtam śāmyantam anvapadyata bhāminī
translated: when he was being pacified, becoming an anthill.

original: nāḍāyanī cendrasenā rūpeṇa yadi te śrutā
analyzed: nāḍāyanī ca indrasenā rūpeṇa yadi te śrutā
translated: And if you have heard of Nadayani Indrasena, who was famous for her beauty,

analyzed: patim anvacarat vṛddham purā varṣa sahasriṇam
translated: she followed her aged husband for a thousand years in the past.

original: duhitā janakasyāpi vaidehī yadi te śrutā
analyzed: duhitā janakasya api vaidehī yadi te śrutā
translated: And if you have heard of Vaidehi, the daughter of Janaka,

original: patim anvacarat sītā mahāraṇyanivāsinam🔽rakṣasā nigrahaṃ prāpya rāmasya mahiṣī priyā
analyzed: patim anvacarat sītā mahā araṇya nivāsinam  rakṣasā nigraham prāpya rāmasya mahiṣī priyā
translated: Sita followed her husband who was dwelling in the great forest.🔽The beloved queen of Rama, who was seized and restrained by a demon,

original: rāvaṇena hṛtā sītā rākṣasībhiś ca tarjitā
analyzed: rāvaṇena hṛtā sītā rākṣasībhiḥ ca tarjitā
translated: Sita was abducted by Ravana and tormented by the demonesses.

analyzed: kliśyamānā api su śroṇī rāmam eva anvapadyata
translated: Even while being afflicted, the one with beautiful hips resorted only to Rama.

analyzed: lopāmudrā tathā bhīru vayaḥ rūpa samanvitā
translated: Similarly, the timid Lopamudra, endowed with youth and beauty,

original: agastyam anvayād dhitvā kāmān sarvān amānuṣān
analyzed: agastyam anvayāt hitvā kāmān sarvān amānuṣān
translated: followed Agastya, renouncing all superhuman desires.

analyzed: dyumatsena sutam vīram satyavantam aninditā
translated: The unblemished Savitri followed the son of Dyumatsena, the hero Satyavan,

analyzed: sāvitrī anucacāra ekā yama lokam manasvinī
translated: alone, the wise one followed him to the world of Yama.

original: yathaitāḥ kīrtitā nāryo rūpavatyaḥ pativratāḥ🔽nalaṃ rājānam evātha damayantī vanāntare
analyzed: yathā etāḥ kīrtitāḥ nāryaḥ rūpavatyaḥ pativratāḥ  nalam rājānam eva atha damayantī vana antare
translated: Just as these women, renowned for their beauty and fidelity,🔽so Damayanti followed king Nala in the forest, O Krishna.

original: anvagacchat purā kṛṣṇe tathā bhartṝṃs tvam anvagāḥ
analyzed: anvagacchat purā kṛṣṇe tathā bhartṝn tvam anvagāḥ
translated: In the same way, you have followed your husbands.

original: tathā tvam api kalyāṇi sarvaiḥ samuditā guṇaiḥ
analyzed: tathā tvam api kalyāṇi sarvaiḥ samuditā guṇaiḥ
translated: O fortunate one, you are endowed with all virtues.

original: mādīrghaṃ kṣama kālaṃ tvaṃ māsam adhyardhasaṃmitam
analyzed: mā adīrgham kṣama kālam tvam māsam adhyardha saṃmitam
translated: Do not delay, wait for a period of one month and thirteen days.

original: pūrṇe trayodaśe varṣe rājño rājñī bhaviṣyasi
analyzed: pūrṇe trayodaśe varṣe rājñaḥ rājñī bhaviṣyasi
translated: At the end of the thirteenth year, you will become the queen of the king.

original: satyena te śape cāhaṃ bhavitā nānyatheti ha
analyzed: satyena te śape ca aham bhavitā na anyathā iti ha
translated: I swear to you truthfully, it will not be otherwise.

analyzed: sarvāsām parama strīṇām prāmāṇyam kartum arhasi
translated: You should establish the supremacy of all the best women.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca narendrāṇāṃ mūrdhni sthāsyasi bhāmini
analyzed: sarveṣām ca narendrāṇām mūrdhni sthāsyasi bhāmini
translated: O beautiful one, you will stand on the heads of all the kings.

original: bhartṛbhaktyā ca vṛttena bhogān prāpsyasi durlabhān
analyzed: bhartṛ bhaktyā ca vṛttena bhogān prāpsyasi durlabhān
translated: By your devotion to your husband and good conduct, you will obtain enjoyments that are difficult to attain.

original: pūrṇāyāṃ tu pratijñāyāṃ mahāntaṃ bhogam āpnuyāḥ
analyzed: pūrṇāyām tu pratijñāyām mahāntam bhogam āpnuyāḥ
translated: When your vow is fulfilled, you will obtain great enjoyments.

original: kuru bhartṛgataṃ jñātvā rājñāṃ mūrdhni sthitā bhaveḥ
analyzed: kuru bhartṛ gatam jñātvā rājñām mūrdhni sthitā bhaveḥ
translated: Knowing that you are devoted to your husband, you will stand on the heads of the kings.

analyzed: draupadī uvāca
translated: Draupadi said:

analyzed: ārtayā etat mayā bhīma kṛtam bāṣpa vimokṣaṇam
translated: O Bhima, I shed these tears out of distress.

analyzed: a pārayantyāḥ duḥkhāni na rājānam upālabhe
translated: Unable to bear my sorrows, I do not reproach the king.

analyzed: vyatītam kathayitvā kim bhīmasena mahā bala
translated: O Bhimasena, O mighty one, what is the use of speaking of the past?

original: idaṃ tu duḥkhaṃ kaunteya mamāsahyaṃ nibodha tat
analyzed: idam tu duḥkham kaunteya mama asahyam nibodha tat
translated: O son of Kunti, understand this sorrow of mine that is unbearable.

original: yo 'yaṃ rājño virāṭasya sūtaputras tu kīcakaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ yam rājñaḥ virāṭasya sūtaputraḥ tu kīcakaḥ
translated: This Kichaka, the son of the Suta of King Virata,

analyzed: syālaḥ nāma pravādena bhojaḥ traigarta deśa jaḥ
translated: is known by the name Syalaka, and is a Bhoja from the Trigarta country.

original: tyaktadharmo nṛśaṃsaś ca sarvārtheṣu ca vallabhaḥ🔽nityam evāha duṣṭātmā bhāryā me bhava śobhane
analyzed: tyakta dharmaḥ nṛśaṃsaḥ ca sarva artheṣu ca vallabhaḥ  nityam eva āha duṣṭa ātmā bhāryā me bhava śobhane
translated: He is devoid of dharma, cruel, and dear to the king in all matters.🔽That wicked-souled one always says to me, 'O beautiful one, be my wife.'

original: avinītaḥ suduṣṭātmā mām anātheti cintya saḥ
analyzed: avinītaḥ su duṣṭa ātmā mām anātha iti cintya saḥ
translated: Thinking that I am helpless, he is insolent and extremely wicked.

analyzed: vimuktena vyatītena bhīmasena mahā bala
translated: O Bhimasena, the mighty one, let go of the past.

analyzed: pratyupasthita kālasya kāryasya anantaraḥ bhava
translated: Be ready for the task at hand.

analyzed: mama iha bhīma kaikeyī rūpa abhibhava śaṅkayā
translated: O Bhima, this Kaikeyi, out of fear of being surpassed in beauty,

original: nityam udvijate rājā kathaṃ neyād imām iti
analyzed: nityam udvijate rājā katham na iyāt imām iti
translated: always worries the king, thinking, How can she be taken away?

original: tasyā viditvā taṃ bhāvaṃ svayaṃ cānṛtadarśanaḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ viditvā tam bhāvam svayam ca anṛta darśanaḥ
translated: Knowing her feelings, and myself being prone to falsehood,

original: kīcako 'yaṃ suduṣṭātmā sadā prārthayate hi mām
analyzed: kīcakaḥ yam su duṣṭa ātmā sadā prārthayate hi mām
translated: this extremely wicked-minded Kichaka always seeks me.

original: tam ahaṃ kupitā bhīma punaḥ kopaṃ niyamya ca
analyzed: tam aham kupitā bhīma punar kopam niyamya ca
translated: I, being angry, O Bhima, controlled my anger again

analyzed: abruvam kāma saṃmūḍham ātmānam rakṣa kīcaka
translated: and said to Kichaka, deluded by desire, Save yourself.

original: gandharvāṇām ahaṃ bhāryā pañcānāṃ mahiṣī priyā
analyzed: gandharvāṇām aham bhāryā pañcānām mahiṣī priyā
translated: I am the beloved queen of five Gandharvas.

original: te tvāṃ nihanyur durdharṣāḥ śūrāḥ sāhasakāriṇaḥ
analyzed: te tvām nihanyuḥ durdharṣāḥ śūrāḥ sāhasa kāriṇaḥ
translated: Those invincible heroes, who act rashly, might kill you.

original: evam uktaḥ sa duṣṭātmā kīcakaḥ pratyuvāca ha
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa duṣṭa ātmā kīcakaḥ pratyuvāca ha
translated: Thus addressed, that evil-minded Kichaka replied:

analyzed: na aham bibhemi sairandhri gandharvāṇām śuci smite
translated: O Sairandhri, O one with a pure smile, I am not afraid of the Gandharvas.

original: śataṃ sahasram api vā gandharvāṇām ahaṃ raṇe
analyzed: śatam sahasram api vā gandharvāṇām aham raṇe
translated: I will kill a hundred or a thousand Gandharvas in battle.

original: samāgataṃ haniṣyāmi tvaṃ bhīru kuru me kṣaṇam
analyzed: samāgatam haniṣyāmi tvam bhīru kuru me kṣaṇam
translated: O timid one, give me a moment.

original: ity ukte cābruvaṃ sūtaṃ kāmāturam ahaṃ punaḥ
analyzed: iti ukte ca abruvam sūtam kāma āturam aham punar
translated: When this was said, I again spoke to the lustful charioteer:

original: na tvaṃ pratibalas teṣāṃ gandharvāṇāṃ yaśasvinām
analyzed: na tvam pratibalaḥ teṣām gandharvāṇām yaśasvinām
translated: You are no match for those illustrious gandharvas.

analyzed: dharme sthitā asmi satatam kula śīla samanvitā
translated: I always abide by dharma, endowed with good lineage and character.

original: necchāmi kaṃ cid vadhyantaṃ tena jīvasi kīcaka
analyzed: na icchāmi kam cit vadhyantam tena jīvasi kīcaka
translated: I do not wish anyone to be killed, therefore you live, Kīchaka.

original: evam uktaḥ sa duṣṭātmā prahasya svanavat tadā
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa duṣṭa ātmā prahasya svanavat tadā
translated: Thus addressed, that evil-souled one laughed loudly and said:🔽I will kill you, O Sairandhri, and then I will kill the Pāṇḍavas.

original: atha māṃ tatra kaikeyī preṣayat preṣaṇena tu
analyzed: atha mām tatra kaikeyī preṣayat preṣaṇena tu
translated: Then Kaikeyī sent me there with a message,

analyzed: tena eva coditā pūrvam bhrātṛ priya cikīrṣayā
translated: urged on by him, desiring to do what was pleasing to her brother.

analyzed: surām ānaya sairandhri kīcakasya niveśanāt
translated: Bring liquor, O Sairandhri, from Kīchaka's house.

original: sūtaputras tu māṃ dṛṣṭvā mahat sāntvam avartayat
analyzed: sūtaputraḥ tu mām dṛṣṭvā mahat sāntvam avartayat
translated: But the charioteer's son, seeing me, began to console me greatly.

analyzed: sāntve pratihate kruddhaḥ parāmarśa manāḥ abhavat
translated: When the conciliation failed, he became angry and intended to outrage me.

original: viditvā tasya saṃkalpaṃ kīcakasya durātmanaḥ🔽tathāhaṃ rājaśaraṇaṃ javenaiva pradhāvitā
analyzed: viditvā tasya saṃkalpam kīcakasya durātmanaḥ  tathā aham rāja śaraṇam javena eva pradhāvitā
translated: Knowing the intention of that evil-minded Kīchaka,🔽I quickly ran to the king for protection.

original: saṃdarśane tu māṃ rājñaḥ sūtaputraḥ parāmṛśat
analyzed: saṃdarśane tu mām rājñaḥ sūtaputraḥ parāmṛśat
translated: But when I was in the king's presence, the charioteer's son seized me.

original: pātayitvā tu duṣṭātmā padāhaṃ tena tāḍitā
analyzed: pātayitvā tu duṣṭa ātmā padā aham tena tāḍitā
translated: And that evil-souled one, having thrown me down, kicked me with his foot.

original: prekṣate sma virāṭas tu kaṅkaś ca bahavo janāḥ
analyzed: prekṣate sma virāṭaḥ tu kaṅkaḥ ca bahavaḥ janāḥ
translated: Virāta saw it, and Kaṅka and many people,

original: rathinaḥ pīṭhamardāś ca hastyārohāś ca naigamāḥ
analyzed: rathinaḥ pīṭhamardāḥ ca hasti ārohāḥ ca naigamāḥ
translated: charioteers, foot-soldiers, elephant-riders and townsmen.

original: upālabdho mayā rājā kaṅkaś cāpi punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: upālabdhaḥ mayā rājā kaṅkaḥ ca api punar punar
translated: The king was reprimanded by me, and Kank also again and again.

original: tato na vārito rājñā na tasyāvinayaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: tatas na vāritaḥ rājñā na tasya avinayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then he was not restrained by the king, nor was any discourtesy shown to him.

original: yo 'yaṃ rājño virāṭasya kīcako nāma sārathiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ yam rājñaḥ virāṭasya kīcakaḥ nāma sārathiḥ
translated: This Kichaka, who is the charioteer of King Virata,

original: tyaktadharmā nṛśaṃsaś ca tarasvī saṃmataḥ priyaḥ
analyzed: tyakta dharmā nṛśaṃsaḥ ca tarasvī saṃmataḥ priyaḥ
translated: is one who has abandoned dharma, is cruel, impetuous, respected, and dear.

analyzed: śūraḥ bhimānī pāpa ātmā sarva artheṣu ca mugdhavān
translated: He is a hero, proud, evil-souled, and skilled in all matters.

analyzed: dāra āmarśī mahābhāga labhate ṛthān bahūn api
translated: He is one who lusts after others' wives, O greatly fortunate one, and obtains much wealth.

original: hared api ca vittāni pareṣāṃ krośatām api
analyzed: haret api ca vittāni pareṣām krośatām api
translated: He would even take away the wealth of others, even while they are crying out.

original: na tiṣṭhati sma sanmārge na ca dharmaṃ bubhūṣati
analyzed: na tiṣṭhati sma sat mārge na ca dharmam bubhūṣati
translated: He does not abide by the path of the good, nor does he desire dharma.

analyzed: pāpa ātmā pāpa bhāvaḥ ca kāma rāga vaśa anugaḥ
translated: He is evil-souled, of an evil disposition, and follows the sway of lust and passion.

original: avinītaś ca duṣṭātmā pratyākhyātaḥ punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: avinītaḥ ca duṣṭa ātmā pratyākhyātaḥ punar punar
translated: He is undisciplined, evil-minded, and repeatedly rejected.

original: darśane darśane hanyāt tathā jahyāṃ ca jīvitam
analyzed: darśane darśane hanyāt tathā jahyām ca jīvitam
translated: He would kill me at every meeting, and I would give up my life.

original: tad dharme yatamānānāṃ mahān dharmo naśiṣyati
analyzed: tat dharme yatamānānām mahān dharmaḥ naśiṣyati
translated: Then the great dharma of those striving for dharma will be destroyed.

original: samayaṃ rakṣamāṇānāṃ bhāryā vo na bhaviṣyati🔽bhāryāyāṃ rakṣyamāṇāyāṃ prajā bhavati rakṣitā
analyzed: samayam rakṣamāṇānām bhāryā vaḥ na bhaviṣyati  bhāryāyām rakṣyamāṇāyām prajā bhavati rakṣitā
translated: While protecting the agreement, you will not have a wife.🔽When the wife is protected, the offspring is protected.

analyzed: prajāyām rakṣyamāṇāyām ātmā bhavati rakṣitaḥ
translated: When the offspring is protected, the self is protected.

original: ātmā hi jāyate tasyāṃ tena jāyāṃ vidur budhāḥ
analyzed: ātmā hi jāyate tasyām tena jāyām viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The self is born from her, therefore the wise know her as the wife.

original: bhartā tu bhāryayā rakṣyaḥ kathaṃ jāyān mamodare
analyzed: bhartā tu bhāryayā rakṣyaḥ katham mama udare
translated: But how can the husband be protected by the wife, when he is born from my womb?

original: vadatāṃ varṇadharmāṃś ca brāhmaṇānāṃ hi me śrutam
analyzed: vadatām varṇa dharmān ca brāhmaṇānām hi me śrutam
translated: I have heard from the Brahmanas the duties of the different castes and the duties of the different stages of life.

analyzed: kṣatriyasya sadā dharmaḥ na anyaḥ śatru nibarhaṇāt
translated: For a Kshatriya there is no other duty than the destruction of enemies.

analyzed: paśyataḥ dharmarājasya kīcakaḥ mām padā avadhīt
translated: While Dharmaraja looked on, Kichaka kicked me with his foot.

original: yeṣāṃ matir na svapiti ṣaṣṭhe 'pi viṣaye vasan
analyzed: yeṣām matiḥ na svapiti ṣaṣṭhe viṣaye vasan
translated: Those whose minds do not sleep even when dwelling in the sixth heaven,

original: teṣāṃ māṃ māninīṃ bhāryāṃ sūtaputraḥ padāvadhīt
analyzed: teṣām mām māninīm bhāryām sūtaputraḥ padā avadhīt
translated: Their proud wife, me, was kicked by the son of a suta.

original: tava caiva samakṣaṃ vai bhīmasena mahābala
analyzed: tava ca eva samakṣam vai bhīmasena mahā bala
translated: And in your very presence, O Bhimasena of great strength,

original: tvayā hy ahaṃ paritrātā tasmād ghorāj jaṭāsurāt
analyzed: tvayā hi aham paritrātā tasmāt ghorāt jaṭāsurāt
translated: You saved me from that terrible demon Jatasura.

original: jayadrathaṃ tathaiva tvam ajaiṣīr bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
analyzed: jayadratham tathā eva tvam ajaiṣīḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
translated: And you defeated Jayadratha along with your brothers.

original: jahīmam api pāpaṃ tvaṃ yo 'yaṃ mām avamanyate
analyzed: jahi imam api pāpam tvam yaḥ yam mām avamanyate
translated: Destroy this sinner too, who insults me.

analyzed: kīcakaḥ rāja vāllabhyāt śoka kṛt mama bhārata
translated: Kichaka, through his favor with the king, is the cause of my sorrow, O Bharata.

original: tam evaṃ kāmasaṃmattaṃ bhindhi kumbham ivāśmani
analyzed: tam evam kāma saṃmattam bhindhi kumbham iva aśmani
translated: Crush him, who is intoxicated with lust, like an earthen pot against a stone.

original: yo nimittam anarthānāṃ bahūnāṃ mama bhārata
analyzed: yaḥ nimittam anarthānām bahūnām mama bhārata
translated: He is the cause of many misfortunes for me, O Bharata.

original: taṃ cej jīvantam ādityaḥ prātar abhyudayiṣyati
analyzed: tam ced jīvantam ādityaḥ prātar
translated: If the sun rises tomorrow morning and finds him alive,

original: viṣam āloḍya pāsyāmi mā kīcakavaśaṃ gamam
analyzed: viṣam āloḍya pāsyāmi mā kīcaka vaśam gamam
translated: I will mix poison and drink it, rather than come under Kichaka's control.

original: śreyo hi maraṇaṃ mahyaṃ bhīmasena tavāgrataḥ
analyzed: śreyaḥ hi maraṇam mahyam bhīmasena tava agratas
translated: O Bhimasena, it is better for me to die in front of you

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ity uktvā prārudat kṛṣṇā bhīmasyoraḥ samāśritā🔽bhīmaś ca tāṃ pariṣvajya mahat sāntvaṃ prayujya ca
analyzed: iti uktvā prārudat kṛṣṇā bhīmasya uraḥ samāśritā  bhīmaḥ ca tām pariṣvajya mahat sāntvam prayujya ca
translated: Having said this, Krishna, leaning on Bhimasena's chest, wept.🔽Bhimasena, embracing her and consoling her greatly,

original: āśvāsayitvā bahuśo bhṛśam ārtāṃ sumadhyamām🔽hetutattvārthasaṃyuktair vacobhir drupadātmajām
analyzed: āśvāsayitvā bahuśas bhṛśam ārtām sumadhyamām  hetu tattva artha saṃyuktaiḥ vacobhiḥ drupada ātmajām
translated: comforted the extremely distressed slender-waisted one in many ways.🔽With words full of reason and truth, to the daughter of Drupada,

analyzed: pramṛjya vadanam tasyāḥ pāṇinā aśru samākulam
translated: wiping her tear-filled face with his hand,

original: uvāca caināṃ duḥkhārtāṃ bhīmaḥ krodhavaśaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: uvāca ca enām duḥkha ārtām bhīmaḥ krodha vaśam gataḥ
translated: Bhima, overcome with anger, spoke to the distressed one,

analyzed: kīcakam manasā agacchat parisaṃlihan
translated: thinking of Kichaka, licking the corners of his mouth.

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhimasena said:

original: tathā bhadre kariṣyāmi yathā tvaṃ bhīru bhāṣase
analyzed: tathā bhadre kariṣyāmi yathā tvam bhīru bhāṣase
translated: O good lady, I will do as you say, O timid one.

analyzed: adya tam sūdayiṣyāmi kīcakam sahabāndhavam
translated: Today I will kill Kichaka along with his relatives.

analyzed: asyāḥ pradoṣe śarvaryāḥ kuruṣva anena saṃgamam
translated: At the end of this night, bring about his encounter with her.

original: duḥkhaṃ śokaṃ ca nirdhūya yājñaseni śucismite
analyzed: duḥkham śokam ca nirdhūya yājñaseni śuci smite
translated: O Yajnaseni, O one with a beautiful smile, casting off sorrow and grief,

analyzed: yā eṣā nartana śālā vai matsya rājena kāritā
translated: This dancing hall was built by the king of Matsya,

original: divātra kanyā nṛtyanti rātrau yānti yathāgṛham
analyzed: divā atra kanyāḥ nṛtyanti rātrau yānti yathāgṛham
translated: where the girls dance during the day and go home at night.

analyzed: tatra asti śayanam bhīru dṛḍha aṅgam su pratiṣṭhitam
translated: O timid one, there is a bed there, with strong limbs and well-established,

analyzed: tatra asya darśayiṣyāmi pūrvapretān pitāmahān
translated: where I will show you his former dead grandfathers.

analyzed: tvad darśana samutthena kāma rāgeṇa mohitam
translated: Deluded by the passion of love arising from seeing you,

analyzed: saṃketam sūtaputrasya kārayasva śubha ānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, make an appointment with the charioteer's son.

original: yathā ca tvāṃ na paśyeyuḥ kurvāṇāṃ tena saṃvidam
analyzed: yathā ca tvām na paśyeyuḥ kurvāṇām tena saṃvidam
translated: And so that no one sees you making an appointment with him,

analyzed: kuryāḥ tathā tvam kalyāṇi yathā saṃnihitaḥ bhavet
translated: O fortunate one, do it in such a way that he will be nearby.

original: āvayoḥ saṃgamaṃ bhīru yathā martyo na budhyati
analyzed: āvayoḥ saṃgamam bhīru yathā martyaḥ na budhyati
translated: O timid one, so that no mortal knows of our union,

analyzed: kīcakasya vināśasya tathā kuru nṛpa ātmaje
translated: O princess, act in such a way that the destruction of Kichaka may take place.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: evaṃ sā bhīru tanvaṅgī āmantryainaṃ mahānase
analyzed: evam sā bhīru tanvaṅgī āmantrya enam mahānase
translated: Thus addressed by him in the kitchen, the timid slender-bodied one,

analyzed: vadham tasya parīpsantī ājagāma sva veśmani
translated: desiring his death, went to her own house.

original: tathā tau kathayitvā tu bāṣpam utsṛjya duḥkhitau
analyzed: tathā tau kathayitvā tu bāṣpam utsṛjya duḥkhitau
translated: And having thus spoken to each other and shed tears in sorrow,

original: bhīmena ca pratijñāte kīcakasya vadhe tadā
analyzed: bhīmena ca pratijñāte kīcakasya vadhe tadā
translated: when Bhima had vowed to kill Kichaka,

original: draupadī ca sudeṣṇāyāḥ praviveśa punar gṛham
analyzed: draupadī ca sudeṣṇāyāḥ praviveśa punar gṛham
translated: Draupadi again entered the house of Sudeṣṇā.

original: rātriśeṣaṃ tad atyugraṃ dhārayām āsatur hṛdā
analyzed: rātri śeṣam tat ati ugram dhārayām āsatuḥ hṛdā
translated: They spent the rest of the terrible night with their hearts full of sorrow.

original: atha jñātvā virāṭo 'pi kṛṣṇāsakhyaṃ tu kīcakam
analyzed: atha jñātvā virāṭaḥ kṛṣṇā sakhyam tu kīcakam
translated: Then Virata, knowing that Kichaka was a friend of Krishna,

original: abravīt sa pratīhāraṃ dvāḥstha ānaya kīcakam
analyzed: abravīt sa pratīhāram dvāḥsthaḥ ānaya kīcakam
translated: said to the doorkeeper, Bring Kichaka here.

analyzed: prahitaḥ sa virāṭena dvāḥsthaḥ kīcaka mandiram
translated: Sent by Virata, the doorkeeper went to Kichaka's house

original: gatvā tam abravīt sūtaṃ matsyas tvāṃ draṣṭum icchati
analyzed: gatvā tam abravīt sūtam matsyaḥ tvām draṣṭum icchati
translated: and said to the suta, The Matsya king wishes to see you.

analyzed: kīcakaḥ pi nṛpa ādeśāt matsyasya bhavanam yayau
translated: Kichaka, on the king's orders, went to the palace of the Matsya king.

analyzed: uvāca matsya rājasya praṇipatya praviśya ca
translated: Having entered and bowed to the king of Matsya, he said:

analyzed: āgataḥ ham mahā rāja virāṭa vacanāt tava
translated: I have come, great king, at the command of Virata.

analyzed: virāṭaḥ uvāca
translated: Virata said:

original: vadasva yadi vaktavyaṃ śrutvā yāsyāmi vai gṛham
analyzed: vadasva yadi vaktavyam śrutvā yāsyāmi vai gṛham
translated: Speak if there is anything to be said. Having heard, I will go home.

original: kalatre vātha vā mitre bhṛtye rājñi yathāpi vā
analyzed: kalatre vā atha vā mitre bhṛtye rājñi yathā api vā
translated: Whether it concerns your wife, friend, servant, or king,

analyzed: nivedite sukhe duḥkhe sukham bhavati kīcaka
translated: when happiness or sorrow is reported, happiness results, O Kichaka.

original: tvam eva śaraṇaṃ mahyaṃ rājyaṃ ca tvatprasādataḥ
analyzed: tvam eva śaraṇam mahyam rājyam ca tvad prasādataḥ
translated: You alone are my refuge, and the kingdom is by your grace.

original: sakhā vāpi mamaiva tvaṃ tena tvāṃ pratipedire
analyzed: sakhā vā api mama eva tvam tena tvām pratipedire
translated: You are also my friend, therefore I have approached you.

original: paśyāmy aharniśaṃ duḥkhaṃ viparītaṃ tu maṇḍalam
analyzed: paśyāmi aharniśam duḥkham viparītam tu maṇḍalam
translated: Day and night I see misfortune, the reversal of the mandala.

original: sadhūmaṃ jvalanaṃ manye vaimanasyaṃ ca vājinām
analyzed: sa dhūmam jvalanam manye vaimanasyam ca vājinām
translated: I think the fire is smoky, and the horses are dispirited.

original: śṛṇomi ca śivāṃ ghorām aśivāṃ pratibhāṣiṇīm
analyzed: śṛṇomi ca śivām ghorām aśivām pratibhāṣiṇīm
translated: And I hear an inauspicious and terrible sound, which is not auspicious.

original: rātrau balibhujaḥ saṃghāñ channaṃ sūryasya maṇḍalam
analyzed: rātrau balibhujaḥ saṃghām channam sūryasya maṇḍalam
translated: At night, the flocks of crows caw, and the sun's orb is hidden.

original: anyac ca saṃprabhāṣante daivajñā mama kīcaka
analyzed: anyat ca saṃprabhāṣante daivajñāḥ mama kīcaka
translated: And the astrologers tell me something else, O Kichaka:

analyzed: mama dvādaśagaḥ sauriḥ janma ṛkṣe tava kīcaka
translated: Saturn is in my twelfth house, O Kichaka, and in your birth sign.

analyzed: paśyāmi harmya patanam kīcaka prāvṛṣam vinā
translated: I see a fall from the palace, O Kichaka, without the rainy season.

analyzed: jānāmi etaiḥ mahā utpātaiḥ yugānta pratimaiḥ alam
translated: I know that these great portents, equal to the end of the yuga, are enough.

original: mṛtyus te bhavitā tathyam atha vā mama kīcaka
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ te bhavitā tathyam atha vā mama kīcaka
translated: Your death will surely come, O Kichaka, or mine.

analyzed: śṛṇomi vīra sairandhryāḥ śūrāḥ sāhasa kāriṇaḥ
translated: I hear, O hero, that the Sairandhri has five heroic and rash husbands,

analyzed: gandharvāḥ patayaḥ pañca santi deva indra vallabhāḥ
translated: who are Gandharvas, dear to the king of the gods.

original: muninā kena cic chaptāś carantīmāṃ vasuṃdharām
analyzed: muninā kena cit śaptāḥ caranti imām vasuṃdharām
translated: They are wandering on this earth, cursed by some sage,

original: rakṣamāṇāś ca sairandhrīṃ bhāryāṃ svīyāṃ pativratām🔽teṣāṃ nu bhāryā tvaṃ vatsa sairandhrīṃ kartum icchasi
analyzed: rakṣamāṇāḥ ca sairandhrīm bhāryām svīyām pativratām  teṣām nu bhāryā tvam vatsa sairandhrīm kartum icchasi
translated: protecting the Sairandhri, their own faithful wife.🔽O child, you wish to make her your wife, the wife of those Gandharvas.

original: na ca śaktā tvayā bhoktum eṣā gandharvarakṣitā
analyzed: na ca śaktā tvayā bhoktum eṣā gandharva rakṣitā
translated: And you are not able to enjoy her, protected as she is by the Gandharvas.

original: tvaṃ vātīva kāmārtaḥ kāryam etan na budhyase
analyzed: tvam vā atīva kāma ārtaḥ kāryam etat na budhyase
translated: Or are you extremely afflicted by desire and do not understand this matter?

original: vidyutpātair imaiḥ saumya martavyaṃ bhavatā dhruvam
analyzed: vidyut pātaiḥ imaiḥ saumya martavyam bhavatā dhruvam
translated: O gentle one, it is certain that you will have to die by these lightning strikes.

original: kānyā caivaṃvidhā nārī cared vai kṣitimaṇḍale
analyzed: kā anyā ca evaṃvidhā nārī caret vai kṣiti maṇḍale
translated: What other woman like this would roam the earth?

analyzed: vinā sairandhrīm bhadram te svayam gandharva rakṣitām
translated: Except for the sairandhri herself, who is protected by the gandharvas, may you be fortunate.

original: vṛddho vā yadi vā svāmī yadi vā bhaginīpatiḥ
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ vā yadi vā svāmī yadi vā bhaginī patiḥ
translated: Whether he is old, or the master, or the brother-in-law,

analyzed: rājā pūjyaḥ sadā mānyaḥ kartavyam vacanam mama
translated: the king is always to be worshipped and respected. My words should be done.

analyzed: kaikeya putra tad mātrām tyaja sairandhri jām kathām
translated: O son of Kaikeyi, abandon this talk of the sairandhri.

analyzed: kṛtyā eṣā mahatī bhāti rūpeṇa atīva kīcaka
translated: This great deed shines with beauty, O Kichaka.

original: tyaktvā kāmaṃ sairandhryāṃ tvaṃ madīyāṃ dhvajinīṃ bhavān
analyzed: tyaktvā kāmam sairandhryām tvam madīyām dhvajinīm bhavān
translated: Abandoning desire for the sairandhri, you should join my army.

analyzed: kīcakaḥ uvāca
translated: Kichaka said:

analyzed: saṃpālayasva viśrabdhaḥ mad vākyāt kaikaya ātmaja
translated: O son of Kaikeyi, protect yourself with confidence at my word.

original: sarvathā bhavadīyaṃ me kartavyaṃ vacanaṃ tathā
analyzed: sarvathā bhavadīyam me kartavyam vacanam tathā
translated: In every way, your words should be done by me.

analyzed: tathā api eṣā mayā avaśyam bhoktavyā tanu madhyamā
translated: Nevertheless, this slender-waisted one must certainly be enjoyed by me.

original: sairandhrī yadi me pārśve śliṣṭā snehena bhāminī
analyzed: sairandhrī yadi me pārśve śliṣṭā snehena bhāminī
translated: If the beautiful sairandhri does not lie with me out of affection,

original: śete na śayane matsya tadā manye mṛtaṃ svayam
analyzed: śete na śayane matsya tadā manye mṛtam svayam
translated: then, O Matsya, I consider myself dead.

original: bādhate māṃ bhṛśaṃ kāmaḥ sairandhryarthaṃ narādhipa
analyzed: bādhate mām bhṛśam kāmaḥ sairandhrī artham narādhipa
translated: O lord of men, desire for the Sairandhri is tormenting me greatly.

original: jīvitaṃ tṛṇavat tyaktvā bhoktavyā hi mayā śubhā
analyzed: jīvitam tṛṇa vat tyaktvā bhoktavyā hi mayā śubhā
translated: Abandoning life like a straw, I must enjoy that beautiful one.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: na stokam api gandharvā mayi śaktā viśāṃ pate🔽sa manmathārto nṛpatiṃ gatas tu
analyzed: na stokam api gandharvāḥ mayi śaktāḥ viśām pate  sa manmatha ārtaḥ nṛpatim gataḥ tu
translated: O lord of the people, the Gandharvas have no power over me, not even a little.🔽But the king, afflicted by passion, went to the king,

analyzed: tyaktvā tu vākyam nṛpateḥ narendra
translated: and disregarding the king's words, O lord of men,

analyzed: saṃyogam icchan drupada ātmajāyāḥ
translated: desiring union with Drupada's daughter,

analyzed: saṃdhāyamānaḥ viditam sa mṛtyum
translated: though knowing that it would lead to his death,

original: tasyāṃ rātryāṃ vyatītāyāṃ prātar utthāya kīcakaḥ
analyzed: tasyām rātryām vyatītāyām prātar utthāya kīcakaḥ
translated: When that night had passed, in the morning Kichaka got up

analyzed: gatvā rāja kulāya eva draupadīm idam abravīt
translated: and went to the royal palace and said this to Draupadi:

analyzed: sabhāyām paśyataḥ rājñaḥ pātayitvā padā ahanam
translated: Having kicked you with my foot in the assembly hall while the king was looking on,🔽and you being overpowered by the stronger one,

analyzed: na ca eva alabhathāḥ trāṇam abhipannā balīyasā

original: pravādena hi matsyānāṃ rājā nāmnāyam ucyate
analyzed: pravādena hi matsyānām rājā nāmnā ayam ucyate

analyzed: aham eva hi matsyānām rājā vai vāhinīpatiḥ
translated: I alone am the king of the Matsyas, the commander of the army.

original: sā sukhaṃ pratipadyasva dāso bhīru bhavāmi te
analyzed: sā sukham pratipadyasva dāsaḥ bhīru bhavāmi te
translated: O timid one, accept me happily, I will be your slave.

analyzed: na hi aham tvām ṛte bhīru ciram jīvitum utsahe
translated: For I cannot bear to live long without you, O timid one.

analyzed: ahnāya tava su śroṇi śatam niṣkān dadāmi aham

original: dāsīśataṃ ca te dadyāṃ dāsānām api cāparam
analyzed: dāsī śatam ca te dadyām dāsānām api ca aparam
translated: I will give you a hundred female slaves and another set of male slaves,

analyzed: ratham ca aśvatarī yuktam astu nau bhīru saṃgamaḥ
translated: and a chariot yoked with mules. Let there be a meeting between us, timid one.

original: tubhyaṃ dāsyāmi sarvāṇi rājārhāṇy aparāṇi ca
analyzed: tubhyam dāsyāmi sarvāṇi rāja arhāṇi aparāṇi ca
translated: I will give you all the other royal possessions.

analyzed: draupadī uvāca
translated: Draupadi said:

original: ekaṃ me samayaṃ tv adya pratipadyasva kīcaka
analyzed: ekam me samayam tu adya pratipadyasva kīcaka
translated: But today accept one condition from me, Kichaka,

original: yadi tvaṃ khalu saṃyogam icchasy adya mayā saha
analyzed: yadi tvam khalu saṃyogam icchasi adya mayā saha
translated: if you indeed desire union with me today.
