original: santītare janapadā ye pārthān veṣibhir nṛpa
analyzed: santi itare janapadāḥ ye pārthān veṣibhiḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, there are other countries where the Parthas may be.

analyzed: pravicitāḥ te hi asmābhiḥ pṛthivī maṇḍale khile
translated: They have all been searched by us in the entire circle of the earth.

original: na tatra pāṇḍavā rājan nāpi kṛṣṇā pativratā
analyzed: na tatra pāṇḍavāḥ rājan na api kṛṣṇā pativratā
translated: There the Pandavas are not, O king, nor is Krishna, devoted to her husband.

original: naradeva yathoddiṣṭaṃ naiva vidma ca pāṇḍavān
analyzed: naradeva yathā uddiṣṭam na eva vidma ca pāṇḍavān
translated: O lord of men, as instructed, we do not know the Pandavas at all.

original: nirvṛto bhava naṣṭās te svastho bhava paraṃtapa
analyzed: nirvṛtaḥ bhava naṣṭāḥ te svasthaḥ bhava paraṃtapa
translated: Be relieved, they are lost. Be at ease, O scorcher of enemies.

original: sarvathā vipranaṣṭās te namas te bharatarṣabha
analyzed: sarvathā vipranaṣṭāḥ te namaḥ te bharata ṛṣabha
translated: In every way, they are completely lost. Salutations to you, O bull among the Bharata lineage.

original: na hi vidmo gatiṃ teṣāṃ vāsaṃ vāpi mahātmanām
analyzed: na hi vidmaḥ gatim teṣām vāsam vā api mahātmanām
translated: We do not know their destination or abode, of those great souls.

original: pāṇḍavānāṃ pravṛttiṃ vā vidmaḥ karmāpi vā kṛtam🔽sarvā ca pṛthivī kṛtsnā saśailavanakānanā
analyzed: pāṇḍavānām pravṛttim vā vidmaḥ karma api vā kṛtam  sarvā ca pṛthivī kṛtsnā sa śaila vana kānanā
translated: We do not know the whereabouts or deeds of the Pandavas.🔽The entire earth, with its mountains, forests, and groves,

analyzed: sa rāṣṭra nagara grāmā pattanaiḥ ca samanvitā
translated: Along with its kingdoms, cities, villages, and towns,

original: anveṣitā ca tatsarvaṃ na ca paśyāma pāṇḍavān
analyzed: anveṣitā ca tat sarvam na ca paśyāma pāṇḍavān
translated: Has all been searched, but we do not see the Pandavas.

original: sa naḥ śādhi manuṣyendra ata ūrdhvaṃ viśāṃ pate
analyzed: sa naḥ śādhi manuṣya indra atas ūrdhvam viśām pate
translated: O lord of men, instruct us further, O lord of the people.

analyzed: anveṣaṇe pāṇḍavānām bhūyas kim karavāmahe
translated: What else should we do in searching for the Pandavas?

original: imāṃ ca naḥ priyām īkṣa vācaṃ bhadravatīṃ śubhām
analyzed: imām ca naḥ priyām īkṣa vācam bhadravatīm śubhām
translated: Listen to these beloved words of ours, auspicious and fortunate,

original: yena trigartā nikṛtā balena mahatā nṛpa
analyzed: yena trigartāḥ nikṛtāḥ balena mahatā nṛpa
translated: By which the Trigartas were defeated, O king, with a great army,

analyzed: sūtena rājñaḥ matsyasya kīcakena mahātmanā
translated: By the charioteer of King Matsya, the great-souled Kichaka.

original: sa hataḥ patitaḥ śete gandharvair niśi bhārata
analyzed: sa hataḥ patitaḥ śete gandharvaiḥ niśi bhārata
translated: He was killed and fell down, and lies there at night, O descendant of Bharata, struck down by the Gandharvas.

analyzed: syālaḥ rājñaḥ virāṭasya senāpatiḥ udāra dhīḥ
translated: Syalaka, the commander of King Virata, of noble mind,

original: sudeṣṇāyā mahāñ jyeṣṭhaḥ śūro vīro gatavyathaḥ
analyzed: sudeṣṇāyāḥ mahān jyeṣṭhaḥ śūraḥ vīraḥ gata vyathaḥ
translated: The eldest son of Sudeshna, the hero, the warrior, the fearless one,

original: utsāhavān mahāvīryo nītimān balavān api🔽yuddhajño ripuvīraghnaḥ siṃhatulyaparākramaḥ
analyzed: utsāhavān mahā vīryaḥ nītimān balavān api
translated: Full of enthusiasm, of great valor, of good policy, and also strong,🔽Knowledgeable in battle, the slayer of enemy heroes, with prowess equal to that of a lion,

original: prajārakṣaṇadakṣaś ca śatrugrahaṇaśaktimān🔽vijitārir mahāyuddhe pracaṇḍo mānatatparaḥ
analyzed: prajā rakṣaṇa dakṣaḥ ca śatru grahaṇa śaktimān  vijita ariḥ mahā yuddhe pracaṇḍaḥ māna tatparaḥ
translated: Skilled in protecting the people, and capable of capturing enemies,🔽The conqueror of enemies in great battles, fierce, and proud,
Charming the minds of men and women, patient, eloquent, and fond of battle,

analyzed: puṇya dharma artha kāmānām bhājanam manuja uttamaḥ
translated: The best of men, a vessel for merit, Dharma, wealth, and desire,

original: sa hato niśi gandharvaiḥ strīnimittaṃ narādhipa
analyzed: sa hataḥ niśi gandharvaiḥ strī nimittam narādhipa
translated: He was killed at night by the Gandharvas, O lord of men, for the sake of a woman.

original: gandharvāṇāṃ ca mahiṣī kā cid asti nitambinī
analyzed: gandharvāṇām ca mahiṣī kā cit asti nitambinī
translated: And there was a certain voluptuous queen of the Gandharvas,

original: sairandhrī nāma tāṃ dṛpto duṣṭātmākāmayad balī
analyzed: sairandhrī nāma tām dṛptaḥ duṣṭa ātmā akāmayat balī
translated: The powerful and wicked-minded one desired her, named Sairandhri.

analyzed: adṛśyamānaiḥ duṣṭa ātmā saha bhrātṛbhiḥ acyuta
translated: The wicked-minded one, O Achyuta, with his brothers unseen,

original: suhṛdāś cātra nihatā yodhāś ca pravarā hatāḥ
analyzed: suhṛdāḥ ca atra nihatāḥ yodhāḥ ca pravarāḥ hatāḥ
translated: And here his friends were killed, and the best warriors were slain.

original: ity evaṃ śrutam asmābhir gandharvair nihato niśi
analyzed: iti evam śrutam asmābhiḥ gandharvaiḥ nihataḥ niśi
translated: Thus we have heard that he was killed at night by the Gandharvas.

analyzed: bāndhavaiḥ bahubhiḥ sārdham kīcakaḥ nihataḥ bhavat
translated: Kichaka was killed along with many relatives.

analyzed: adya prabhṛti rāja indra pāṇḍava anveṣaṇam prati
translated: From today onwards, O lord of kings, in search of the Pandavas,

original: cārāṃs tān sarvataś cartuṃ preṣayeti matir hi naḥ
analyzed: cārān tān sarvatas cartum preṣaya iti matiḥ hi naḥ
translated: We think it is best to send spies in all directions to search for them.

original: nihato niśi gandharvair duṣṭātmā bhrātṛbhiḥ saha🔽priyam etad upaśrutya śatrūṇāṃ tu parābhavam
analyzed: nihataḥ niśi gandharvaiḥ duṣṭa ātmā bhrātṛbhiḥ saha  priyam etat upaśrutya śatrūṇām tu parābhavam
translated: The wicked-souled one, along with his brothers, was killed at night by the Gandharvas.🔽Having heard this pleasant news of the defeat of our enemies,

original: etāvac chrutam asmābhir bhadraṃ te 'stu narādhipa
analyzed: etāvat śrutam asmābhiḥ bhadram te stu narādhipa
translated: we have heard this much, may you fare well, O lord of men.

original: kṛtakṛtyaś ca kauravya vidhatsva yad anantaram
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaḥ ca kauravya vidhatsva yat anantaram
translated: O Kouravya, you have accomplished your purpose, now do what comes next.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tato duryodhano rājā śrutvā teṣāṃ vacas tadā
analyzed: tatas duryodhanaḥ rājā śrutvā teṣām vacaḥ tadā
translated: Then King Duryodhana, having heard their words,

analyzed: ciram antarmanāḥ bhūtvā pratyuvāca sabhāsadaḥ
translated: remained silent for a long time and then replied to the courtiers:

analyzed: jānan api mahā rāja sa śalyena antarātmanā
translated: O great king, although he knew, with a wounded heart,

original: kīcakasya vadhaṃ śrutvā na cākāram adarśayat
analyzed: kīcakasya vadham śrutvā na ca ākāram adarśayat
translated: having heard of Kichaka's death, he did not show any reaction.

original: kevalaṃ śauryam ālambya gatasattva iva śvasan
analyzed: kevalam śauryam ālambya gata sattvaḥ iva śvasan
translated: Only relying on his bravery, breathing like one bereft of spirit,

analyzed: bhūyas pratyāgata prāṇaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭra ātmajaḥ balī
translated: the powerful son of Dhritarashtra, his life seemingly gone,

original: śrutvā teṣāṃ vacas tāvac cintayām āsa kauravaḥ
analyzed: śrutvā teṣām vacaḥ tāvat cintayām āsa kauravaḥ
translated: having heard their words, the Kourava began to think:

original: suduḥkhā khalu kāryāṇāṃ gatir vijñātum antataḥ
analyzed: su duḥkhā khalu kāryāṇām gatiḥ vijñātum antatas
translated: The course of events is indeed very difficult to understand in the end.

original: tasmāt sarve udīkṣadhvaṃ kva nu syuḥ pāṇḍavā gatāḥ
analyzed: tasmāt sarve udīkṣadhvam kva nu syuḥ pāṇḍavāḥ gatāḥ
translated: Therefore, all of you look out for where the Pandavas have gone.

analyzed: alpa avaśiṣṭam kālasya gata bhūyiṣṭham antatas
translated: There is little time left, almost the end of the year,

analyzed: teṣām ajñāta caryāyām asmin varṣe trayodaśe
translated: In the thirteenth year of their unknown life,

original: asya varṣasya śeṣaṃ ced vyatīyur iha pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: asya varṣasya śeṣam ced vyatīyuḥ iha pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: If the Pandavas spend the rest of this year here,

analyzed: nivṛtta samayāḥ te hi satya vrata parāyaṇāḥ
translated: They will have completed their time, devoted to the vow of truth,

analyzed: kṣarantaḥ iva nāga indrāḥ sarve āśīviṣa upamāḥ
translated: Like the best of elephants in rut, all of them like venomous serpents,

original: duḥkhā bhaveyuḥ saṃrabdhāḥ kauravān prati te dhruvam🔽vijñātavyā manuṣyendrās tarkayā supraṇītayā
analyzed: duḥkhāḥ bhaveyuḥ saṃrabdhāḥ kauravān prati te dhruvam  vijñātavyāḥ manuṣya indrāḥ tarkayā su praṇītayā
translated: They will certainly become angry and miserable towards the Kauravas.🔽They should be known as the lords of men by means of well-reasoned inference,

analyzed: nipuṇaiḥ cāra puruṣaiḥ prājñaiḥ dakṣaiḥ su saṃvṛtaiḥ
translated: By skillful and wise spies, well-guarded,

analyzed: arvāk kālasya vijñātāḥ kṛcchra rūpa dharāḥ punar
translated: Known before time, again assuming difficult forms,

original: praviśeyur jitakrodhās tāvad eva punar vanam
analyzed: praviśeyuḥ jita krodhāḥ tāvat eva punar vanam
translated: They will enter the forest again, their anger conquered.

original: tasmāt kṣipraṃ bubhutsadhvaṃ yathā no 'tyantam avyayam
analyzed: tasmāt kṣipram bubhutsadhvam yathā no tyantam avyayam
translated: Therefore, quickly find out how we may not be completely destroyed,

original: rājyaṃ nirdvandvam avyagraṃ niḥsapatnaṃ ciraṃ bhavet
analyzed: rājyam nirdvandvam avyagram niḥsapatnam ciram bhavet
translated: How the kingdom may be without conflict, without anxiety, without rivals, and last long.

original: athābravīt tataḥ karṇaḥ kṣipraṃ gacchantu bhārata
analyzed: atha abravīt tatas karṇaḥ kṣipram gacchantu bhārata
translated: Then Karna said, O descendant of Bharata, let them go quickly,

analyzed: satya dharma artha saṃyutam
translated: Endowed with truth, righteousness and wealth.

analyzed: karṇaḥ
translated: Karna said:

analyzed: ete punar na gacchantu
translated: Let these not go again,

analyzed: anye dhūrtatarāḥ dakṣāḥ nibhṛtāḥ sādhu kāriṇaḥ
translated: Others are more cunning, skilled, discreet and virtuous.

analyzed: duryodhanena evam ukte vacane tīva duḥkhinā
translated: When these words were spoken by Duryodhana, who was extremely unhappy,

analyzed: carantu deśān saṃvītāḥ sphītām janapada ākulān
translated: Let them roam the prosperous countries, crowded with people,

original: tatra goṣṭhīṣv athānyāsu siddhapravrajiteṣu ca🔽paricāreṣu tīrtheṣu grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca
analyzed: tatra goṣṭhīṣu atha anyāsu siddha pravrajiteṣu ca  paricāreṣu tīrtheṣu grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca
translated: In assemblies, in other places, among accomplished mendicants,🔽In services, in holy places, in villages and cities,

original: paricāreṣu tīrtheṣu vividheṣv ākareṣu ca🔽vijñātavyā manuṣyais tais tarkayā suvinītayā
analyzed: paricāreṣu tīrtheṣu vividheṣu ākareṣu ca  vijñātavyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ taiḥ tarkayā su vinītayā
translated: In services, in various holy places, in various mines,🔽They should be sought out by those men with well-trained reasoning.

analyzed: vividhaiḥ tad paraiḥ samyak tad jñaiḥ nipuṇa saṃvṛtaiḥ
translated: By various devoted people, by those who know that, by those who are skilled and discreet,

analyzed: anveṣṭavyāḥ ca nipuṇam pāṇḍavāḥ channa vāsinaḥ
translated: The Pandavas, who are living in disguise, should be carefully sought out.

analyzed: nadī kuñjeṣu tīrtheṣu grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca
translated: In the groves by the rivers, in holy places, in villages and cities,

original: āśrameṣu ca ramyeṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca
analyzed: āśrameṣu ca ramyeṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca
translated: In beautiful hermitages, on mountains and in caves,

analyzed: atha agraja anantara jaḥ pāpa bhāva anurāgiṇam
translated: Then the younger brother, who was attached to evil ways,

original: jyeṣṭhaṃ duḥśāsanas tatra bhrātā bhrātaram abravīt
analyzed: jyeṣṭham duḥśāsanaḥ tatra bhrātā bhrātaram abravīt
translated: Dushasana, the elder brother, spoke to his brother there:

original: yeṣu naḥ pratyayo rājaṃś cāreṣu manujādhipa
analyzed: yeṣu naḥ pratyayaḥ rājan cāreṣu manuja adhipa
translated: O king, O lord of men, in those spies whom we trust,

original: te yāntu dattadeyā vai bhūyas tān parimārgitum
analyzed: te yāntu datta deyāḥ vai bhūyas tān parimārgitum
translated: Let them go again, after giving them gifts, to search for them.

analyzed: tān aham preṣayiṣyāmi yatantaḥ dṛḍha bhaktayaḥ
translated: I will send them, striving with firm devotion.

analyzed: etat matam mahā rāja madīyam priya darśana
translated: O great king, this is my opinion, O you of pleasant appearance.

analyzed: apare tatra gacchantu carāḥ pracchanna cāriṇaḥ
translated: Let others go there, spies moving in disguise.

original: etac ca karṇo yat prāha sarvam īkṣāmahe tathā
analyzed: etat ca karṇaḥ yat prāha sarvam īkṣāmahe tathā
translated: And all that Karna has said, we shall see to it.

original: ghrāṇaiḥ paśyanti paśavo vedaiḥ paśyanti brāhmaṇāḥ
analyzed: ghrāṇaiḥ paśyanti paśavaḥ vedaiḥ paśyanti brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Animals see with their noses, Brahmins see with the Vedas,

original: cāraiḥ paśyanti rājānaś cakṣurbhyām itare janāḥ
analyzed: cāraiḥ paśyanti rājānaḥ cakṣurbhyām itare janāḥ
translated: Kings see with spies, and other people with their eyes.

original: yathoddiṣṭaṃ carāḥ sarve mṛgayantu tatas tataḥ
analyzed: yathoddiṣṭam carāḥ sarve mṛgayantu tatas tatas
translated: Let all the spies search everywhere, as directed.

original: ete cānye ca bhūyāṃso deśād deśaṃ yathāvidhi
analyzed: ete ca anye ca bhūyāṃsaḥ deśāt deśam yathāvidhi
translated: These and many others, from country to country, as prescribed.

original: na tu teṣāṃ gatir vāsaḥ pravṛttiś copalabhyate🔽atyāhitaṃ vā gūḍhās te pāraṃ vormimato gatāḥ
analyzed: na tu teṣām gatiḥ vāsaḥ pravṛttiḥ ca upalabhyate  atyāhitam vā gūḍhāḥ te pāram vā ūrmimataḥ gatāḥ
translated: But their course, dwelling, and activity are not found.🔽Or perhaps they have gone to a distant shore, hidden, or beyond the ocean.

original: pratyāhartuṃ ca mūḍhās te pathi nāśam ato gatāḥ
analyzed: pratyāhartum ca mūḍhāḥ te pathi nāśam atas gatāḥ
translated: Or perhaps the foolish ones, trying to return, have perished on the way.

analyzed: vyālaiḥ vā api mahā araṇye bhakṣitāḥ śūra māninaḥ
translated: Or perhaps the self-conceited ones have been devoured by beasts in the great forest.

original: dvīpaṃ vā paramaṃ prāptā giridurgaṃ vanāni vā
analyzed: dvīpam vā paramam prāptāḥ giri durgam vanāni vā
translated: Or perhaps they have reached a distant island, a mountain fortress, or the forest.

original: hīnadarpā nirāśās te bhakṣitā vāpi rākṣasaiḥ
analyzed: hīna darpāḥ nirāśāḥ te bhakṣitāḥ vā api rākṣasaiḥ
translated: Or perhaps they have lost their pride, are hopeless, and have been devoured by demons.

original: atha vā viṣamaṃ prāpya vinaṣṭāḥ śāśvatīḥ samāḥ
analyzed: atha vā viṣamam prāpya vinaṣṭāḥ śāśvatīḥ samāḥ
translated: Or perhaps, having reached a difficult place, they have perished for all time.

original: tasmān mānasam avyagraṃ kṛtvā tvaṃ kurunandana
analyzed: tasmāt mānasam avyagram kṛtvā tvam kuru nandana
translated: Therefore, O descendant of Kuru, keeping your mind steady,

original: kuru kāryaṃ yathotsāhaṃ manyase yan narādhipa
analyzed: kuru kāryam yathā utsāham manyase yat narādhipa
translated: do what you think fit with all your might, O lord of men.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: athā bravīt mahā vīryaḥ droṇaḥ tattva artha darśivān
translated: Then the greatly powerful Drona, who saw the truth, said:

original: na tādṛśā vinaśyanti nāpi yānti parābhavam
analyzed: na tādṛśāḥ vinaśyanti na api yānti parābhavam
translated: Such men do not perish nor are they defeated.

original: śūrāś ca kṛtavidyāś ca buddhimanto jitendriyāḥ🔽dharmajñāś ca kṛtajñāś ca dharmarājam anuvratāḥ
analyzed: śūrāḥ ca kṛtavidyāḥ ca buddhimantaḥ jita indriyāḥ  dharma jñāḥ ca kṛtajñāḥ ca dharmarājam anuvratāḥ
translated: They are heroes, learned, wise, and self-controlled,🔽knowers of dharma, grateful, devoted to Dharmaraja.

analyzed: nīti dharma artha tattva jñam pitṛ vat ca samāhitam
translated: Knowing the truth of policy, dharma and artha, and devoted like a father,

analyzed: dharme sthitam satya dhṛtim jyeṣṭham jyeṣṭha apacāyinam
translated: steadfast in dharma, truthful, the eldest, who respects the eldest,

analyzed: anuvratāḥ mahātmānam bhrātaram bhrātaraḥ nṛpa
translated: his brothers are devoted to that great-souled king.🔽The humble, the self-controlled, the great-souled,

original: ajātaśatruṃ hrīmantaṃ taṃ ca bhrātṝn anuvratam🔽teṣāṃ tathā vidheyānāṃ nibhṛtānāṃ mahātmanām
analyzed: ajātaśatrum hrīmantam tam ca bhrātṝn anuvratam  teṣām tathā vidheyānām nibhṛtānām mahātmanām
translated: the unvanquished, the modest, and those devoted to their brother,🔽how can such men be destroyed?🔽How can they be defeated?

original: kimarthaṃ nītimān pārthaḥ śreyo naiṣāṃ kariṣyati
analyzed: kimartham nītimān pārthaḥ śreyaḥ na eṣām kariṣyati
translated: How can the wise Partha not bring about their welfare?

analyzed: tasmāt yatnāt pratīkṣante kālasya udayam āgatam
translated: Therefore, they are waiting with care for the rise of time,

original: na hi te nāśam ṛccheyur iti paśyāmy ahaṃ dhiyā
analyzed: na hi te nāśam ṛccheyuḥ iti paśyāmi aham dhiyā
translated: for I see with my mind that they will not meet with destruction.

original: sāṃprataṃ caiva yat kāryaṃ tac ca kṣipram akālikam
analyzed: sāṃpratam ca eva yat kāryam tat ca kṣipram akālikam
translated: And whatever needs to be done now, that too should be done quickly and without delay.

original: kriyatāṃ sādhu saṃcintya vāsaś caiṣāṃ pracintyatām🔽tathābhivādinaṃ matsyaṃ kauraveyāḥ pṛthak pṛthak
analyzed: kriyatām sādhu saṃcintya vāsaḥ ca eṣām pracintyatām  tathā abhivādinam matsyam kauraveyāḥ pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Having carefully considered this, let them be given proper shelter.

analyzed: ūcuḥ prāñjalayaḥ sarve yudhiṣṭhira purogamāḥ
translated: The Kauravas, with Yudhishthira at the forefront, all spoke with folded hands to the king of Matsya, who was thus greeting them.

original: pratinandāma te vākyaṃ sarva eva viśāṃ pate
analyzed: pratinandāma te vākyam sarve eva viśām pate
translated: We all welcome your words, O lord of the people,

analyzed: yathāvat pāṇḍu putrāṇām sarva artheṣu dhṛta ātmanām
translated: as befits the sons of Pandu, who are steadfast in all matters.

analyzed: pravṛttiḥ upalabhyeta tathā nītiḥ vidhīyatām
translated: Let policy be devised so that their activities may be discerned.

original: sarvopāyair yatasva tvaṃ yathā paśyasi pāṇḍavān
analyzed: sarva upāyaiḥ yatasva tvam yathā paśyasi pāṇḍavān
translated: Strive by all means so that you may see the Pandavas.

original: durjñeyāḥ khalu śūrās te apāpās tapasā vṛtāḥ
analyzed: durjñeyāḥ khalu śūrāḥ te apāpāḥ tapasā vṛtāḥ
translated: Indeed, they are difficult to recognize, being heroes, sinless, and surrounded by ascetics.

original: śuddhātmā guṇavān pārthaḥ satyavān nītimāñ śuciḥ
analyzed: śuddha ātmā guṇavān pārthaḥ satyavān nītimān śuciḥ
translated: Partha has a pure soul, is virtuous, truthful, wise, and pure.

analyzed: tejaḥ rāśiḥ asaṃkhyeyaḥ gṛhṇīyāt api cakṣuṣī
translated: He is an immeasurable mass of energy, and could even take away one's eyes.

original: vijñāya kriyatāṃ tasmād bhūyaś ca mṛgayāmahe
analyzed: vijñāya kriyatām tasmāt bhūyas ca mṛgayāmahe
translated: Therefore, having ascertained this, let us search for them again.

original: brāhmaṇaiś cārakaiḥ siddhair ye cānye tadvido janāḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ cārakaiḥ siddhaiḥ ye ca anye tad vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: With Brahmins, spies, accomplished ones, and other people who know about them.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: tatas śāṃtanavaḥ bhīṣmaḥ bharatānām pitāmahaḥ
translated: Then Shantanu's son Bhishma, the grandfather of the Bharatas,

analyzed: śrutavān deśa kāla jñaḥ tattva jñaḥ sarva dharma vid
translated: He was learned, knew the right time and place, knew the truth, and knew all about dharma.

analyzed: ācārya vākya uparame tat vākyam abhisaṃdadhat
translated: When the teacher's words ceased, he remembered those words.

original: hitārthaṃ sa uvācemāṃ bhāratīṃ bhāratān prati
analyzed: hita artham saḥ uvāca imām bhāratīm bhāratān prati
translated: For the sake of their welfare, he spoke this speech in Sanskrit to the Bharatas.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhire samāsaktām dharma jñe dharma saṃśritām
translated: To Yudhishthira, who was devoted to dharma and knew dharma,

original: pāṇḍave nityam avyagrāṃ giraṃ bhīṣmaḥ samādade
analyzed: pāṇḍave nityam avyagrām giram bhīṣmaḥ samādade
translated: Bhishma spoke these words, which were always relevant to the Pandavas.

original: asatsu durlabhāṃ nityaṃ satāṃ cābhimatāṃ sadā
analyzed: asatsu durlabhām nityam satām ca abhimatām sadā
translated: Which is always difficult to find among the wicked, and is always approved by the virtuous,

original: bhīṣmaḥ samavadat tatra giraṃ sādhubhir arcitām
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ samavadat tatra giram sādhubhiḥ arcitām
translated: Bhishma spoke there those words which are revered by the righteous.

analyzed: yathā eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ prāha droṇaḥ sarva artha tattva vid
translated: Just as this brahmin Drona, who knows the truth about everything, has said,

original: tad vākyam abhinandāmi na me 'sty atra vicāraṇā
analyzed: tat vākyam abhinandāmi na me sti atra vicāraṇā
translated: I approve of those words, I have no doubt about it.

analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam tathā eva etat bhūyas ca enām vibodhata
translated: Without doubt, it is just so, understand it again and again.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpannāḥ nāśam na arhanti pāṇḍavāḥ  śruta vṛtta upasaṃpannāḥ sādhu vrata samanvitāḥ
translated: The Pandavas, who are endowed with all good qualities, do not deserve destruction.🔽They are endowed with learning and good conduct, and are devoted to the vows of the virtuous.

analyzed: vṛddha anuśāsane magnāḥ satya vrata parāyaṇāḥ
translated: They are immersed in the instructions of the elders, and are devoted to the vow of truth.

analyzed: samayam samaya jñāḥ te pālayantaḥ śuci vratāḥ
translated: Knowing the right time, they are observing the agreement, with pure vows.

analyzed: na avasīditum arhanti udvahantaḥ satām dhuram
translated: Bearing the burden of the virtuous, they do not deserve to perish.

analyzed: kṣatra dharma ratāḥ nityam keśava anugatāḥ sadā
translated: Always devoted to the duties of a Kshatriya and always following Keshava,

analyzed: pravīra puruṣāḥ te vai mahātmānaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: those foremost of men, those high-souled and mighty ones,

original: dharmataś caiva guptās te svavīryeṇa ca pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: dharmataḥ ca eva guptāḥ te sva vīryeṇa ca pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: the Pandavas, protected by their own prowess and by the ways of righteousness,

original: na nāśam adhigaccheyur iti me dhīyate matiḥ
analyzed: na nāśam adhigaccheyuḥ iti me dhīyate matiḥ
translated: will not meet with destruction. Such is my opinion.

original: tatra buddhiṃ praṇeṣyāmi pāṇḍavān prati bhārata
analyzed: tatra buddhim praṇeṣyāmi pāṇḍavān prati bhārata
translated: There, O Bharata, I will set forth my opinion regarding the Pandavas.

original: na tu nītiḥ sunītasya śakyate 'nveṣituṃ paraiḥ
analyzed: na tu nītiḥ su nītasya śakyate nveṣitum paraiḥ
translated: But the policy of a wise man cannot be discovered by his enemies.

original: yat tu śakyam ihāsmābhis tān vai saṃcintya pāṇḍavān
analyzed: yat tu śakyam iha asmābhiḥ tān vai saṃcintya pāṇḍavān
translated: But what is possible for us here, thinking of those Pandavas,

original: buddhyā pravaktuṃ na drohāt pravakṣyāmi nibodha tat
analyzed: buddhyā pravaktum na drohāt pravakṣyāmi nibodha tat
translated: I will speak through intelligence, not through malice. Listen to that.

original: na tv iyaṃ mādṛśair nītis tasya vācyā kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na tu iyam mādṛśaiḥ nītiḥ tasya vācyā katham cana
translated: But this policy should never be spoken by one like me to him.

original: sā tv iyaṃ sādhu vaktavyā na tv anītiḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: sā tu iyam sādhu vaktavyā na tu anītiḥ katham cana
translated: But this should be spoken as good policy, not as bad policy.

analyzed: vṛddha anuśāsane tāta tiṣṭhataḥ satya śīlinaḥ
translated: O son, in the instruction of the elders, abiding in truthfulness,

original: ayuktaṃ tu mayā vaktuṃ tulyā me kurupāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: ayuktam tu mayā vaktum tulyāḥ me kuru pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: it is improper for me to speak, for the Kurus and the Pandavas are equal to me.

original: nivāsaṃ pāṇḍuputrāṇāṃ saṃcintya ca vadāmy aham
analyzed: nivāsam pāṇḍu putrāṇām saṃcintya ca vadāmi aham
translated: But having considered the residence of the sons of Pandu, I will speak.

original: bahunā kiṃ pralāpena yato dharmas tato jayaḥ
analyzed: bahunā kim pralāpena yatas dharmaḥ tatas jayaḥ
translated: What is the use of much talk? Where there is righteousness, there is victory.

original: avaśyaṃ tv iha dhīreṇa satāṃ madhye vivakṣatā
analyzed: avaśyam tu iha dhīreṇa satām madhye vivakṣatā
translated: But a wise man, who wishes to speak in the midst of the good,

analyzed: yathāmati vivaktavyam sarvaśas dharma lipsayā
translated: must speak according to his understanding, desiring Dharma in every way.

original: tatra nāhaṃ tathā manye yathāyam itaro janaḥ
analyzed: tatra na aham tathā manye yathā ayam itaraḥ janaḥ
translated: There, I do not think as this other person does,

analyzed: nivāsam dharmarājasya varṣe smin vai trayodaśe
translated: about the residence of Dharmaraja in this thirteenth year.

original: tatra tāta na teṣāṃ hi rājñāṃ bhāvyam asāṃpratam
analyzed: tatra tāta na teṣām hi rājñām bhāvyam asāṃpratam
translated: There, O son, those kings should not be treated improperly,

analyzed: nivāsam pāṇḍu putrāṇām śṛṇuṣva manuja adhipa
translated: listen, O lord of men, about the residence of the sons of Pandu.

original: bhrātṛbhiḥ sahito vīraiḥ kṛṣṇayā ca mahāyaśāḥ
analyzed: bhrātṛbhiḥ sahitaḥ vīraiḥ kṛṣṇayā ca mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Together with his brothers, the heroes, and the greatly illustrious Krishna,

analyzed: kimartham sa mahā rājaḥ na ātma śreyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: for what purpose will that great king not bring about his own welfare?

original: pāṇḍavo nikṛtaḥ pūrvaṃ yathāvad viditaṃ tava
analyzed: pāṇḍavaḥ nikṛtaḥ pūrvam yathāvat viditam tava
translated: The Pandava was deceived before, as you know well.

original: kleśitaś ca pure nityaṃ rājyakāmaiś ca sāṃpratam
analyzed: kleśitaḥ ca pure nityam rājya kāmaiḥ ca sāṃpratam
translated: And he was always tormented in the city, and now by those desiring the kingdom.

original: channaś carati tasmāt sa prakṛtyā nītimān nṛpaḥ
analyzed: channaḥ carati tasmāt sa prakṛtyā nītimān nṛpaḥ
translated: Therefore, that king, naturally wise in policy, moves in disguise.

original: varṣam ekaṃ susaṃchannam uṣya vāsam anuttamam
analyzed: varṣam ekam su saṃchannam uṣya vāsam anuttamam
translated: Having lived for one year, well concealed, in an excellent residence,

original: āyāti codaye kāle kṣipraṃ drakṣyasi pāṇḍavam
analyzed: āyāti ca udaye kāle kṣipram drakṣyasi pāṇḍavam
translated: and returning at the time of the rising of the constellation Pushya, you will soon see the Pandava.

original: sodaraiḥ sahitaṃ vīraṃ draupadyā ca paraṃtapa
analyzed: sodaraiḥ sahitam vīram draupadyā ca paraṃtapa
translated: Together with his brothers, the hero, and Draupadi, that scorcher of enemies.

original: saṃvidhatsva mahābāho yathā na syāt sukhodayaḥ
analyzed: saṃvidhatsva mahā bāho yathā na syāt sukha udayaḥ
translated: Make arrangements, O mighty-armed one, so that he may not rise in prosperity.

original: yasmin sa rājā vasatiś channaḥ sattvabhṛtāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: yasmin sa rājā vasatiḥ channaḥ sattva bhṛtām varaḥ
translated: In which that king, the best of beings, lives hidden,

analyzed: bhaviṣyanti narāḥ tatra rāga moha vivarjitāḥ
translated: The people there will be free from passion and delusion.

original: nādhayo hi mahārāja na vyādhiḥ kṣatriyarṣabha
analyzed: na ādhayaḥ hi mahā rāja na vyādhiḥ kṣatriya ṛṣabha
translated: O great king, there will be no mental anguish, no disease, O bull among Kshatriyas,

original: pure janapade vāpi yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: pure janapade vā api yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: In the city or the country where King Yudhishthira resides.
He is inclined towards charity, generous, self-controlled, and restrained by modesty.

original: jano janapade bhāvyo yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: janaḥ janapade bhāvyaḥ yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: The people in the country where King Yudhishthira is,

original: priyavādī sadā dānto bhavyaḥ satyaparo janaḥ
analyzed: priya vādī sadā dāntaḥ bhavyaḥ satya paraḥ janaḥ
translated: Will be pleasant-spoken, always self-controlled, and devoted to truth.

original: hṛṣṭaḥ puṣṭaḥ śucir dakṣo yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: hṛṣṭaḥ puṣṭaḥ śuciḥ dakṣaḥ yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Cheerful, well-nourished, pure, and skillful, where King Yudhishthira is.

original: nāsūyako na cāpīrṣur nātivādī na matsarī
analyzed: na asūyakaḥ na ca api īrṣuḥ na ativādī na matsarī
translated: He will not be envious, malicious, overbearing, or jealous.

original: bhaviṣyati janas tatra svaṃ svaṃ dharmam anuvrataḥ🔽brahmaghoṣāś ca bhūyāṃsaḥ pūrṇāhutyas tathaiva ca
analyzed: bhaviṣyati janaḥ tatra svam svam dharmam anuvrataḥ  brahmaghoṣāḥ ca bhūyāṃsaḥ pūrṇāhutyaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The people there will follow their own duties, each according to their own.🔽There will be many sounds of the Vedas, and many complete oblations,

analyzed: kratavaḥ ca bhaviṣyanti bhūyāṃsaḥ bhūri dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: And there will be many sacrifices with abundant gifts.

original: sadā ca tatra parjanyaḥ samyag varṣī na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: sadā ca tatra parjanyaḥ samyak varṣī na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And there, Parjanya (Indra) will surely always rain properly,

analyzed: saṃpanna sasyā ca mahī nirītīkā bhaviṣyati
translated: And the earth will be full of crops and free from calamities.

original: rasavanti ca dhānyāni guṇavanti phalāni ca
analyzed: rasavanti ca dhānyāni guṇavanti phalāni ca
translated: The grains will be juicy, and the fruits will have good qualities.

original: gandhavanti ca mālyāni śubhaśabdā ca bhāratī
analyzed: gandhavanti ca mālyāni śubha śabdā ca bhāratī
translated: The garlands will be fragrant, and the speech will be auspicious.

original: vāyuś ca sukhasaṃsparśo niṣpratīpaṃ ca darśanam
analyzed: vāyuḥ ca sukha saṃsparśaḥ niṣpratīpam ca darśanam
translated: The wind will be pleasant to the touch, and the sight will be unobstructed.

original: na rogās tatra vidyante vadhabandhā na santi ca
analyzed: na rogāḥ tatra vidyante vadha bandhāḥ na santi ca
translated: There will be no diseases there, and there will be no killing or bondage.

original: na corā na hi dambhāś ca na ca bādhā bhavanti ca
analyzed: na corāḥ na hi dambhāḥ ca na ca bādhāḥ bhavanti ca
translated: There will be no thieves, no hypocrites, and no troubles.

original: nāśaktā na ca duṣṭāś ca yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: na aśaktāḥ na ca duṣṭāḥ ca yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Where King Yudhishthira is, there will be no weak or wicked people.

original: bhayaṃ nābhyāviśet tatra yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: bhayam na abhyāviśet tatra yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Fear will not enter where King Yudhishthira is.

original: gāvaś ca bahulās tatra na kṛśā na ca durduhāḥ
analyzed: gāvaḥ ca bahulāḥ tatra na kṛśāḥ na ca durduhāḥ
translated: The cows there will be numerous, not thin, and not difficult to milk.

analyzed: payāṃsi dadhi sarpīṃṣi rasavanti hitāni ca
translated: The milk, curd, and ghee will be tasty and wholesome.

original: salilāni prasannāni sarve bhāvāś ca śobhanāḥ
analyzed: salilāni prasannāni sarve bhāvāḥ ca śobhanāḥ
translated: The waters will be clear, and all things will be auspicious.

original: guṇavanti ca pānāni bhojyāni rasavanti ca
analyzed: guṇavanti ca pānāni bhojyāni rasavanti ca
translated: The drinks will be wholesome, and the food will be tasty.

original: tatra deśe bhaviṣyanti yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: tatra deśe bhaviṣyanti yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Where King Yudhishthira is, those things will be.

original: rasāḥ sparśāś ca gandhāś ca śabdāś cāpi guṇānvitāḥ
analyzed: rasāḥ sparśāḥ ca gandhāḥ ca śabdāḥ ca api guṇa anvitāḥ
translated: The tastes, textures, smells, and sounds will be endowed with good qualities.

original: dṛśyāni ca prasannāni yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: dṛśyāni ca prasannāni yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: The sights will be clear where King Yudhishthira is.

original: dharmāś ca tatra dṛśyante sevitāś ca dvijātibhiḥ
analyzed: dharmāḥ ca tatra dṛśyante sevitāḥ ca dvijātibhiḥ
translated: The duties will be seen there, and they will be practiced by the twice-born.

original: svaiḥ svair guṇaiḥ susaṃyuktās tasmin varṣe trayodaśe
analyzed: svaiḥ svaiḥ guṇaiḥ su saṃyuktāḥ tasmin varṣe trayodaśe
translated: In that thirteenth year, they will be endowed with their own qualities.

analyzed: deśe tasmin bhaviṣyanti tāta pāṇḍava saṃyute
translated: In that country, O son, when the Pandavas are united,

original: saṃprītimāñ janas tatra saṃtuṣṭaḥ śucir avyayaḥ
analyzed: saṃprītimān janaḥ tatra saṃtuṣṭaḥ śuciḥ avyayaḥ
translated: The people there will be full of affection, content, pure, and without decay.

analyzed: devatā atithi pūjāsu sarva bhūta anurāgavān
translated: They will be devoted to the worship of gods and guests, and will love all beings.

analyzed: iṣṭa dānaḥ mahā utsāhaḥ śaśvat dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: They will be givers of desired gifts, full of great enthusiasm, and always devoted to dharma.
They will hate inauspiciousness, seek auspiciousness, always perform sacrifices, and be of auspicious conduct,

original: bhaviṣyati janas tatra yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati janaḥ tatra yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: wherever King Yudhishthira is.
Always joyful with constant festivities, always delighted, surrounded by prosperity,

analyzed: bhaviṣyati nivāsaḥ yam yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: this will be the abode wherever King Yudhishthira is.

analyzed: tyakta vākya anṛtaḥ tāta śubha kalyāṇa maṅgalaḥ
translated: O son, abandoning false speech, with auspicious, wholesome, and fortunate words,

analyzed: śubha artha īpsuḥ śubha matiḥ yatra rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: desiring auspicious goals, with an auspicious mind, wherever King Yudhishthira is,

analyzed: sarva bhūta dayā yuktaḥ sadā nirmala mānasaḥ
translated: endowed with compassion for all beings, always with a pure mind,

original: anirdiśyaḥ sa dharmātmā dvijair api hi bhārata
analyzed: anirdiśyaḥ sa dharma ātmā dvijaiḥ api hi bhārata
translated: that righteous-souled one cannot be described even by the twice-born, O Bharata.

analyzed: bhaviṣyati janaḥ tatra nityam ca iṣṭa priya vrataḥ
translated: The people there will always be devoted to pleasing vows.

original: dharmātmā sa tadādṛśyaḥ so 'pi tāta dvijātibhiḥ
analyzed: dharma ātmā sa tadā adṛśyaḥ saḥ tadā adṛśyaḥ saḥ tāta dvijātibhiḥ
translated: That righteous-souled one cannot be seen even by the twice-born, O son.

original: kiṃ punaḥ prākṛtaiḥ pārthaḥ śakyo vijñātum antataḥ
analyzed: kim punar prākṛtaiḥ pārthaḥ śakyaḥ vijñātum antatas
translated: What to speak of ordinary people?

original: yasmin satyaṃ dhṛtir dānaṃ parā śāntir dhruvā kṣamā
analyzed: yasmin satyam dhṛtiḥ dānam parā śāntiḥ dhruvā kṣamā
translated: In him are truth, fortitude, generosity, supreme peace, firmness, forgiveness,

original: hrīḥ śrīḥ kīrtiḥ paraṃ teja ānṛśaṃsyam athārjavam
analyzed: hrīḥ śrīḥ kīrtiḥ param tejaḥ ānṛśaṃsyam atha ārjavam
translated: Humility, prosperity, fame, supreme splendor, non-violence, and sincerity.

original: tasmāt tatra nivāsaṃ tu channaṃ satreṇa dhīmataḥ
analyzed: tasmāt tatra nivāsam tu channam satreṇa dhīmataḥ
translated: Therefore, I am not eager to speak otherwise about the wise one's hidden stay there

original: gatiṃ vā paramāṃ tasya notsahe vaktum anyathā
analyzed: gatim vā paramām tasya nā utsahe vaktum anyathā
translated: or about his supreme destination.

original: evam etat tu saṃcintya yatkṛtaṃ manyase hitam
analyzed: evam etat tu saṃcintya yat kṛtam manyase hitam
translated: Having thought about this, do what you consider beneficial.

original: tat kṣipraṃ kuru kauravya yady evaṃ śraddadhāsi me
analyzed: tat kṣipram kuru kauravya yadi evam śraddadhāsi me
translated: O descendant of Kuru, quickly do that if you have faith in me.

original: kulasya hi kṣamaṃ tāta yad ahaṃ tad bravīmi te
analyzed: kulasya hi kṣamam tāta yat aham tat bravīmi te
translated: O son, I tell you what is proper for the family.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tataḥ śāradvato vākyam ity uvāca kṛpas tadā
analyzed: tatas śāradvataḥ vākyam iti uvāca kṛpaḥ tadā
translated: Then Sharadvan's son, Kripa, spoke these words:

original: yuktaṃ prāptaṃ ca vṛddhena pāṇḍavān prati bhāṣitam
analyzed: yuktam prāptam ca vṛddhena pāṇḍavān prati bhāṣitam
translated: The advice given by the aged one towards the Pandavas is proper and appropriate.

analyzed: dharma artha sahitam ślakṣṇam tattvataḥ ca sa hetumat
translated: It is full of dharma and artha, smooth, truthful, and has reasons.

original: tatrānurūpaṃ bhīṣmeṇa mamāpy atra giraṃ śṛṇu
analyzed: tatra anurūpam bhīṣmeṇa mama api atra giram śṛṇu
translated: In this matter, it is befitting for Bhishma. Listen to my words in this matter also.

original: teṣāṃ caiva gatis tīrthair vāsaś caiṣāṃ pracintyatām
analyzed: teṣām ca eva gatiḥ tīrthaiḥ vāsaḥ ca eṣām pracintyatām
translated: And let their destination and their stay be considered through the sacred places.

original: nītir vidhīyatāṃ cāpi sāṃprataṃ yā hitā bhavet
analyzed: nītiḥ vidhīyatām ca api sāṃpratam yā hitā bhavet
translated: And let a policy be laid down now that will be beneficial.

analyzed: na avajñeyaḥ ripuḥ tāta prākṛtaḥ bubhūṣatā
translated: Even an ordinary enemy should not be disregarded, my son, by one who desires prosperity,

original: kiṃ punaḥ pāṇḍavās tāta sarvāstrakuśalā raṇe
analyzed: kim punar pāṇḍavāḥ tāta sarva astra kuśalāḥ raṇe
translated: how much more so the Pandavas, my son, who are skilled in all weapons in battle.

analyzed: tasmāt satram praviṣṭeṣu pāṇḍaveṣu mahātmasu
translated: Therefore, when the great-souled Pandavas have entered the assembly,

analyzed: gūḍha bhāveṣu channeṣu kāle ca udayam āgate
translated: when their intentions are concealed, when the time has come,

analyzed: sva rāṣṭra para rāṣṭreṣu jñātavyam balam ātmanaḥ
translated: in our own country and in the enemy's country, our own strength should be known,

original: udaye pāṇḍavānāṃ ca prāpte kāle na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: udaye pāṇḍavānām ca prāpte kāle na saṃśayaḥ
translated: and when the rise of the Pandavas has come, there is no doubt,

analyzed: nivāsam pāṇḍu putrāṇām darśane mṛgayāmahe
translated: we should seek the residence of the sons of Pandu, when the time comes.

analyzed: nivṛtta samayāḥ pārthāḥ mahātmānaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: The Parthas, the great-souled and greatly powerful ones,

analyzed: mahā utsāhāḥ bhaviṣyanti pāṇḍavāḥ hi ati tejasaḥ
translated: will be of great enthusiasm, the Pandavas are indeed of great energy.

original: tasmād balaṃ ca kośaṃ ca nītiś cāpi vidhīyatām
analyzed: tasmāt balam ca kośam ca nītiḥ ca api vidhīyatām
translated: Therefore, let strength, treasury and policy be laid down,

original: yathā kālodaye prāpte samyak taiḥ saṃdadhāmahe
analyzed: yathā kāla udaye prāpte samyak taiḥ saṃdadhāmahe
translated: so that when the time has come, we may properly make peace with them.

original: tāta manyāmi tat sarvaṃ budhyasva balam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: tāta manyāmi tat sarvam budhyasva balam ātmanaḥ
translated: My son, I think all that should be understood by you, your own strength,

analyzed: niyatam sarva mitreṣu balavatsu abaleṣu ca
translated: certainly among all friends, both strong and weak,

original: uccāvacaṃ balaṃ jñātvā madhyasthaṃ cāpi bhārata
analyzed: uccāvacam balam jñātvā madhyastham ca api bhārata
translated: having known the high and low strength, and also the neutral, O Bharata,

original: prahṛṣṭam aprahṛṣṭaṃ ca saṃdadhāma tathā paraiḥ
analyzed: prahṛṣṭam a prahṛṣṭam ca saṃdadhāma tathā paraiḥ
translated: We will make peace with the enemies, both when they are delighted and when they are not delighted.

analyzed: sāmnā bhedena dānena daṇḍena bali karmaṇā
translated: By conciliation, by sowing dissension, by gifts, by punishment, by the performance of sacrifices,

original: nyāyenānamya ca parān balāc cānamya durbalān
analyzed: nyāyena ānamya ca parān balāt ca ānamya durbalān
translated: By bending the enemies through justice and by overpowering the weak through force,

original: sāntvayitvā ca mitrāṇi balaṃ cābhāṣyatāṃ sukham
analyzed: sāntvayitvā ca mitrāṇi balam ca ābhāṣyatām sukham
translated: By comforting the friends and addressing the army happily,

original: sakośabalasaṃvṛddhaḥ samyak siddhim avāpsyasi🔽yotsyase cāpi balibhir aribhiḥ pratyupasthitaiḥ
analyzed: sa kośa bala saṃvṛddhaḥ samyak siddhim avāpsyasi  yotsyase ca api balibhiḥ aribhiḥ pratyupasthitaiḥ
translated: Increasing the treasury and the army, you will attain complete success.🔽And you will fight with powerful enemies who have approached,

analyzed: anyaiḥ tvam pāṇḍavaiḥ vā api hīna sva bala vāhanaiḥ
translated: Either with others or with the Pandavas, who have a weak army and vehicles.

analyzed: evam sarvam viniścitya vyavasāyam svadharmataḥ
translated: Having thus determined everything according to your own duty,

analyzed: yathākālam manuṣya indra ciram sukham avāpsyasi
translated: At the proper time, O lord of men, you will attain happiness for a long time.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tato duryodhano vākyaṃ śrutvā teṣāṃ mahātmanām
analyzed: tatas duryodhanaḥ vākyam śrutvā teṣām mahātmanām
translated: Then Duryodhana, having heard the words of those great souls,

original: muhūrtam iva saṃcintya sacivān idam abravīt
analyzed: muhūrtam iva saṃcintya sacivān idam abravīt
translated: Thought for a moment and said this to his ministers:

original: śrutaṃ hy etan mayā pūrvaṃ kathāsu janasaṃsadi
analyzed: śrutam hi etat mayā pūrvam kathāsu jana saṃsadi
translated: This has been heard by me before in the assemblies of people,

analyzed: dhīrāṇām śāstra viduṣām prājñānām mati niścaye
translated: In the determined opinions of the wise, the learned in the scriptures,

analyzed: kṛtīnām sāra phalgu tve jānāmi naya cakṣuṣā
translated: I know through the eye of policy the success and the worthlessness of the strong,

analyzed: sattve bāhu bale dhairye prāṇe śārīra saṃbhave
translated: In courage, in the strength of arms, in patience, in the physical constitution,

analyzed: sāṃpratam mānuṣe loke sa daitya nara rākṣase
translated: Now in the human world, along with the demons, men and demons,

original: catvāras tu naravyāghrā bale śakropamā bhuvi
analyzed: catvāraḥ tu nara vyāghrāḥ bale śakra upamāḥ bhuvi
translated: There were four tigers among men, equal to Indra in strength on earth.

original: uttamāḥ prāṇināṃ teṣāṃ nāsti kaś cid bale samaḥ
analyzed: uttamāḥ prāṇinām teṣām na asti kaḥ cit bale samaḥ
translated: They were the best among beings, and no one was equal to them in strength.

analyzed: sama prāṇa balāḥ nityam saṃpūrṇa bala pauruṣāḥ
translated: They were always of equal life-force and strength, and fully endowed with power and manliness.

original: baladevaś ca bhīmaś ca madrarājaś ca vīryavān
analyzed: baladevaḥ ca bhīmaḥ ca madra rājaḥ ca vīryavān
translated: Baladeva, Bhima, and the valiant king of the Madras,

original: caturthaḥ kīcakas teṣāṃ pañcamaṃ nānuśuśrumaḥ🔽anyonyānantarabalāḥ parasparajayaiṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: caturthaḥ kīcakaḥ teṣām pañcamam na anuśuśrumaḥ  anyonya anantara balāḥ paraspara jaya eṣiṇaḥ
translated: And the fourth was Kichaka - we have not heard of a fifth.🔽They were of equal strength, each one after the other, and they always sought victory over each other.

analyzed: bāhu yuddham abhīpsantaḥ nityam saṃrabdha mānasāḥ
translated: Desiring a wrestling match, they were always filled with anger.

analyzed: tena aham avagacchāmi pratyayena vṛkodaram
translated: Therefore, I understand Vrikodara through this evidence,

original: manasy abhiniviṣṭaṃ me vyaktaṃ jīvanti pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: manasi abhiniviṣṭam me vyaktam jīvanti pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: That the Pandavas are certainly alive, as I have firmly decided in my mind.

analyzed: tatra aham kīcakam manye bhīmasenena māritam
translated: There, I think Kichaka was killed by Bhimasena,

original: sairandhrīṃ draupadīṃ manye nātra kāryā vicāraṇā🔽śaṅke kṛṣṇānimittaṃ tu bhīmasenena kīcakaḥ
analyzed: sairandhrīm draupadīm manye na atra kāryā vicāraṇā  śaṅke kṛṣṇā nimittam tu bhīmasenena kīcakaḥ
translated: And I think the sairandhri is Draupadi - there is no doubt to be had in this matter.

analyzed: gandharva vyapadeśena hataḥ niśi mahā balaḥ
translated: But I suspect that the greatly strong Kichaka was killed by Bhimasena at night under the pretext of a gandharva,

original: ko hi śakto 'paro bhīmāt kīcakaṃ hantum ojasā
analyzed: kaḥ hi śakto paraḥ bhīmāt kīcakam hantum ojasā
translated: For who else but Bhima could have killed Kichaka with his strength?

analyzed: śastram vinā bāhu vīryāt tathā sarva aṅga cūrṇitam
translated: And all his limbs were crushed without weapons, through the strength of his arms,

analyzed: marditum vā tathā śīghram carma māṃsa asthi cūrṇitam
translated: And quickly ground to dust, with skin, flesh and bones ground to powder,

original: rūpam anyat samāsthāya bhīmasyaitad viceṣṭitam🔽dhruvaṃ kṛṣṇānimittaṃ tu bhīmasenena sūtajaḥ
analyzed: rūpam anyat samāsthāya bhīmasya etat viceṣṭitam  dhruvam kṛṣṇā nimittam tu bhīmasenena sūtajaḥ
translated: Assuming another form, this is the deed of Bhima.🔽There is no doubt that the charioteer's son was killed by Bhimasena in the night, for the sake of Krishna,

analyzed: gandharva vyapadeśena hataḥ niśi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Under the pretext of being a gandharva.

original: pitāmahena ye coktā deśasya ca janasya ca
analyzed: pitāmahena ye ca uktāḥ deśasya ca janasya ca
translated: And the qualities of the country and the people that were mentioned by the grandfather,

original: guṇās te matsyarāṣṭreṣu bahuśo 'pi mayā śrutāḥ
analyzed: guṇāḥ te matsya rāṣṭreṣu bahuśas mayā śrutāḥ
translated: I have heard them many times in the kingdom of Matsya.

analyzed: virāṭa nagare manye pāṇḍavāḥ channa cāriṇaḥ
translated: I think the Pandavas are living in disguise in the city of Virata,

original: nivasanti pure ramye tatra yātrā vidhīyatām
analyzed: nivasanti pure ramye tatra yātrā vidhīyatām
translated: Let us go on a pilgrimage to that beautiful city.

analyzed: matsya rāṣṭram gamiṣyāmaḥ grahīṣyāmaḥ ca go dhanam
translated: We will go to the kingdom of Matsya and seize their cattle wealth.

original: gṛhīte godhane nūnaṃ te 'pi yotsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: gṛhīte go dhane nūnam te yotsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: When the cattle wealth is seized, the Pandavas will certainly fight.

original: apūrṇe samaye cāpi yadi paśyāma pāṇḍavān
analyzed: apūrṇe samaye ca api yadi paśyāma pāṇḍavān
translated: If we see the Pandavas before the appointed time,

analyzed: dvādaśa anyāni varṣāṇi pravekṣyanti punar vanam
translated: They will again enter the forest for twelve more years.

analyzed: tasmāt anyatareṇa api lābhaḥ smākam bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, we will gain something by either of the two.

analyzed: kośa vṛddhiḥ iha asmākam śatrūṇām nidhanam bhavet
translated: Our treasury will increase and our enemies will be destroyed.

analyzed: katham suyodhanam gacchet yudhiṣṭhira bhṛtaḥ purā
translated: How can he who was formerly the servant of Yudhishthira go to Suyodhana?

original: etac cāpi vadaty eṣa mātsyaḥ paribhavān mayi
analyzed: etat ca api vadati eṣa mātsyaḥ paribhavāt mayi
translated: And this Matsya speaks thus out of contempt for me.

original: tasmāt kartavyam etad vai tasmin yātrā vidhīyatām
analyzed: tasmāt kartavyam etat vai tasmin yātrā vidhīyatām
translated: Therefore, this must be done. Let the journey be undertaken.

original: etat sunītaṃ manye 'haṃ sarveṣāṃ yadi rocate
analyzed: etat su nītam manye ham sarveṣām yadi rocate
translated: I consider this to be well-advised, if it pleases all of you.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: atha rājā trigartānām suśarmā ratha yūthapaḥ
translated: Then Susharma, the king of Trigarta, the leader of charioteers,

original: pūrvam ābhāṣya karṇena tathā duḥśāsanena ca
analyzed: pūrvam ābhāṣya karṇena tathā duḥśāsanena ca
translated: having been addressed earlier by Karna and also by Duhshasana,

original: prāptakālam idaṃ vākyam uvāca tvarito bhṛśam
analyzed: prāpta kālam idam vākyam uvāca tvaritaḥ bhṛśam
translated: quickly spoke these words that were appropriate for the occasion:

original: asakṛn nikṛtaḥ pūrvaṃ matsyaiḥ sālveyakaiḥ saha
analyzed: asakṛt nikṛtaḥ pūrvam matsyaiḥ sālveyakaiḥ saha
translated: I have been repeatedly deceived by the Matsyas along with the Shalveyas,

original: sūtena caiva matsyasya kīcakena punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: sūtena ca eva matsyasya kīcakena punar punar
translated: and again and again by Kichaka, the charioteer of the Matsya king.

original: bādhito bandhubhiḥ sārdhaṃ balād balavatā vibho
analyzed: bādhitaḥ bandhubhiḥ sārdham balāt balavatā vibho
translated: O lord, along with my relatives, I have been forcibly oppressed by the powerful one.

analyzed: sa karṇam abhyudīkṣya atha duryodhanam abhāṣata
translated: Having looked at Karna, he then spoke to Duryodhana:

original: asakṛn matsyarājñā me rāṣṭraṃ bādhitam ojasā
analyzed: asakṛt matsya rājñā me rāṣṭram bādhitam ojasā
translated: My kingdom has been repeatedly oppressed by the king of Matsya with great force.

original: praṇetā kīcakaś cāsya balavān abhavat purā
analyzed: praṇetā kīcakaḥ ca asya balavān abhavat purā
translated: And in the past, his powerful brother Kichaka became (my enemy).

analyzed: krūraḥ marṣī sa duṣṭa ātmā bhuvi prakhyāta vikramaḥ
translated: He was cruel, intolerant, evil-minded, and his valor was well-known on earth.

analyzed: nihataḥ tatra gandharvaiḥ pāpa karmā nṛśaṃsavān
translated: The wicked and cruel one was killed there by the Gandharvas.

original: tasmiṃś ca nihate rājan hīnadarpo nirāśrayaḥ
analyzed: tasmin ca nihate rājan hīna darpaḥ nirāśrayaḥ
translated: And when he is killed, O king, his pride diminished and without support,

original: bhaviṣyati nirutsāho virāṭa iti me matiḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati nirutsāhaḥ virāṭaḥ iti me matiḥ
translated: I think Virata will become dispirited.

original: tatra yātrā mama matā yadi te rocate 'nagha
analyzed: tatra yātrā mama matā yadi te rocate nagha
translated: If it pleases you, O sinless one, I think that is where we should go.

original: kauravāṇāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ karṇasya ca mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: kauravāṇām ca sarveṣām karṇasya ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: And for all the Kauravas and the great-souled Karna,

original: etat prāptam ahaṃ manye kāryam ātyayikaṃ hitam🔽rāṣṭraṃ tasyābhiyātv āśu bahudhānyasamākulam
analyzed: etat prāptam aham manye kāryam ātyayikam hitam  rāṣṭram tasya abhiyātu āśu bahu dhānya samākulam
translated: I consider that to be the most urgent and beneficial task at hand.🔽Let us quickly march against his kingdom, which is full of abundant grain,

analyzed: ādadāmaḥ sya ratnāni vividhāni vasūni ca
translated: and seize his various jewels and riches.

original: grāmān rāṣṭrāṇi vā tasya hariṣyāmo vibhāgaśaḥ
analyzed: grāmān rāṣṭrāṇi vā tasya hariṣyāmaḥ vibhāgaśaḥ
translated: We will seize his villages and kingdoms, each for our share.

original: atha vā gosahasrāṇi bahūni ca śubhāni ca🔽vidhamitvā hariṣyāmaḥ praviśya ca purād balam
analyzed: atha vā go sahasrāṇi bahūni ca śubhāni ca  vidhamitvā hariṣyāmaḥ praviśya ca purāt balam
translated: Or else, having divided up his many excellent and auspicious thousands of cows,🔽we will seize them by entering his city with our army.

analyzed: vividhāni hariṣyāmaḥ pratipīḍya puram balāt
translated: Having forcefully attacked his city with our army, we will seize various things.

original: kauravaiḥ saha saṃgamya trigartaiś ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: kauravaiḥ saha saṃgamya trigartaiḥ ca viśām pate
translated: Having allied with the Kauravas and the Trigartas, O lord of the people,

analyzed: gāḥ tasya apaharāma āśu saha sarvaiḥ su saṃhatāḥ
translated: let us quickly seize his cattle, united with all of you.

original: saṃdhiṃ vā tena kṛtvā tu nibadhnīmo 'sya pauruṣam
analyzed: saṃdhim vā tena kṛtvā tu nibadhnīmaḥ u sya pauruṣam
translated: Or having made peace with him, let us bind his manliness.

original: hatvā cāsya camūṃ kṛtsnāṃ vaśam anvānayāmahe
analyzed: hatvā ca asya camūm kṛtsnām vaśam anvānayāmahe
translated: Having destroyed his entire army, we will bring him under our control.

original: taṃ vaśe nyāyataḥ kṛtvā sukhaṃ vatsyāmahe vayam
analyzed: tam vaśe nyāyataḥ kṛtvā sukham vatsyāmahe vayam
translated: Having brought him under our control through proper means, we will live happily.

original: bhavato balavṛddhiś ca bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: bhavataḥ bala vṛddhiḥ ca bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And there is no doubt that your strength will increase.

original: tac chrutvā vacanaṃ tasya karṇo rājānam abravīt
analyzed: tat śrutvā vacanam tasya karṇaḥ rājānam abravīt
translated: Having heard those words of his, Karna spoke to the king:

original: sūktaṃ suśarmaṇā vākyaṃ prāptakālaṃ hitaṃ ca naḥ
analyzed: su uktam suśarmaṇā vākyam prāpta kālam hitam ca naḥ
translated: The words spoken by Susharma are well-said, timely and beneficial for us.

analyzed: tasmāt kṣipram viniryāmaḥ yojayitvā varūthinīm
translated: Therefore, let us quickly march out, having arrayed our army,

original: yady etat te 'bhirucitaṃ mama caitad dhi rocate
analyzed: yadi etat te bhirucitam mama ca etat hi rocate
translated: if this is agreeable to you, for it appeals to me.

original: vibhajya cāpy anīkāni yathā vā manyase 'nagha
analyzed: vibhajya ca api anīkāni yathā vā manyase nagha
translated: And having divided the troops, O sinless one, as you think fit,

analyzed: prajñāvān kuruvṛddhaḥ yam sarveṣām naḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: this wise and aged Kuru, our grandfather,

original: ācāryaś ca tathā droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ śāradvatas tathā
analyzed: ācāryaḥ ca tathā droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ śāradvataḥ tathā
translated: and the preceptor Drona, and also Kripa, the son of Sharadvata,

original: manyante te yathā sarve tathā yātrā vidhīyatām
analyzed: manyante te yathā sarve tathā yātrā vidhīyatām
translated: let the expedition be undertaken as they all think it should be.

analyzed: saṃmantrya ca āśu gacchāmaḥ sādhana artham mahīpateḥ
translated: And having consulted, let us quickly go to accomplish the purpose of the king.

original: kiṃ ca naḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ kāryaṃ hīnārthabalapauruṣaiḥ
analyzed: kim ca naḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ kāryam hīna artha bala pauruṣaiḥ
translated: What have we to do with the Pandavas, who are devoid of wealth, strength and manliness?

original: atyarthaṃ vā pranaṣṭās te prāptā vāpi yamakṣayam
analyzed: atyartham vā pranaṣṭāḥ te prāptāḥ vā api yama kṣayam
translated: Or they have perished utterly, or have reached Yama's abode.

original: tad bhavāṃś caturaṅgeṇa balena mahatā vṛtaḥ
analyzed: tat bhavān caturaṅgeṇa balena mahatā vṛtaḥ
translated: Therefore, O king, surrounded by a great army with four divisions,

analyzed: yāmaḥ rājan anudvignāḥ virāṭa viṣayam vayam
translated: Let us go to the kingdom of Virata without any anxiety.

original: ādāsyāmo hi gās tasya vividhāni vasūni ca
analyzed: ādāsyāmaḥ hi gāḥ tasya vividhāni vasūni ca
translated: We will seize his cattle and various riches.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: uktam etad vidheyaṃ vā vākyam uktaṃ tvayānagha
analyzed: uktam etat vidheyam vā vākyam uktam tvayā anagha
translated: O sinless one, the words spoken by you should be done or not done.

analyzed: yadā eva cāraiḥ prahitaiḥ iha āgamya niveditam
translated: As soon as it was reported by the spies sent here,

analyzed: nidhanam sūtaputrasya kīcakasya balīyasaḥ
translated: The death of the powerful son of Suta, Kichaka,

original: tadaiva hi mahācintā hṛdi pāṇḍusutān prati
analyzed: tadā eva hi mahā cintā hṛdi pāṇḍu sutān prati
translated: Then only the great anxiety about the sons of Pandu in the heart,

analyzed: kīcakam bala saṃpannam na anyaḥ hantā vṛkodarāt
translated: Except Vrikodara, there is no other slayer of the powerful Kichaka.

original: nityam eva hi pārthānāṃ virāṭaḥ priyam icchati
analyzed: nityam eva hi pārthānām virāṭaḥ priyam icchati
translated: Virata always desires the welfare of the Parthas.

original: tasmiṃs te cāpi viśvastā nivāsāya sthitā dhruvam
analyzed: tasmin te ca api viśvastāḥ nivāsāya sthitāḥ dhruvam
translated: And they too are certainly staying there with trust in him for residence.

analyzed: pitāmahena yat ca uktam cihnam pārtha abhivedane
translated: The sign mentioned by the grandfather for recognizing the Parthas,

original: tad dhi rājño virāṭasya śrūyate viṣaye kila
analyzed: tat hi rājñaḥ virāṭasya śrūyate viṣaye kila
translated: That is heard indeed in the kingdom of king Virata.

original: tat tatra gatvā karṇāśu virāṭaṃ godhanaṃ vayam
analyzed: tat tatra gatvā karṇa āśu virāṭam go dhanam vayam
translated: Therefore, O Karna, having gone there quickly, we will seize Virata's cattle and wealth.

original: gṛhṇīmas tasya rāṣṭraṃ ca pramathya svabalair yutāḥ
analyzed: gṛhṇīmaḥ tasya rāṣṭram ca pramathya sva balaiḥ yutāḥ
translated: Having crushed his kingdom with our own forces,

analyzed: anuyāsyanti te ca asmān virāṭasya hita eṣiṇaḥ
translated: And those who wish the welfare of Virata will follow us.

original: tatra vetsyāmahe tān vai buddhvā caiṣāṃ yathāgatim

analyzed: bhīmaḥ tu bhīma saṃkāśaḥ rathāt praskandya kuṇḍalī
translated: But Bhima, terrible to behold, jumped down from his chariot, wearing earrings,

analyzed: trigarta rājam ādatta siṃhaḥ kṣudra mṛgam yathā
translated: and seized the king of Trigarta, like a lion seizing a small animal.

analyzed: tam bhīmasenaḥ dhāvantam abhyadhāvata vīryavān
translated: The powerful Bhimasena ran after him as he was fleeing.

original: utplutyāgatya vegena tadrathe vinipatya ca🔽suśarmaṇaḥ śiro 'gṛhṇāt punar āśvāsya yudhyataḥ
analyzed: utplutya āgatya vegena tad rathe vinipatya ca  suśarmaṇaḥ śiraḥ gṛhṇāt punar āśvāsya yudhyataḥ
translated: Jumping up with force, he fell on his chariot,🔽and grabbed Susharma's head while he was still fighting, taking a breath.

original: abhidrutya suśarmāṇaṃ keśapakṣe parāmṛśat🔽samudyamya ca roṣāt taṃ niṣpipeṣa mahītale
analyzed: abhidrutya suśarmāṇam keśa pakṣe parāmṛśat  samudyamya ca roṣāt tam niṣpipeṣa mahī tale
translated: Approaching Susharma, he grabbed him by the hair.🔽And lifting him up in anger, he crushed him on the ground.

analyzed: padā mūrdhni mahā bāhuḥ prāharat vilapiṣyataḥ
translated: The mighty-armed one struck him on the head with his foot, while he was lamenting.

original: tasya jānuṃ dadau bhīmo jaghne cainam aratninā
analyzed: tasya jānum dadau bhīmaḥ jaghne ca enam aratninā
translated: Bhima gave him his knee and struck him with his forearm.

analyzed: sa moham agamat rājā prahāra vara pīḍitaḥ
translated: The king, afflicted by those excellent blows, fell unconscious.

original: taṃ niṣedhayatāṃ bhīmaṃ yamau traigartam āraṇe
analyzed: tam niṣedhayatām bhīmam yamau traigartam āraṇe
translated: The twins, in order to restrain Bhima, who was engaged in slaying the Trigartas,

original: tadā bhīmo 'bhisaṃkruddhas tasya darpaṃ nanāśa ha
analyzed: tadā bhīmaḥ tasya darpam nanāśa ha
translated: Then Bhima, enraged, destroyed his pride.

original: ūrdhvam utplutya mārjāra ākhor yadvac chiro ruṣā
analyzed: ūrdhvam utplutya mārjāraḥ ākhoḥ yadvat śiraḥ ruṣā
translated: Jumping up, like a cat for a mouse, he seized his head with his foot.

analyzed: tasmin gṛhīte virathe trigartānām mahā rathe
translated: When that great chariot of the Trigartas was captured and deprived of his chariot,

analyzed: abhajyata balam sarvam traigartam tat bhaya āturam
translated: The entire army of the Trigartas, afflicted with fear, was shattered.

original: nivartya gās tataḥ sarvāḥ pāṇḍuputrā mahābalāḥ
analyzed: nivartya gāḥ tatas sarvāḥ pāṇḍu putrāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: Then the greatly powerful sons of Pandu, having turned back all the cows,

analyzed: avajitya suśarmāṇam dhanam ca ādāya sarvaśas
translated: Having defeated Susharma and taken all the wealth,

original: svabāhubalasaṃpannā hrīniṣedhā yatavratāḥ🔽mocayitvā virāṭaṃ taṃ pāṇḍavās te hatadviṣaḥ
analyzed: sva bāhu bala saṃpannāḥ hrī niṣedhāḥ yata vratāḥ  mocayitvā virāṭam tam pāṇḍavāḥ te hata dviṣaḥ
translated: Endowed with the strength of their own arms, restrained by modesty, and firm in their vows,🔽Having freed Virata, the Pandavas, their enemies slain,

analyzed: virāṭasya mahātmānaḥ parikleśa vināśanāḥ
translated: The great souls of the Pandavas, destroyers of Virata's great suffering,

original: sthitāḥ samakṣaṃ te sarve tv atha bhīmo 'bhyabhāṣata
analyzed: sthitāḥ samakṣam te sarve tu atha bhīmaḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: All of them stood before him, then Bhima spoke:

original: nāyaṃ pāpasamācāro matto jīvitum arhati🔽kiṃ nu śakyaṃ mayā kartuṃ yad rājā satataṃ ghṛṇī
analyzed: na ayam pāpa samācāraḥ mattaḥ jīvitum arhati  kim nu śakyam mayā kartum yat rājā satatam ghṛṇī
translated: This one of sinful conduct does not deserve to live by me.🔽What can I do, since the king is always merciful?

original: gale gṛhītvā rājānam ānīya vivaśaṃ vaśam
analyzed: gale gṛhītvā rājānam ānīya vivaśam vaśam
translated: Seizing the king by the throat, bringing him under my power helplessly,

original: tata enaṃ viceṣṭantaṃ baddhvā pārtho vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: tatas enam viceṣṭantam baddhvā pārthaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Then Partha Vrikodara, binding him struggling,

analyzed: ratham āropayām āsa visaṃjñam pāṃsu guṇṭhitam
translated: and placed him, unconscious and covered with dust, on his chariot.

analyzed: abhyetya raṇa madhya stham abhyagacchat yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Approaching Yudhishthira, who was in the midst of the battle,

original: darśayām āsa bhīmas tu tām avasthāṃ suśarmaṇaḥ
analyzed: darśayām āsa bhīmaḥ tu tām avasthām suśarmaṇaḥ
translated: Bhima showed him the condition of Susharma.

analyzed: provāca puruṣa vyāghraḥ bhīmam āhava śobhinam
translated: The tiger among men said to Bhima, the ornament of battle:

analyzed: tam rājā prāhasat dṛṣṭvā mucyatām vai nara adhamaḥ
translated: Seeing him, the king laughed and said, 'Let this lowest of men be released.'

analyzed: evam uktaḥ bravīt bhīmaḥ suśarmāṇam mahā balam

analyzed: jīvitum ca icchase mūḍha hetum te vadataḥ śṛṇu

analyzed: dāsaḥ smi iti tvayā vācyam ca sabhāsu ca

analyzed: evam te jīvitam dadyām eṣa yuddha jitaḥ vidhiḥ

original: tam uvāca tato jyeṣṭho bhrātā sapraṇayaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas jyeṣṭhaḥ bhrātā sa praṇayam vacaḥ
translated: Then his elder brother spoke to him with affection:

original: muñcemam adhamācāraṃ pramāṇaṃ yadi te vayam
analyzed: muñca imam adhama ācāram pramāṇam yadi te vayam
translated: 'If we are your authority, release this one of low conduct.

original: dāsabhāvaṃ gato hy eṣa virāṭasya mahīpateḥ
analyzed: dāsa bhāvam gataḥ hi eṣa virāṭasya mahīpateḥ

analyzed: adāsaḥ gaccha muktaḥ si mā evam kārṣīḥ punar kva cit

analyzed: evam ukte tu sa vrīḍaḥ suśarmā āsīt adhomukhaḥ

analyzed: sa muktaḥ bhyetya rājānam abhivādya pratasthivān

original: pramucya ca suśarmāṇaṃ pāṇḍavās te hatadviṣaḥ
analyzed: pramucya ca suśarmāṇam pāṇḍavāḥ te hata dviṣaḥ
translated: The Pandavas, having freed Susharma and having killed their enemies,

translated: endowed with the strength of their own arms, modest, observing vows,

analyzed: saṃgrāma śirasaḥ madhye tām rātrim sukhinaḥ vasan

analyzed: sa bhīmasenaḥ samare nihatya
translated: Bhimasena, having killed the enemies in battle,

analyzed: śatrūn virāṭasya mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: the greatly illustrious one of Virata,

analyzed: nanāda hṛṣṭaḥ balavān amarṣī

analyzed: siṃhaḥ yathā kṣudra mṛgam nihatya  tatas virāṭaḥ kaunteyān ati mānuṣa vikramān

original: arcayām āsa vittena mānena ca mahārathān
analyzed: arcayām āsa vittena mānena ca mahā rathān
translated: those great charioteers with wealth and honor,

original: vacasā caiva sāntvena snehena ca mudānvitaḥ

analyzed: virāṭaḥ uvāca
translated: Virata said:

original: yathaiva mama ratnāni yuṣmākaṃ tāni vai tathā
analyzed: yathā eva mama ratnāni yuṣmākam tāni vai tathā

original: kāryaṃ kuruta taiḥ sarve yathākāmaṃ yathāsukham
analyzed: kāryam kuruta taiḥ sarve yathākāmam yathāsukham
translated: Do whatever needs to be done with them, as you wish and as you please.

original: dadāny alaṃkṛtāḥ kanyā vasūni vividhāni ca
analyzed: dadāni alaṃkṛtāḥ kanyāḥ vasūni vividhāni ca
translated: I will give you adorned maidens and various riches,

analyzed: manasaḥ ca api abhipretam yat vaḥ śatru nibarhaṇāḥ

analyzed: yuṣmākam vikramāt adya muktaḥ ham svastimān iha

analyzed: tasmāt bhavantaḥ matsyānām īśvarāḥ sarve eva hi

translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: tathā abhivādinam matsyam kauraveyāḥ pṛthak pṛthak

analyzed: yat tvam muktaḥ si śatrubhyaḥ etat kāryam hitam hi naḥ

analyzed: na kim cit kāryam asmākam na dhanam mṛgayāmahe

analyzed: athā bravīt prīta manāḥ matsya rājaḥ yudhiṣṭhiram

analyzed: nirbharaḥ prīti pūrveṇa harṣa gadgadayā girā
translated: Full of affection, with words choked with joy,

analyzed: punar eva mahā bāhuḥ virāṭaḥ rāja sattamaḥ

analyzed: ehi tvām abhiṣekṣyāmi matsya rājaḥ stu naḥ bhavān

analyzed: manasaḥ ca api abhipretam yat te śatru nibarhaṇa
translated: And whatever is desired in your mind, O destroyer of enemies,

analyzed: tat te ham saṃpradāsyāmi sarvam arhati naḥ bhavān

original: ratnāni gāḥ suvarṇaṃ ca maṇimuktam athāpi vā
analyzed: ratnāni gāḥ suvarṇam ca maṇi muktam atha api vā

analyzed: tvad kṛte hi adya paśyāmi rājyam ātmānam eva ca

analyzed: dharmarājaḥ mahā rāja jagāda sadṛśīm giram
translated: Dharmaraja, O great king, spoke words befitting the occasion:

analyzed: tatas yudhiṣṭhiraḥ matsyam punar eva abhyabhāṣata

analyzed: saḥ ham śūdreṇa saṃgrāme valalena abhirakṣitaḥ

analyzed: tvad kṛte sarvam eva etat upapannam mama anagha

analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva bhadram te brūhi kim karavāṇi te

analyzed: dadāni te mahā prītyā ratnāni uccāvacāni api

analyzed: śayana āsana yānāni kanyāḥ ca samalaṃkṛtāḥ

analyzed: hasti aśva ratha saṃghāḥ ca rāṣṭrāṇi vividhāni ca

translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: tam tathā vādinam tatra kauravyaḥ pratyabhāṣata

analyzed: eṣā eva tu mama prītiḥ yat tvam muktaḥ si śatrubhiḥ

analyzed: pratītaḥ ced punar tuṣṭaḥ pravekṣyasi tadā anagha
translated: And if you are satisfied and content, you may enter again, O sinless one,

analyzed: dāraiḥ putraiḥ ca saṃśliṣya sā hi prītiḥ mama atulā

analyzed: suśarmāṇam tu rāja indra sa bhṛtya bala vāhanam

analyzed: visarjaya nara śreṣṭha varam etat aham vṛṇe

analyzed: pratyuvāca tatas kaṅkam suśarmā yātu ceṣṭataḥ

analyzed: gacchantu dūtāḥ tvaritam nagaram tava pārthiva

analyzed: suhṛdām priyam ākhyātum ghoṣayantu ca te jayam

analyzed: tatas tad vacanāt matsyaḥ dūtān rājā samādiśat

analyzed: ācakṣadhvam puram gatvā saṃgrāme vijayam mama
translated: Go to the city and proclaim my victory in battle,

analyzed: vāditrāṇi ca sarvāṇi gaṇikāḥ ca su alaṃkṛtāḥ

analyzed: etat ājñām tatas śrutvā rājñā matsyena noditāḥ

analyzed: te gatvā kevalām rātrim atha sūrya udayam prati

analyzed: nagaram prāviśan te vai sūrye samyak atha udite

analyzed: patākā ucchraya mālā āḍhyam puram apratimam yathā

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: yāte trigartam matsye tu paśūn tān svān parīpsati
translated: When the Matsya king had gone to Trigartta, desiring to get back his cattle,

translated: Duryodhana, along with his ministers, then approached Virata.

original: bhīṣmo droṇaś ca karṇaś ca kṛpaś ca paramāstravit
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ droṇaḥ ca karṇaḥ ca kṛpaḥ ca parama astra vid
translated: Bhishma, Drona, Karna, and Kripa, skilled in supreme weapons,

translated: Having said this, the son of Kunti jumped down from that excellent chariot

analyzed: tam anvadhāvat dhāvantam rāja putram dhanaṃjayaḥ  dīrghām veṇīm vidhunvānaḥ sādhu rakte ca vāsasī
translated: and Dhananjaya ran after the prince who was running away.🔽Shaking his long braid and wearing beautiful red garments,

analyzed: vikramantam padanyāsaiḥ namayan iva bhū talam
translated: he was striding with long steps as if bending the earth with his footsteps.

analyzed: vidhūya veṇīm dhāvantam a jānantaḥ rjunam tadā
translated: Not recognizing Arjuna who was running with his braid loosened,

original: sainikāḥ prāhasan ke cit tathārūpam avekṣya tam
analyzed: sainikāḥ prāhasan ke cid tathārūpam avekṣya tam
translated: some of the soldiers laughed when they saw him in that form.

analyzed: tam śīghram abhidhāvantam saṃprekṣya kuravaḥ bruvan
translated: Seeing him running swiftly, the Kurus said:

analyzed: sainikāḥ
translated: The soldiers said:

analyzed: kaḥ yam dhāvati asaṃgena pūrvam muktvā ratha uttamam  kaḥ eṣa veṣa pracchannaḥ bhasmanā iva hutāśanaḥ
translated: Who is this running unhindered, having left his excellent chariot behind?🔽Who is this disguised as a woman, like ashes on a fire?

original: kiṃ cid asya yathā puṃsaḥ kiṃ cid asya yathā striyaḥ
analyzed: kim cit asya yathā puṃsaḥ kim cit asya yathā striyaḥ
translated: Is he a man or a woman?

original: ity evaṃ sainikāḥ prāhur droṇas tān idam abravīt
analyzed: iti evam sainikāḥ prāhuḥ droṇaḥ tān idam abravīt
translated: Thus spoke the soldiers, and Drona said this to them:

analyzed: ācāryaḥ kuru pāṇḍūnām matau śukra aṅgirāḥ upamaḥ
translated: The preceptor of the Kurus and Pandus, equal to Shukra and Angiras in wisdom,

original: kiṃ vicāreṇa vaḥ kāryam etenānusṛtena vai
analyzed: kim vicāreṇa vaḥ kāryam etena anusṛtena vai
translated: what need is there for you to ponder over this one who is being pursued?

analyzed: dhāvantam anudhāvan ca nirbhayaḥ bhaya viplutam
translated: Fearlessly pursuing the one who is running away in fear,

analyzed: veṇī kalāpam nirdhūya pravibhāti nara ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The bull among men shines forth, having cast off his braid and topknot.

analyzed: sārūpyam arjunasya iva klība rūpam bibharti ca
translated: And he bears a form like that of Arjuna, in the guise of a eunuch.

analyzed: rūpeṇa pārtha sadṛśaḥ strī veṣa samalaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: In appearance, he is like Partha, adorned in women's attire.

original: tad evaitac chirogrīvaṃ tau bāhū parighopamau
analyzed: tat eva etat śiraḥ grīvam tau bāhū parigha upamau
translated: That very head and neck, those arms resembling iron bars,

original: tadvad evāsya vikrāntaṃ nāyam anyo dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: tadvat eva asya vikrāntam na ayam anyaḥ dhanaṃjayāt
translated: his valor is like that, he is none other than Dhananjaya.

analyzed: amareṣu iva deva indraḥ mānuṣeṣu dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Just as Indra of the gods among the immortals, so is Dhananjaya among humans.

original: ekaḥ ko 'smān upāyāyād anyo loke dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: ekaḥ kaḥ smān upāyāyāt anyaḥ loke dhanaṃjayāt
translated: Who else in the world but Dhananjaya could have come to us alone?

original: droṇena caivam ukte tu karṇaḥ provāca buddhimān
analyzed: droṇena ca evam ukte tu karṇaḥ provāca buddhimān
translated: When Drona said this, the wise Karna spoke:

original: ekaḥ putro virāṭasya śūnye saṃnihitaḥ pure
analyzed: ekaḥ putraḥ virāṭasya śūnye saṃnihitaḥ pure
translated: Virata's only son, left alone in the empty city,

original: sa eṣa kila niryāto bālabhāvān na pauruṣāt
analyzed: saḥ eṣa kila niryātaḥ bāla bhāvāt na pauruṣāt
translated: he has indeed gone out, out of childishness, not out of manliness.

original: klībaṃ vai sārathiṃ kṛtvā niryāto nagarād bahiḥ
analyzed: klībam vai sārathim kṛtvā niryātaḥ nagarāt bahis
translated: Having made a eunuch his charioteer, he has gone out of the city.

original: satreṇa nūnaṃ channaṃ hi carantaṃ pārtham arjunam
analyzed: satreṇa nūnam channam hi carantam pārtham arjunam
translated: Surely, they are hiding the sacrificial Partha Arjuna.

original: te hi naḥ pratisaṃyātuṃ saṃgrāme na hi śaknuyuḥ
analyzed: te hi naḥ pratisaṃyātum saṃgrāme na hi śaknuyuḥ
translated: For they are not able to return to fight with us.

original: katham ekataras teṣāṃ samastān yodhayet kurūn
analyzed: katham ekataraḥ teṣām samastān yodhayet kurūn
translated: How could one of them fight all the assembled Kurus?

original: uttaraḥ sārathiṃ kṛtvā niryāto nagarād bahiḥ
analyzed: uttaraḥ sārathim kṛtvā niryātaḥ nagarāt bahis
translated: Having made Uttara his charioteer, he has gone out of the city.

original: sa no manye dhvajān dṛṣṭvā bhīta eṣa palāyati
analyzed: sa naḥ manye dhvajān dṛṣṭvā bhītaḥ eṣa palāyati
translated: Seeing our banners, he is frightened and is running away.

original: taṃ nūnam eṣa dhāvantaṃ jighṛkṣati dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tam nūnam eṣa dhāvantam jighṛkṣati dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: No doubt Dhananjaya is chasing him, wishing to seize him.

original: eko 'smān anuyāty eṣa nānyo loke dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: ekaḥ smān anuyāti eṣa na anyaḥ loke dhanaṃjayāt
translated: He is alone following us, there is no one else in the world like Dhananjaya.

original: sārathiṃ hy uttaraṃ kṛtvā svayaṃ yoddhum ihecchati
analyzed: sārathim hi uttaram kṛtvā svayam yoddhum iha icchati
translated: Making Uttara his charioteer, he wishes to fight here himself.

original: iti sma kuravaḥ sarve vimṛśantaḥ pṛthak pṛthak
analyzed: iti sma kuravaḥ sarve vimṛśantaḥ pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Thus all the Kurus, reflecting separately,

original: na ca vyavasituṃ kiṃ cid uttaraṃ śaknuvanti te
analyzed: na ca vyavasitum kim cit uttaram śaknuvanti te
translated: were unable to decide anything in reply.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca idam sainikān ratha sattamān
translated: Duryodhana said this to the soldiers, the best of charioteers:

original: arjuno vāsudevo vā rāmaḥ pradyumna eva vā
analyzed: arjunaḥ vāsudevaḥ vā rāmaḥ pradyumnaḥ eva vā
translated: Either Arjuna, Vasudeva, Rama or Pradyumna,

original: te hi naḥ pratisaṃyoddhuṃ saṃgrāme na hi śaknuyuḥ
analyzed: te hi naḥ pratisaṃyoddhum saṃgrāme na hi śaknuyuḥ
translated: for they would not be able to fight against us in battle.

original: katham ekataras teṣāṃ samastān yodhayet kurūn
analyzed: katham ekataraḥ teṣām samastān yodhayet kurūn
translated: How could one of them fight against all the Kurus together?

original: anyo vai klībaveṣeṇa yady āgacched gavāṃ padam
analyzed: anyaḥ vai klība veṣeṇa yadi āgacchet gavām padam
translated: If anyone else were to come in the guise of a eunuch, following the path of the cows,

analyzed: śaraiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ arpayitvā pātayiṣyāmi bhū tale
translated: I will pierce him with sharp arrows and bring him down to the ground.

original: channaṃ tathā taṃ satreṇa pāṇḍavaṃ prekṣya bhārata
analyzed: channam tathā tam satreṇa pāṇḍavam prekṣya bhārata
translated: Seeing the Pandava Arjuna thus hidden in the sacrificial session, O descendant of Bharata,

original: arjunaṃ neti cety enaṃ na vyavasyanti te punaḥ
analyzed: arjunam na iti ca iti enam na vyavasyanti te punar
translated: they again did not decide whether it was him or not.

original: iti sma kuravaḥ sarve mantrayanti mahārathāḥ
analyzed: iti sma kuravaḥ sarve mantrayanti mahā rathāḥ
translated: Thus all the great warriors of the Kurus were consulting.

analyzed: dṛḍha vedhī mahā sattvaḥ śakra tulya parākramaḥ
translated: He is a great warrior, a firm shot, equal to Shakra in prowess.

original: abhyāgacchati ced yoddhuṃ sarvaṃ saṃśayitaṃ balam
analyzed: abhyāgacchati ced yoddhum sarvam saṃśayitam balam
translated: If he comes to fight, the entire army is in doubt.

original: na cāpy anyataraṃ tatra vyavasyanti dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: na ca api anyataram tatra vyavasyanti dhanaṃjayāt
translated: And they do not decide on anyone other than Dhananjaya.

analyzed: uttaram tu pradhāvantam anudrutya dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: But Dhananjaya ran after the fleeing Uttara,

analyzed: gatvā pada śatam tūrṇam keśa pakṣe parāmṛśat
translated: and quickly going a hundred steps, seized him by the hair.

original: mā mā gṛhāṇa bhadraṃ te dāso 'haṃ te bṛhannale🔽iti vādinam evāśu dhāvantaṃ tarasāgrahīt🔽virāṭaputraṃ bībhatsur balavān arimardanaḥ
analyzed: mā mā gṛhāṇa bhadram te dāsaḥ ham te bṛhat nale  iti vādinam eva āśu dhāvantam tarasā agrahīt  virāṭa putram bībhatsuḥ balavān ari mardanaḥ
translated: He said, Do not seize me, may you fare well, I am your slave, O Brihannala.🔽 But the powerful Bibhatsu, the destroyer of enemies, quickly seized him as he was running away, saying this.

analyzed: saḥ rjunena parāmṛṣṭaḥ paryadevayat ārta vat
translated: Seized by Arjuna, the son of Virata lamented piteously.

original: mā mā māraya bhadraṃ te muñca mām emi me gṛham
analyzed: mā mā māraya bhadram te muñca mām emi me gṛham
translated: He said, Do not kill me, may you fare well, release me, I will go home.

original: muñca māṃ muñca muñceti tatpādāv agrahīd bruvan
analyzed: muñca mām muñca muñca iti tad pādau agrahīt bruvan
translated: Saying, Release me, release me, he seized his feet.

original: darśayitvā tataḥ sarvān adaśat so 'ṅguliṃ nṛpa🔽mā bhais tvam iti pārthena prārthitaḥ paryadevayat
analyzed: darśayitvā tatas sarvān adaśat saḥ ṅgulim nṛpa  mā bhaiḥ tvam iti pārthena prārthitaḥ paryadevayat
translated: Then showing his finger to all, he bit it, O king.

original: bahulaṃ kṛpaṇaṃ caiva virāṭasya sutas tadā
analyzed: bahulam kṛpaṇam ca eva virāṭasya sutaḥ tadā
translated: When asked by Partha, Do not be afraid, the son of Virata then lamented much and pitifully.

analyzed: uttaraḥ uvāca
translated: Uttara said:

original: śṛṇuyās tvaṃ hi kalyāṇi bṛhannaḍe sumadhyame
analyzed: śṛṇuyāḥ tvam hi kalyāṇi bṛhannaḍe sumadhyame
translated: Listen, O fortunate one, O Brihannada of slender waist,

original: nivartaya rathaṃ śīghraṃ jīvan bhadrāṇi paśyati
analyzed: nivartaya ratham śīghram jīvan bhadrāṇi paśyati
translated: Turn back the chariot quickly. A living person sees what is auspicious.

original: grāmāś caturdaśa tathā pūrṇāś ca dhanagokulaiḥ
analyzed: grāmāḥ caturdaśa tathā pūrṇāḥ ca dhana go kulaiḥ
translated: And fourteen villages filled with wealth and cattle

original: dadāmy etad dhanaṃ tubhyaṃ muñca māṃ tvaṃ bṛhannaḍe
analyzed: dadāmi etat dhanam tubhyam muñca mām tvam bṛhannaḍe
translated: I will give you this wealth, release me, O Brihannala.

analyzed: aśvānām tu sahasre dve śubhrāṇām hema mālinām
translated: Two thousand white horses adorned with golden garlands,

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa yuktānām muñca mām tvam bṛhannaḍe
translated: endowed with all good qualities, release me, O Brihannala.

analyzed: uttaraḥ
translated: Uttara:

analyzed: suvarṇa maṇi muktānām yat yat icchasi dadmi te
translated: Whatever you desire of gold, jewels and pearls I will give to you.

analyzed: hastinaḥ śvān rathān gāvaḥ striyaḥ ca samalaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: Elephants, horses, chariots, cows, and women adorned with ornaments,

analyzed: śātakumbhasya śuddhasya śatam niṣkān dadāmi te
translated: I will give you a hundred nishkas of pure gold,

analyzed: śreṣṭhasya rajatasya ca
translated: and a hundred nishkas of the best silver,
