analyzed: dadāmi śata niṣkam te muñca mām tvam bṛhat nale
translated: I will give you, release me, O Brihannala.

original: maṇīn aṣṭau ca vaiḍūryān hemabaddhān mahāprabhān
analyzed: maṇīn aṣṭau ca vaiḍūryān hema baddhān mahā prabhān
translated: And eight lapis lazuli gems, very radiant, set in gold,

analyzed: hema daṇḍa praticchannam ratham yuktam ca su vrajaiḥ
translated: a chariot covered with golden poles, yoked with well-trained horses,

original: mattāṃś ca daśa mātaṅgān muñca māṃ tvaṃ bṛhannaḍe
analyzed: mattān ca daśa mātaṅgān muñca mām tvam bṛhannaḍe
translated: and ten rutting elephants, release me, O Brihannala.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭim su alaṃkṛtāḥ kanyāḥ grāmam ekam dadāmi te
translated: Sixty well-adorned maidens and one village I will give to you.

original: muñca māṃ tvaṃ bhṛśaṃ dīnaṃ vihvalaṃ bhayakampitam
analyzed: muñca mām tvam bhṛśam dīnam vihvalam bhaya kampitam
translated: Release me, I am extremely distressed, agitated, trembling with fear.

analyzed: gamiṣyāmi puram ṣaṇḍha draṣṭum mātaram arditām

analyzed: mātsyasya putraḥ bālaḥ ham tena ca asmi sukha uṣitaḥ

analyzed: mātṛ pārśva śayānaḥ ham a spṛṣṭa ātapa vāyumān
translated: Lying by my mother's side, untouched by the sun and wind.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa bala yuddhaḥ ham kutas te kuravaḥ kutas
translated: I have never seen a battle, how much less the Kurus?

original: mātṛpārśvaṃ gamiṣyāmi muñca māṃ tvaṃ bṛhannale
analyzed: mātṛ pārśvam gamiṣyāmi muñca mām tvam bṛhat nale
translated: I will go to my mother's side, release me, O Brihannala.

analyzed: pralaya arṇava saṃkāśam dṛśyate kauravam balam
translated: The Kaurava army appears like the ocean at the time of dissolution.

analyzed: strīṇām madhye ham ajñānāt vīrya śaurya aṅkitām giram
translated: In the midst of women, out of ignorance, I spoke words marked by heroism and valor,

original: uktavān madagarveṇa ko jetuṃ śaknuyāt kurūn
analyzed: uktavān mada garveṇa kaḥ jetum śaknuyāt kurūn
translated: out of pride, saying Who can defeat the Kurus?

original: amuktvā vā yadi nayer mariṣyāmi tavāgrataḥ
analyzed: a muktvā vā yadi nayeḥ mariṣyāmi tava agratas
translated: If I do not say this, I will die before you.

original: pragṛhyaitad dhanaṃ sarvaṃ muñca māṃ tvaṃ bṛhannaḍe
analyzed: pragṛhya etat dhanam sarvam muñca mām tvam bṛhannaḍe
translated: Taking all this wealth, release me, O Brihannala.

original: āranālena jīviṣye na me gobhiḥ prayojanam
analyzed: āranālena jīviṣye na me gobhiḥ prayojanam
translated: I will live on sugarcane juice, I have no need for cows.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: jīvan prāpsyāmi gā hy anyā nivartasva bṛhannaḍe
analyzed: jīvan prāpsyāmi gāḥ hi anyāḥ nivartasva bṛhannaḍe
translated: Alive, I will obtain other cows, turn back, O Brihannala.

analyzed: yaśaḥ hi kalpānta śata eka sākṣi
translated: For fame is the sole witness of a hundred ages,

analyzed: na jīvitam kuñjara karṇa lolam
translated: not life, which is fickle as an elephant's ear.

analyzed: kṣitipāla sūno bhava raṅga madhye
translated: O son of a king, be in the middle of the battlefield.

analyzed: uttaraḥ uvāca
translated: Uttara said:

analyzed: lajjāmahe saṃgara raṅga bhaṅgāt
translated: We are ashamed of breaking off in the middle of the battlefield.

analyzed: yā kīrtiḥ utsarpati dehanāśe
translated: That fame which spreads when the body is destroyed,

analyzed: dhik duḥkha dām mūla vināśinīm tām
translated: Fie on that fame which causes sorrow and destroys the root.

analyzed: vikrīya deham draviṇena kaḥ nu
translated: Having sold the body for money, who would

analyzed: yātrā kṛtam devakule karoti
translated: make a pilgrimage to a temple?

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: evamādīni vākyāni vilapantam acetasam
translated: While he was lamenting like this, the best of men,

analyzed: prahasya puruṣa vyāghraḥ rathasya antikam ānayat
translated: having laughed, brought him near the chariot.

analyzed: athā enam abravīt pārthaḥ bhaya ārtam naṣṭa cetasam
translated: Then Partha said to him, who was afflicted with fear and had lost his senses:

analyzed: arjunaḥ
translated: Arjuna said:

original: ahaṃ yotsyāmi kauravyair hayān saṃyaccha cottara
analyzed: aham yotsyāmi kauravyaiḥ hayān saṃyaccha ca uttara
translated: I will fight with the Kurus, and you hold the reins, O Uttara.

analyzed: ādadānaḥ kimartham tvam palāyana parobhavaḥ
translated: Why are you intent on fleeing, taking up (the reins)?

original: yudhyasva kauravaiḥ sārdhaṃ vijayas te bhaviṣyati
analyzed: yudhyasva kauravaiḥ sārdham vijayaḥ te bhaviṣyati
translated: Fight with the Kurus, victory will be yours.

original: yasya yantāsmy ahaṃ yuddhe saṃyacchāmi hayottamān
analyzed: yasya yantā asmi aham yuddhe saṃyacchāmi haya uttamān
translated: Whose charioteer I am in battle, I hold the best of horses.

original: rājño vā rājaputrasya tasya nityaṃ jayo dhruvaḥ
analyzed: rājñaḥ vā rāja putrasya tasya nityam jayaḥ dhruvaḥ
translated: For the king or the prince, his victory is always certain.

original: sarvathottara yudhyasva yantrā sākaṃ mayā kurūn
analyzed: sarvathā uttara yudhyasva yantrā sākam mayā kurūn
translated: O Uttara, fight in every way with me against the Kurus.

original: jitvā mahīṃ yaśaḥ prāpya bhokṣyase sakalām imām
analyzed: jitvā mahīm yaśaḥ prāpya bhokṣyase sakalām imām
translated: Having conquered the earth, having attained fame, you will enjoy this entire world.

original: hato 'pi prāpsyase svargaṃ na śreyas te palāyanam
analyzed: hataḥ pi prāpsyase svargam na śreyaḥ te palāyanam
translated: Even if killed, you will attain heaven. Flight is not better for you.

original: adya sarvān kurūñ jitvā yathā jayam avāpsyasi
analyzed: adya sarvān kurūm jitvā yathā jayam avāpsyasi
translated: Today, having conquered all the Kurus, you will obtain victory

original: tathāhaṃ prayatiṣye 'tra sahāyo 'tra mato hy aham
analyzed: tathā aham prayatiṣye tra tra mataḥ hi aham
translated: as you will. I will strive in this, for I am considered an ally here.

original: saṃyacchāmi hayān yasya na sa bhītaḥ palāyati
analyzed: saṃyacchāmi hayān yasya na sa bhītaḥ palāyati
translated: I restrain the horses of one who is not frightened and does not flee.

original: yadi notsahase yoddhuṃ śatrubhiḥ śatrukarśana🔽ehi me tvaṃ hayān yaccha yudhyamānasya śatrubhiḥ
analyzed: yadi nā utsahase yoddhum śatrubhiḥ śatru karśana  ehi me tvam hayān yaccha yudhyamānasya śatrubhiḥ
translated: If you are not eager to fight with the enemies, O destroyer of enemies,🔽then come, guide my horses while I fight with the enemies.

analyzed: prayāhi etat ratha anīkam mad bāhu bala rakṣitaḥ
translated: Protected by the strength of my arms, enter this chariot division

analyzed: apradhṛṣyatamam ghoram guptam vīraiḥ mahā rathaiḥ
translated: which is extremely invincible, terrible, and guarded by heroic great warriors.

original: mā bhais tvaṃ rājaputrāgrya kṣatriyo 'si paraṃtapa
analyzed: mā bhaiḥ tvam rāja putra agrya kṣatriyaḥ si paraṃtapa
translated: Do not be afraid, O foremost prince, you are a kshatriya, O scorcher of enemies.

analyzed: katham puruṣa śārdūla śatru madhye viṣīdasi

original: papāta mahatī colkā diśo na pracakāśire
analyzed: papāta mahatī ca ulkā diśaḥ na pracakāśire

analyzed: bhrānta dvijam kham tadā āsīt prakampita mahā drumam  tam śabdam kuravaḥ jānan visphoṭam aśaneḥ iva

analyzed: tārkṣyam śabdam iva śrutvā vitresuḥ dīna mānasāḥ

translated: Just as the powerful Indra drew his terrible thunderbolt,

translated: The great sound of the bowstring was like the great sound of a great thunderbolt.

original: śatrūn vīrāṃś ca saṃtyajya nigrahastho rathe sthitaḥ
analyzed: śatrūn vīrān ca saṃtyajya nigraha sthaḥ rathe sthitaḥ

analyzed: asahāyaḥ si kaunteya sa sahāyāḥ ca kauravāḥ

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca

analyzed: atas eva mahā bāho bhītaḥ tiṣṭhāmi te gratas

analyzed: uvāca pārthaḥ mā bhaiṣīḥ prahasya svanavat tadā

analyzed: yudhyamānasya me vīra gandharvaiḥ su mahā balaiḥ

analyzed: sahāyaḥ ghoṣa yātrāyām kaḥ tadā āsīt sakhā mama  tathā pratibhaye tasmin deva dānava saṃkule

analyzed: khāṇḍave yudhyamānasya kaḥ tadā āsīt sakhā mama  nivāta kavacaiḥ sārdham paulomaiḥ ca mahā balaiḥ

analyzed: yudhyataḥ devarāja arthe kaḥ sahāyaḥ tadā abhavat
translated: who was my ally then?

original: svayaṃvare tu pāñcālyā rājabhiḥ saha saṃyuge
analyzed: svayaṃvare tu pāñcālyāḥ rājabhiḥ saha saṃyuge
translated: And when I was fighting in the Svayamvara of Panchala with the kings, O son,

analyzed: yudhyataḥ bahubhiḥ tāta kaḥ sahāyaḥ tadā abhavat
translated: who was my ally then?

analyzed: upajīvya gurum droṇam śakram vaiśravaṇam yamam
translated: Having served the preceptors Drona, Shakra, Vaishravana and Yama,

original: varuṇaṃ pāvakaṃ caiva kṛpaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ ca mādhavam
analyzed: varuṇam pāvakam ca eva kṛpam kṛṣṇam ca mādhavam
translated: Varuna, Pavaka, Kripa, Krishna, Madhava,

analyzed: pinākapāṇinam ca eva katham etān na yodhaye

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: uttaram sārathim kṛtvā śamīm kṛtvā pradakṣiṇam

analyzed: sa patākam vicitra aṅgam sa upāsaṅgam mahā rathaḥ
translated: The great chariot, with flags, of wonderful limbs, with a seat,

analyzed: śaṅkha śabdena vitrastam jyā ghātena ca mūrchitam

translated: Arjuna embraced Uttara and comforted him, saying:

analyzed: mā bhaiḥ tvam rāja putra agrya kṣatriyaḥ si paraṃtapa

analyzed: katham puruṣa śārdūla śatru madhye viṣīdasi

analyzed: uttaraḥ uvāca
translated: Uttara said:

analyzed: śrutāḥ me śaṅkha śabdāḥ ca bherī śabdāḥ ca puṣkalāḥ

analyzed: kuñjarāṇām ca ninadāḥ vyūḍha anīkeṣu tiṣṭhatām
translated: and the trumpeting of elephants standing in battle formations,

analyzed: na evaṃvidhaḥ śaṅkha śabdaḥ purā jātu mayā śrutaḥ

analyzed: dhvajasya ca api rūpam me dṛṣṭa pūrvam na hi īdṛśam

analyzed: dhanuṣaḥ ca eva nirghoṣaḥ śruta pūrvaḥ na me kva cit

analyzed: asya śaṅkhasya śabdena dhanuṣaḥ nisvanena ca

analyzed: vyākulāḥ ca diśaḥ sarvāḥ hṛdayam vyathati iva me

analyzed: sthirīkuruṣva hṛdayam yathā śabdaḥ mahān bhavet

analyzed: tasya śaṅkhasya śabdena ratha nemi svanena ca

translated: Then Bharadvaja's son Drona, the best among all wielders of weapons,

analyzed: rājānam ca āha saṃprekṣya duryodhanam ariṃdamam
translated: and beholding King Duryodhana, the conqueror of enemies,

analyzed: droṇaḥ uvāca  nadī ja laṅkā īśava nārī ketuḥ
translated: Drona said:

analyzed: nagāhvayaḥ nāma nagāri sūnuḥ
translated: The son of the enemy of the city, named Nagahva, who has the banner of the lord of Lanka on the river,

analyzed: eṣaḥ u ṅganā veṣa dharaḥ tarasvī
translated: this swift one, wearing the attire of a woman,

analyzed: vijeṣyate sarva kuru pravīrān
translated: will defeat all the best warriors of the Kurus.

original: eṣā na yoṣā yadi yoṣid eṣā
analyzed: eṣā na yoṣā yadi yoṣit eṣā
translated: If this is not a woman, but a woman,

analyzed: tat sā eva yā śumbha niśumbha hantrī
translated: then she is the very one who killed Shumbha and Nishumbha,

analyzed: māyā maya strī vapuḥ ātanoti
translated: assuming the form of a woman made of illusion,

analyzed: līlāyitam vā puruṣaḥ purāṇaḥ
translated: or the ancient Purusha is playing.

analyzed: yathā indrajit kṣatriyāṇī aṅganā iyam
translated: As this woman of Anga is the daughter of Indrajit, a Kshatriya,

analyzed: guruḥ babhāṣe vacanam kila etat
translated: the teacher spoke these words:

original: yathā rathasya nirghoṣo yathā śaṅkha udīryate
analyzed: yathā rathasya nirghoṣaḥ yathā śaṅkhaḥ udīryate
translated: As the sound of the chariot is, as the conch is blown,

original: kampate ca yathā bhūmir naiṣo 'nyaḥ savyasācinaḥ
analyzed: kampate ca yathā bhūmiḥ na eṣaḥ nyaḥ savyasācinaḥ
translated: and as the earth trembles, this is none other than Savyasachi (Arjuna).

original: autpātikam idaṃ rājan nimittaṃ bhavatīha naḥ
analyzed: autpātikam idam rājan nimittam bhavati iha naḥ
translated: O king, this is an inauspicious omen for us here.

original: na hi paśyāmi vijayaṃ sainye 'smākaṃ paraṃtapa🔽śastrāṇi na prakāśante na prahṛṣyanti vājinaḥ
analyzed: na hi paśyāmi vijayam sainye smākam paraṃtapa  śastrāṇi na prakāśante na prahṛṣyanti vājinaḥ
translated: For I do not see victory for our army, O scorcher of enemies.🔽The weapons do not shine, the horses do not rejoice,

original: agnayaś ca na bhāsante samiddhās tan na śobhanam
analyzed: agnayaḥ ca na bhāsante samiddhāḥ tat na śobhanam
translated: and the kindled fires do not blaze, that is not good.

original: praty ādityaṃ ca naḥ sarve mṛgā ghorapravādinaḥ
analyzed: prati ādityam ca naḥ sarve mṛgāḥ ghora pravādinaḥ
translated: All the animals are howling towards the sun,

original: dhvajeṣu ca nilīyante vāyasās tan na śobhanam
analyzed: dhvajeṣu ca nilīyante vāyasāḥ tat na śobhanam
translated: and crows are perching on our flags - that is not auspicious.

original: śakunāś cāpasavyā no vedayanti mahad bhayam
analyzed: śakunāḥ ca apasavyāḥ naḥ vedayanti mahat bhayam
translated: The birds are on our left, foretelling great danger.

analyzed: go māyuḥ eṣa senāyāḥ ruvan madhye nudhāvati
translated: This jackal is running in the middle of our army, howling.

original: anāhataś ca niṣkrānto mahad vedayate bhayam
analyzed: anāhataḥ ca niṣkrāntaḥ mahat vedayate bhayam
translated: And it has come out without being struck - it foretells great danger.

analyzed: bhavatām romakūpāṇi prahṛṣṭāni upalakṣaye
translated: I observe that the pores of your body are delighted.

analyzed: dhruvam vināśaḥ yuddhena kṣatriyāṇām pradṛśyate
translated: The destruction of the Kshatriyas in battle is certainly seen.

original: jyotīṃṣi na prakāśante dāruṇā mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ🔽utpātā vividhā ghorā dṛśyante kṣatranāśanāḥ
analyzed: jyotīṃṣi na prakāśante dāruṇāḥ mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ  utpātāḥ vividhāḥ ghorāḥ dṛśyante kṣatra nāśanāḥ
translated: The luminaries are not shining, and the animals and birds are terrible.🔽Various terrible portents are seen, foretelling the destruction of the Kshatriyas.

analyzed: viśeṣataḥ iha asmākam nimittāni vināśane
translated: In particular, these omens are seen for our destruction.

original: ulkābhiś ca pradīptābhir bādhyate pṛtanā tava
analyzed: ulkābhiḥ ca pradīptābhiḥ bādhyate pṛtanā tava
translated: Your army is afflicted by flaming meteors.

analyzed: vāhanāni a prahṛṣṭāni rudanti iva viśām pate
translated: The animals are not cheerful, as if weeping, O lord of the people.

original: upāsate ca sainyāni gṛdhrās tava samantataḥ
analyzed: upāsate ca sainyāni gṛdhrāḥ tava samantataḥ
translated: And vultures are hovering all around your troops.

analyzed: tapsyase vāhinīm dṛṣṭvā pārtha bāṇa prapīḍitām
translated: You will be tormented on seeing your army afflicted by Partha's arrows.

original: anuṣṇāṅgāś ca saṃsvinnā jṛmbhante cāpy abhīkṣṇaśaḥ
analyzed: anuṣṇa aṅgāḥ ca saṃsvinnāḥ jṛmbhante ca api abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: Their limbs are not warm, they are sweating, and they are yawning frequently.

analyzed: viṣṭambhanti iha mātaṅgāḥ muñcanti aśrūṇi vājinaḥ
translated: The elephants are trembling here, and the horses are shedding tears,

original: sadā mūtraṃ purīṣaṃ ca utsṛjante punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: sadā mūtram purīṣam ca utsṛjante punar punar
translated: And they are constantly releasing urine and feces again and again.

original: lohitārdrā ca pṛthivī diśaḥ sarvāḥ pradhūpitāḥ
analyzed: lohita ārdrā ca pṛthivī diśaḥ sarvāḥ pradhūpitāḥ
translated: And the earth is moist with blood, and all the directions are filled with smoke,

original: na ca sūryaḥ pratapati mahad vedayate bhayam
analyzed: na ca sūryaḥ pratapati mahat vedayate bhayam
translated: And the sun is not shining, foreboding great fear.

original: hastinaś cāpi vitrastā yodhāś cāpi vitatrasuḥ
analyzed: hastinaḥ ca api vitrastāḥ yodhāḥ ca api vitatrasuḥ
translated: Even the elephants are frightened, and the warriors are terrified,

original: parābhūtā ca vaḥ senā na kaś cid yoddhum icchati
analyzed: parābhūtā ca vaḥ senā na kaḥ cit yoddhum icchati
translated: And your army is defeated, no one wishes to fight.

analyzed: vivarṇa mukha bhūyiṣṭhāḥ sarve yodhāḥ vicetasaḥ
translated: Most of the warriors have pale faces and are senseless,

original: diśaṃ te dakṣiṇāṃ sarve viprekṣante punaḥ punaḥ🔽mṛgāś ca pakṣiṇaś caiva savyam eva patanti naḥ
analyzed: diśam te dakṣiṇām sarve viprekṣante punar punar  mṛgāḥ ca pakṣiṇaḥ ca eva savyam eva patanti naḥ
translated: And they keep looking again and again to the southern direction.🔽The deer and birds are flying to our left,

original: vāditroddhuṣṭaghoṣāś ca na gāḍhaṃ prasvananti naḥ
analyzed: vāditra uddhuṣṭa ghoṣāḥ ca na gāḍham prasvananti naḥ
translated: And the sounds of musical instruments are not resounding deeply for us.

original: yathā meghasya ninado gambhīras tūrṇam āyataḥ
analyzed: yathā meghasya ninadaḥ gambhīraḥ tūrṇam āyataḥ
translated: The deep and swift rumble of a cloud

analyzed: śrūyate ratha nirghoṣaḥ na ayam anyaḥ dhanaṃjayāt
translated: Is heard as the roar of a chariot, this is none other than Dhananjaya.

analyzed: aśvānām svanatām śabdaḥ vahatām pākaśāsanim
translated: The sound of the horses neighing as they carry the son of Paka's chastiser,

original: vānaraś ca dhvajo nityo niḥsaṅgaṃ dhūyate mahān
analyzed: vānaraḥ ca dhvajaḥ nityaḥ niḥsaṅgam dhūyate mahān
translated: And the monkey banner is always fluttering in the great wind.

analyzed: śaṅkha śabdena pārthasya karṇau me badhirīkṛtau
translated: Partha's conch sound has deafened my ears.

original: sarvasainyaṃ ca vitrastaṃ nāyam anyo dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: sarva sainyam ca vitrastam na ayam anyaḥ dhanaṃjayāt
translated: And the entire army is terrified, thinking that there is no one else but Dhananjaya.

analyzed: rājānam agratas kṛtvā duryodhanam ariṃdamam
translated: Placing King Duryodhana, the scorcher of enemies, at the forefront,

analyzed: gāḥ saṃprasthāpya tiṣṭhāmaḥ vyūḍha anīkāḥ prahāriṇaḥ
translated: we will stand here, our troops arrayed in battle formation, ready to strike, with the cattle driven in front of us.

original: pravibhajya tridhā senāṃ samucchritya dhvajān api
analyzed: pravibhajya tridhā senām samucchritya dhvajān api
translated: Dividing the army into three parts, raising our standards,

analyzed: dikṣu gulmāḥ niveśyantām yattāḥ yotsyāmahe rjunam
translated: and stationing our troops in all directions, we will fight Arjuna with all our might.

original: śitair bāṇaiḥ pratapyemāṃ camūm eṣa dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: śitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ pratapya imām camūm eṣa dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: With his sharp arrows, Dhananjaya is scorching this army.

analyzed: mūrdhni sarva narendrāṇām vāma pādam kariṣyati
translated: He will place his left foot on the heads of all the kings.

original: na hy eṣa śakyo bībhatsur jetuṃ devāsurair api
analyzed: na hi eṣa śakyaḥ bībhatsuḥ jetum deva asuraiḥ api
translated: For this Bibhatsu cannot be conquered even by the gods and demons.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: atha duryodhano rājā samare bhīṣmam abravīt
analyzed: atha duryodhanaḥ rājā samare bhīṣmam abravīt
translated: Then King Duryodhana, in the battle, spoke to Bhishma,

original: droṇaṃ ca rathaśārdūlaṃ kṛpaṃ ca sumahāratham
analyzed: droṇam ca ratha śārdūlam kṛpam ca su mahā ratham
translated: and to Drona, the tiger among charioteers, and to the great warrior Kripa,

original: ukto 'yam artha ācāryo mayā karṇena cāsakṛt
analyzed: uktaḥ yam arthe ācāryaḥ mayā karṇena ca asakṛt
translated: The preceptor has been told this by me and Karna many times,

original: punar eva ca vakṣyāmi na hi tṛpyāmi taṃ bruvan
analyzed: punar eva ca vakṣyāmi na hi tṛpyāmi tam bruvan
translated: but I will speak again, for I am not satisfied in speaking it.

original: parājitair hi vastavyaṃ taiś ca dvādaśa vatsarān
analyzed: parājitaiḥ hi vastavyam taiḥ ca dvādaśa vatsarān
translated: For we have been defeated and must live in the forest for twelve years,

original: vane janapade 'jñātair eṣa eva paṇo hi naḥ
analyzed: vane janapade jñātaiḥ eṣaḥ eva paṇaḥ hi naḥ
translated: unknown in a different country. This is our wager.

original: teṣāṃ na tāvan nirvṛttaṃ vartate tu trayodaśam
analyzed: teṣām na tāvat nirvṛttam vartate tu trayodaśam
translated: Their thirteenth year is now running, but not yet completed.

analyzed: ajñāta vāsam bībhatsuḥ atha asmābhiḥ samāgataḥ
translated: Then Vibhatsu, having lived in concealment, has come to us.

original: anivṛtte tu nirvāse yadi bībhatsur āgataḥ
analyzed: a nivṛtte tu nirvāse yadi bībhatsuḥ āgataḥ
translated: But if Vibhatsu has come when the period of concealment is not over,

original: punar dvādaśa varṣāṇi vane vatsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: punar dvādaśa varṣāṇi vane vatsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: the Pandavas will have to live in the forest for twelve more years.

original: lobhād vā te na jānīyur asmān vā moha āviśat
analyzed: lobhāt vā te na jānīyuḥ asmān vā mohaḥ āviśat
translated: Either out of greed they will not know us, or delusion will possess them.

analyzed: hīna atiriktam eteṣām bhīṣmaḥ veditum arhati
translated: Bhishma is worthy of knowing whether they are deficient or in excess.

original: arthānāṃ tu punar dvaidhe nityaṃ bhavati saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: arthānām tu punar dvaidhe nityam bhavati saṃśayaḥ
translated: But in the case of a conflict of interests, there is always doubt.

original: svārthe sarve vimuhyanti ye 'pi dharmavido janāḥ
analyzed: sva arthe sarve vimuhyanti ye dharma vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: Even people who know dharma become confused about their own interests.

original: anyathā cintito hy arthaḥ punar bhavati cānyathā
analyzed: anyathā cintitaḥ hi arthaḥ punar bhavati ca anyathā
translated: An object is thought of in one way, but it turns out to be different.

analyzed: uttaram mārgamāṇānām matsya senām yuyutsatām
translated: While we were seeking a northern route, desirous of fighting the Matsya army,

original: yadi bībhatsur āyātas teṣāṃ kaḥ syāt parāṅmukhaḥ
analyzed: yadi bībhatsuḥ āyātaḥ teṣām kaḥ syāt parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: if Vibhatsu has come, who among them would turn away?

original: trigartānāṃ vayaṃ hetor matsyān yoddhum ihāgatāḥ🔽matsyānāṃ viprakārāṃs te bahūn asmān akīrtayan
analyzed: trigartānām vayam hetoḥ matsyān yoddhum iha āgatāḥ  matsyānām viprakārān te bahūn asmān akīrtayan
translated: We have come here to fight the Matsyas for the sake of the Trigartas.🔽They have told us many wrongs done to them by the Matsyas.

original: teṣāṃ bhayābhipannānāṃ tad asmābhiḥ pratiśrutam🔽trastānāṃ trāṇam icchatām
analyzed: teṣām bhaya abhipannānām tat asmābhiḥ pratiśrutam      icchatām
translated: We have promised them, who are overcome with fear,🔽who desire protection from those who are frightened,

analyzed: abhayam yācamānānām
translated: who are begging for safety,

original: prathamaṃ tair grahītavyaṃ matsyānāṃ godhanaṃ mahat
analyzed: prathamam taiḥ grahītavyam matsyānām go dhanam mahat
translated: They should first seize the large cattle wealth of the Matsyas,

original: saptamīm aparāhṇe vai tathā nas taiḥ samāhitam🔽aṣṭamyāṃ punar asmābhir ādityasyodayaṃ prati
analyzed: saptamīm aparāhṇe vai tathā naḥ taiḥ samāhitam  aṣṭamyām punar asmābhiḥ ādityasya udayam prati
translated: And in the afternoon of the seventh day, they have done so for us.🔽On the eighth day, when the sun rises,

original: imā gāvo gṛhītavyā gate matsye gavāṃ padam
analyzed: imāḥ gāvaḥ gṛhītavyāḥ gate matsye gavām padam
translated: These cows should be seized by us, after the Matsya has gone to the cowpen.

analyzed: iti eṣa niścayaḥ smākam mantraḥ bhūt nāgasāhvaye
translated: This is our resolve, the mantra that was made in the city of Hastināpura,

analyzed: pāṇḍavānām parijñāne sarveṣām naḥ parasparam
translated: For the recognition of the Pāṇḍavas, all of us towards each other.

original: te vā gāvo na paśyanti yadi va syuḥ parājitāḥ
analyzed: te vā gāvaḥ na paśyanti yadi syuḥ parājitāḥ
translated: If they do not see the cows, or if they are defeated,

original: asmān vāpy atisaṃdhāya kuryur matsyena saṃgatam
analyzed: asmān vā api atisaṃdhāya kuryuḥ matsyena saṃgatam
translated: Or if they have deceived us, they may have made an alliance with the Matsya.

original: atha vā tān upāyāto matsyo jānapadaiḥ saha
analyzed: atha vā tān upāyātaḥ matsyaḥ jānapadaiḥ saha
translated: Or perhaps the Matsya has come with the people of the country,

original: sarvayā senayā sārdham asmān yoddhum upāgataḥ
analyzed: sarvayā senayā sārdham asmān yoddhum upāgataḥ
translated: With his entire army, to fight with us.

analyzed: saṃvṛtaḥ bhīma rūpayā
translated: Surrounded by a terrible-looking army,

analyzed: āyātaḥ kevalām rātrim
translated: He has come all night long.

original: teṣām eva mahāvīryaḥ kaś cid eva puraḥsaraḥ
analyzed: teṣām eva mahā vīryaḥ kaḥ cit eva puraḥsaraḥ
translated: One of their extremely valorous leaders,

original: asmāñ jetum ihāyāto matsyo vāpi svayaṃ bhavet
analyzed: asmām jetum iha āyātaḥ matsyaḥ vā api svayam bhavet
translated: Either the Matsya has come to defeat us, or he himself may be Vibhātsu.

original: yady eṣa rājā matsyānāṃ yadi bībhatsur āgataḥ
analyzed: yadi eṣa rājā matsyānām yadi bībhatsuḥ āgataḥ
translated: If this is the king of the Matsyas, or if Vibhātsu has come,

original: sarvair yoddhavyam asmābhir iti naḥ samayaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: sarvaiḥ yoddhavyam asmābhiḥ iti naḥ samayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: We have made an agreement that all of us should fight with him.

analyzed: śaraiḥ enam su niśitaiḥ pātayiṣyāmi bhū tale
translated: I will bring him down to the ground with my extremely sharp arrows.

original: atha kasmāt sthitā hy ete ratheṣu rathasattamāḥ
analyzed: atha kasmāt sthitāḥ hi ete ratheṣu ratha sattamāḥ
translated: But why are these best of charioteers standing on their chariots?

original: bhīṣmo droṇaḥ kṛpaś caiva vikarṇo drauṇir eva ca
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ ca eva vikarṇaḥ drauṇiḥ eva ca
translated: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Vikarna and Drona's son -

original: saṃbhrāntamanasaḥ sarve kāle hy asmin mahārathāḥ
analyzed: saṃbhrānta manasaḥ sarve kāle hi asmin mahā rathāḥ
translated: all these great warriors are agitated in their minds at this time.

analyzed: na anyatra yuddhāt śreyaḥ sti tathā ātmā praṇidhīyatām
translated: There is no better course than battle, so let your mind be set on that.

original: sarvalokena vā yuddhaṃ devair vāstu savāsavaiḥ
analyzed: sarva lokena vā yuddham devaiḥ vā astu sa vāsavaiḥ
translated: Let there be a battle with the entire world, or with the gods along with Indra,

analyzed: ācchinne go dhane smākam api devena vajriṇā
translated: even if the wealth of cattle is taken away by the god with the thunderbolt,

original: yamena vāpi saṃgrāme ko hāstinapuraṃ vrajet🔽śarair abhipraṇunnānāṃ bhagnānāṃ gahane vane
analyzed: yamena vā api saṃgrāme kaḥ hāstinapuram vrajet  śaraiḥ abhipraṇunnānām bhagnānām gahane vane
translated: or if there is a battle with Yama, who will go to Hastinapura?🔽Who will survive when they are driven away by arrows in the dense forest?

original: ko hi jīvet padātīnāṃ bhaved aśveṣu saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hi jīvet padātīnām bhavet aśveṣu saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt about the horses, but what about the infantry?

original: ācāryaṃ pṛṣṭhataḥ kṛtvā tathā nītir vidhīyatām
analyzed: ācāryam pṛṣṭhatas kṛtvā tathā nītiḥ vidhīyatām
translated: Having made the preceptor to the rear, let the policy be decided accordingly.

original: duryodhanavacaḥ śrutvā rāṃdheyas tv abravīd vacaḥ
analyzed: duryodhana vacaḥ śrutvā rāṃdheyaḥ tu abravīt vacaḥ
translated: Having heard Duryodhana's words, the son of Radha spoke these words:

original: jānāti hi mataṃ teṣām atas trāsayatīva naḥ
analyzed: jānāti hi matam teṣām atas trāsayati iva naḥ
translated: He knows their opinion, and therefore he does not frighten us.

analyzed: arjunena asya saṃprītim adhikām upalakṣaye
translated: I observe his excessive affection for Arjuna.

original: tathā hi dṛṣṭvā bībhatsum upāyāntaṃ praśaṃsati
analyzed: tathā hi dṛṣṭvā bībhatsum upāyāntam praśaṃsati
translated: For he praises Bibhatsu when he sees him coming.

original: yathā senā na bhajyeta tathā nītir vidhīyatām
analyzed: yathā senā na bhajyeta tathā nītiḥ vidhīyatām
translated: Let a policy be devised so that the army is not destroyed.

original: heṣitaṃ hy upaśṛṇvāne droṇe sarvaṃ vighaṭṭitam🔽adeśikā mahāraṇye grīṣme śatruvaśaṃ gatā
analyzed: heṣitam hi upaśṛṇvāne droṇe sarvam vighaṭṭitam  a deśikā mahā araṇye grīṣme śatru vaśam gatā
translated: For when Drona hears the neighing, everything will be shattered.🔽We are in a great forest without a guide, in the summer, fallen under the power of the enemy.

original: yathā na vibhramet senā tathā nītir vidhīyatām
analyzed: yathā na vibhramet senā tathā nītiḥ vidhīyatām
translated: Let a policy be devised so that the army is not confused.

original: iṣṭā hi pāṇḍavā nityam ācāryasya viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: iṣṭāḥ hi pāṇḍavāḥ nityam ācāryasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: The Pandavas have always been dear to the teacher, especially so.

original: āsayann aparārthāś ca kathyate sma svayaṃ tathā
analyzed: āsayan apara arthāḥ ca kathyate sma svayam tathā
translated: And he himself has said that they are not to be killed, even though they are enemies.

original: aśvānāṃ heṣitaṃ śrutvā kā praśaṃsā bhavet pare
analyzed: aśvānām heṣitam śrutvā kā praśaṃsā bhavet pare
translated: Having heard the neighing of the horses, what praise can there be of the enemy?

original: sthāne vāpi vrajanto vā sadā heṣanti vājinaḥ
analyzed: sthāne vā api vrajantaḥ vā sadā heṣanti vājinaḥ
translated: Whether standing or moving, the horses always neigh.

original: sadā ca vāyavo vānti nityaṃ varṣati vāsavaḥ
analyzed: sadā ca vāyavaḥ vānti nityam varṣati vāsavaḥ
translated: The winds always blow, Vasava always rains,

original: stanayitnoś ca nirghoṣaḥ śrūyate bahuśas tathā
analyzed: stanayitnoḥ ca nirghoṣaḥ śrūyate bahuśas tathā
translated: And the rumbling of thunder is heard many times.

original: bhīṣayan pāṇḍaveyebhyo bhavān sarvān imāñ janān
analyzed: bhīṣayan pāṇḍaveyebhyaḥ bhavān sarvān imān janān
translated: Frightening all these people for the Pandavas, you speak much that is irrelevant.

analyzed: pramukhe sarva sainyānām abaddham bahu bhāṣate
translated: At the head of all the troops, you speak much that is irrelevant.

analyzed: yathā eva aśvān mārgamāṇāḥ tān eva abhiparīpsavaḥ
translated: Just as those seeking the horses, desiring to find them,

original: heṣitāny eva śṛṇvanti syād idaṃ bhavatas tathā
analyzed: heṣitāni eva śṛṇvanti syāt idam bhavataḥ tathā
translated: Hear only the neighing, so it is for you.

original: kim atra kāryaṃ pārthasya kathaṃ vā sa praśasyate
analyzed: kim atra kāryam pārthasya katham vā sa praśasyate
translated: What is Partha's duty here, or how is he to be praised?

original: anyatra kāmād dveṣād vā roṣād vāsmāsu kevalāt
analyzed: anyatra kāmāt dveṣāt vā roṣāt vā asmāsu kevalāt
translated: Not because of desire, hatred, or anger towards us alone,

analyzed: ācāryāḥ vai kāruṇikāḥ prājñāḥ ca apāya darśinaḥ
translated: The teachers are compassionate and wise, seeing danger.

original: naite mahābhaye prāpte saṃpraṣṭavyāḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na ete mahā bhaye prāpte saṃpraṣṭavyāḥ katham cana
translated: When a great danger has come, they should not be consulted at all.

analyzed: prāsādeṣu vicitreṣu goṣṭhīṣu āvasatheṣu ca
translated: In colorful palaces, in assemblies and residences,

original: kathā vicitrāḥ kurvāṇāḥ paṇḍitās tatra śobhanāḥ
analyzed: kathāḥ vicitrāḥ kurvāṇāḥ paṇḍitāḥ tatra śobhanāḥ
translated: The wise are shining there, telling various stories.

analyzed: bahūni āścarya rūpāṇi kurvantaḥ jana saṃsadi
translated: Doing many things of wondrous form in the assembly of people,

analyzed: iṣu astre cāru saṃdhāne paṇḍitāḥ tatra śobhanāḥ
translated: The wise are shining there, in archery and the arrangement of weapons.

analyzed: pareṣām vivara jñāne manuṣya ācariteṣu ca
translated: In knowing the weaknesses of others and in the conduct of men,

analyzed: hasti aśva ratha caryāsu khara uṣṭra aja avi karmaṇi
translated: In the conduct of elephants, horses and chariots, in the work of donkeys, camels and goats,

analyzed: go dhaneṣu pratolīṣu vara dvāra mukheṣu ca
translated: In cattle, in the streets, in the entrances to the best doors,

analyzed: anna saṃskāra doṣeṣu paṇḍitāḥ tatra śobhanāḥ
translated: The wise are shining there, in the faults of food preparation.

analyzed: paṇḍitān pṛṣṭhatas kṛtvā pareṣām guṇa vādinaḥ
translated: Having put the wise behind, the proclaimers of others' qualities,

original: vidhīyatāṃ tathā nītir yathā vadhyeta vai paraḥ
analyzed: vidhīyatām tathā nītiḥ yathā vadhyeta vai paraḥ
translated: Let policy be made so that the enemy may be killed.

original: gāvaś caiva pratiṣṭhantāṃ senāṃ vyūhantu māciram
analyzed: gāvaḥ ca eva pratiṣṭhantām senām vyūhantu māciram
translated: And let the cows be established, let the army be arrayed without delay.

original: ārakṣāś ca vidhīyantāṃ yatra yotsyāmahe parān
analyzed: ārakṣāḥ ca vidhīyantām yatra yotsyāmahe parān
translated: And let guards be appointed where we will fight the enemy.

original: yathāsmākaṃ jayo vīra cintanīyas tathā tvayā
analyzed: yathā asmākam jayaḥ vīra cintanīyaḥ tathā tvayā
translated: O hero, you should think about how we can be victorious.

analyzed: karṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Karna said:

original: sarvān āyuṣmato bhītān saṃtrastān iva lakṣaye
analyzed: sarvān āyuṣmataḥ bhītān saṃtrastān iva lakṣaye
translated: I see all of you, though long-lived, frightened and terrified,

analyzed: ayuddha manasaḥ ca eva sarvān ca eva anavasthitān
translated: and all of you are dispirited and not in a fighting mood.

original: yady eṣa jāmadagnyo vā yadi vendraḥ puraṃdaraḥ
analyzed: yadi eṣa jāmadagnyaḥ vā yadi vā indraḥ puraṃdaraḥ
translated: Whether it is Jamadagni's son, or Indra, the destroyer of cities,

original: yady eṣa rājā matsyānāṃ yadi bībhatsur āgataḥ
analyzed: yadi eṣa rājā matsyānām yadi bībhatsuḥ āgataḥ
translated: whether it is the king of the Matsyas, or Vibhatsu has come,

analyzed: aham āvārayiṣyāmi velā iva makara ālayam
translated: I will hold him back, like the shore holds back the abode of makaras.

analyzed: mama cāpa pramuktānām śarāṇām nata parvaṇām
translated: There is no escape for the arrows shot by me, with their straight knots,

original: nāvṛttir gacchatām asti sarpāṇām iva sarpatām
analyzed: na āvṛttiḥ gacchatām asti sarpāṇām iva sarpatām
translated: as they go forth like snakes gliding along.

analyzed: rukma puṅkhāḥ su tīkṣṇa agrāḥ muktāḥ hastavatā mayā
translated: Released by me, skilled in the use of hands, they are gold-feathered, very sharp-pointed,

original: chādayantu śarāḥ pārthaṃ śalabhā iva pādapam🔽śarāṇāṃ puṅkhasaktānāṃ maurvyābhihatayā dṛḍham
analyzed: chādayantu śarāḥ pārtham śalabhāḥ iva pādapam  śarāṇām puṅkha saktānām maurvyā abhihatayā dṛḍham
translated: and may the arrows cover Partha like locusts cover a tree.🔽The sound of my palms struck hard against each other,

original: śrūyatāṃ talayoḥ śabdo bheryor āhatayor iva
analyzed: śrūyatām talayoḥ śabdaḥ bheryoḥ āhatayoḥ iva
translated: with the arrows stuck to the nocks, should be heard like that of two drums being beaten.

original: ekaikaṃ caturaḥ pañca kva cit ṣaṣṭiṃ kva cic chatam
analyzed: ekaikam caturaḥ pañca kva cit ṣaṣṭim kva cit śatam
translated: And see, one, four, five, somewhere sixty, somewhere a hundred,

original: mayā paśyata matsyānām iṣubhir nihatān rathān
analyzed: mayā paśyata matsyānām iṣubhiḥ nihatān rathān
translated: by me, the Matsyas' chariots are being killed with arrows.

original: ekaṃ dvau caturaḥ pañca kva cit ṣaṣṭiṃ kva cic chatam
analyzed: ekam dvau caturaḥ pañca kva cit ṣaṣṭim kva cit śatam
translated: One, two, four, five, in some places sixty, in some places a hundred.

original: hatān paśyata mātaṅgān kīrṇān ekeṣuṇā mayā
analyzed: hatān paśyata mātaṅgān kīrṇān eka iṣuṇā mayā
translated: Behold the elephants slain, scattered by a single arrow of mine.

analyzed: mad bāhu muktaiḥ iṣubhiḥ taila dhautaiḥ patatribhiḥ
translated: With arrows released from my arms, polished with oil,

analyzed: khadyotaiḥ iva saṃvṛttam antarikṣam vyarājatām
translated: The sky appeared as if covered with fireflies.

original: samāhito hi bībhatsur varṣāṇy aṣṭau ca pañca ca
analyzed: samāhitaḥ hi bībhatsuḥ varṣāṇi aṣṭau ca pañca ca
translated: For eight and five years, indeed, Vibhatsu has been concentrated,

analyzed: jāta snehaḥ ca yuddhasya mayi saṃprahariṣyati
translated: And having developed affection for battle, he will strike me.

original: pātrībhūtaś ca kaunteyo brāhmaṇo guṇavān iva
analyzed: pātrī bhūtaḥ ca kaunteyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ guṇavān iva
translated: And the son of Kunti is like a qualified brahmin who has become a worthy recipient,

analyzed: śara oghān pratigṛhṇātu mayā muktān sahasraśas
translated: May he receive thousands of arrows released by me.

original: eṣa caiva maheṣvāsas triṣu lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
analyzed: eṣa ca eva mahā iṣvāsaḥ triṣu lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
translated: And this great archer is renowned in the three worlds,

original: ahaṃ cāpi kuruśreṣṭhā arjunān nāvaraḥ kva cit🔽mama hastapramuktānāṃ śarāṇāṃ nataparvaṇām
analyzed: aham ca api kuru śreṣṭhāḥ arjunāt na avaraḥ kva cit  mama hasta pramuktānām śarāṇām nata parvaṇām
translated: And I am also not inferior to Arjuna in any way, O best of the Kurus.🔽There is no turning back for the arrows released from my hand, with their straight knots,

original: nivṛttir gacchatāṃ nāsti vaiśvānarasamatviṣām🔽itaś cetaś ca nirmuktaiḥ kāñcanair gārdhravājitaiḥ🔽dṛśyatām adya vai vyoma khadyotair iva saṃvṛtam
analyzed: nivṛttiḥ gacchatām na asti vaiśvānara sama tviṣām  itas ca itas ca nirmuktaiḥ kāñcanaiḥ gārdhra vājitaiḥ  dṛśyatām adya vai vyoma khadyotaiḥ iva saṃvṛtam
translated: Which have the luster of the fire.🔽The sky will be seen today as if covered with golden arrows, equipped with vulture feathers, released from here and there.

original: tumulaḥ śrūyatāṃ nādaḥ ṣaṭpadāṃ gāyatām iva
analyzed: tumulaḥ śrūyatām nādaḥ ṣaṭpadām gāyatām iva
translated: Listen to the tumultuous sound, like the singing of bees.

analyzed: mad kārmuka vimuktānām śarāṇām nata parvaṇām
translated: Who can stand before me, even all the gods and demons,

original: kaḥ sahetāgrataḥ sthātum api sarvaiḥ surāsuraiḥ🔽adyāham ṛṇam akṣayyaṃ purā vācā pratiśrutam
analyzed: kaḥ saheta agratas sthātum api sarvaiḥ sura asuraiḥ  adya aham ṛṇam akṣayyam purā vācā pratiśrutam
translated: of the straight-tufted arrows released from my bow?🔽Today I will repay the inexhaustible debt that I promised long ago with my words,

analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭrasya dāsyāmi nihatya samare rjunam
translated: by killing Arjuna in battle and giving it to Dhritarashtra's son.

analyzed: antarā chidyamānānām puṅkhānām vyatiśīryatām
translated: While they are being cut down, their feathers scattered,

analyzed: śalabhānām iva ākāśe pracāraḥ saṃpradṛśyatām  indra aśani sama sparśam mahā indra sama tejasam
translated: their flight will be seen to resemble that of locusts in the sky.🔽I will torment Partha, whose touch is like Indra's thunderbolt and whose energy is like that of the great Indra,

original: ardayiṣyāmy ahaṃ pārtham ulkābhir iva kuñjaram
analyzed: ardayiṣyāmi aham pārtham ulkābhiḥ iva kuñjaram
translated: like a firebrand against an elephant.

analyzed: rathāt atiratham śūram sarva śastrabhṛtām varam
translated: From his chariot, that hero, the best of all wielders of weapons,

original: vivaśaṃ pārtham ādāsye garutmān iva pannagam
analyzed: vivaśam pārtham ādāsye garutmān iva pannagam
translated: I will seize the helpless Partha, like Garuda seizing a snake.

analyzed: tam agnim iva durdharṣam asi śakti śara indhanam
translated: Like a fire that is unassailable, fueled by swords, spears and arrows,

analyzed: pāṇḍava agnim aham dīptam pradahantam iva āhitān
translated: I will extinguish the blazing fire of the Pandavas, which is burning the enemies.

analyzed: aśva vega purovātaḥ ratha ogha stanayitnumān  śara dhāraḥ mahā meghaḥ śamayiṣyāmi pāṇḍavam
translated: With the speed of horses as the wind in front, the mass of chariots as the thunder,🔽and the arrows as the great cloud, I will pacify the Pandava.

analyzed: nirdahantam anīkāni śamayiṣye rjuna analam
translated: I will extinguish the fire of Arjuna that is burning the troops,

original: kṣudrakair vividhair bhallair nipatadbhiś ca māmakaiḥ
analyzed: kṣudrakaiḥ vividhaiḥ bhallaiḥ nipatadbhiḥ ca māmakaiḥ
translated: With small and various broad arrows falling from my side,

original: saṃmūḍhacetāḥ kaunteyaḥ kartavyaṃ nābhipadyate🔽matkārmukavinirmuktāḥ pārtham āśīviṣopamāḥ
analyzed: saṃmūḍha cetāḥ kaunteyaḥ kartavyam na abhipadyate  mad kārmuka vinirmuktāḥ pārtham āśīviṣa upamāḥ
translated: The mind of the son of Kunti is confused and he does not know what to do.🔽Arrows released from my bow, resembling venomous snakes,

analyzed: śarāḥ samabhisarpantu valmīkam iva pannagāḥ
translated: Let them crawl towards Partha like snakes towards an anthill.

analyzed: su tejanaiḥ rukma puṅkhaiḥ su pītaiḥ nata parvabhiḥ
translated: With well-sharpened, gold-feathered, very yellow, straight arrows,

original: ācitaṃ paśya kaunteyaṃ karṇikārair ivācalam🔽barhibarhiṇavājānāṃ barhiṇāṃ barhiṇām iva
analyzed: ācitam paśya kaunteyam karṇikāraiḥ iva acalam  barhi barhiṇa vājānām barhiṇām barhiṇām iva
translated: Behold the son of Kunti covered, like a mountain with karnikara flowers.🔽Like the sound of peacocks, peacocks with peacocks,

original: patatāṃ patatāṃ ghoṣaḥ patatāṃ patatām iva
analyzed: patatām patatām ghoṣaḥ patatām patatām iva
translated: Of those falling, falling, the sound of those falling, falling.

original: jāmadagnyān mayā hy astraṃ yat prāptam ṛṣisattamāt
analyzed: jāmadagnyāt mayā hi astram yat prāptam ṛṣi sattamāt
translated: The weapon that I obtained from Jamadagni, from that best of sages,

original: tad upāśritya vīryaṃ ca yudhyeyam api vāsavam
analyzed: tat upāśritya vīryam ca yudhyeyam api vāsavam
translated: Relying on that and my valor, I would fight even with Vasava.

original: dhvajāgre vānaras tiṣṭhan bhallena nihato mayā
analyzed: dhvaja agre vānaraḥ tiṣṭhan bhallena nihataḥ mayā
translated: The monkey standing at the top of the flagstaff, slain by my broad arrow,

original: adyaiva patatāṃ bhūmau vinadan bhairavān ravān
analyzed: adyā eva patatām bhūmau vinadan bhairavān ravān
translated: Today itself will fall to the ground, crying out terrible roars.

analyzed: śatroḥ mayā abhipannānām bhūtānām dhvaja vāsinām
translated: To the beings dwelling on the flagstaff, who are overcome by my enemy,

original: diśaḥ pratiṣṭhamānānām astu śabdo divaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: diśaḥ pratiṣṭhamānānām astu śabdaḥ divam gataḥ
translated: May their sound, as they depart in the directions, reach the heavens.

original: kruddhenāstraṃ mayā muktaṃ nirdahet pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: kruddhena astram mayā muktam nirdahet pṛthivīm imām
translated: The weapon released by me in anger would burn up this earth.

original: sthitaṃ saṃgrāmaśirasi pārtham ekākinaṃ kimu🔽adya duryodhanasyāhaṃ śalyaṃ hṛdi cirasthitam
analyzed: sthitam saṃgrāma śirasi pārtham ekākinam kimu  adya duryodhanasya aham śalyam hṛdi cira sthitam
translated: What will the Kauravas do when they see Partha alone, standing at the head of the battle?🔽Today I will uproot the thorn that has long been lodged in Duryodhana's heart,

original: samūlam uddhariṣyāmi bībhatsuṃ pātayan rathāt🔽hatāśvaṃ virathaṃ pārthaṃ pauruṣe paryavasthitam
analyzed: sa mūlam uddhariṣyāmi bībhatsum pātayan rathāt  hata aśvam viratham pārtham pauruṣe paryavasthitam
translated: bringing down Bibhatsu from his chariot and destroying him along with his roots.🔽Let the Kauravas today see Partha, his horses slain and himself chariotless,

original: niḥśvasantaṃ yathā nāgam adya paśyantu kauravāḥ
analyzed: niḥśvasantam yathā nāgam adya paśyantu kauravāḥ
translated: relying on his manliness and sighing like a serpent.

original: kāmaṃ gacchantu kuravo dhanam ādāya kevalam
analyzed: kāmam gacchantu kuravaḥ dhanam ādāya kevalam
translated: Let the Kurus go as they please, taking only their wealth,

original: ratheṣu vāpi tiṣṭhanto yuddhaṃ paśyantu māmakam🔽paśyantu vīryam iha māmakam adya nāma
analyzed: ratheṣu vā api tiṣṭhantaḥ yuddham paśyantu māmakam  paśyantu vīryam iha māmakam adya nāma
translated: or let them watch my battle from their chariots.

analyzed: magne jane sa manujāḥ sura siddha saṃghāḥ
translated: Let the gods, demons, and hosts of sages today behold my valor

analyzed: śakrātmajasya samare virathīkṛtasya
translated: in the battle, when I have stripped the son of Shakra of his chariot.

original: evaṃ punaḥ sa virarāma kṛpo babhāṣe
analyzed: evam punar sa virarāma kṛpaḥ babhāṣe
translated: Having said this, Kripa fell silent, and then he spoke again:

analyzed: kṛpaḥ uvāca
translated: Kripa said:

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ  tasya tat vacanam śrutvā nīti śāstra viśāradaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:🔽Having heard his words, the preceptor of the Kuru heroes,

analyzed: ācāryaḥ kuru vīrāṇām kṛpaḥ śāradvataḥ bravīt
translated: Kripa Sharadvata, skilled in the science of statecraft, spoke:

original: sadaiva tava rādheya yuddhe krūratarā matiḥ
analyzed: sadā eva tava rādheya yuddhe krūratarā matiḥ
translated: O Radheya, your mind has always been crueler than the battle itself.

analyzed: na arthānām prakṛtim vettha na anubandham avekṣase
translated: You do not understand the nature of things, nor do you consider the consequences.

original: nayā hi bahavaḥ santi śāstrāṇy āśritya cintitāḥ
analyzed: nayāḥ hi bahavaḥ santi śāstrāṇi āśritya cintitāḥ
translated: For there are many ways of policy that have been thought out by relying on the scriptures.

original: teṣāṃ yuddhaṃ tu pāpiṣṭhaṃ vedayanti purāvidaḥ
analyzed: teṣām yuddham tu pāpiṣṭham vedayanti purāvidaḥ
translated: The wise ones of old declared war to be the most sinful of them.

analyzed: deśa kālena saṃyuktam yuddham vijaya dam bhavet
translated: A war that is undertaken at the right place and time will bring victory.

original: hīnakālaṃ tad eveha phalavan na bhavaty uta🔽deśe kāle ca vikrāntaṃ kalyāṇāya vidhīyate
analyzed: hīna kālam tat eva iha phalavat na bhavati uta  deśe kāle ca vikrāntam kalyāṇāya vidhīyate
translated: But if it is undertaken at the wrong time, it will not bring any fruit.🔽An attack that is undertaken at the right place and time is done for the good.

analyzed: ānukūlyena kāryāṇām antaram saṃvidhīyatām
translated: Let us find an opportunity for our actions when it is favorable.

original: bhāraṃ hi rathakārasya na vyavasyanti paṇḍitāḥ
analyzed: bhāram hi rathakārasya na vyavasyanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise do not undertake the burden of a chariot-maker.

original: paricintya tu pārthena saṃnipāto na naḥ kṣamaḥ
analyzed: paricintya tu pārthena saṃnipātaḥ na naḥ kṣamaḥ
translated: But after considering it, we do not see any opportunity for us to attack.

original: eko hi samare śatrūn samarthaḥ pratibādhitum
analyzed: ekaḥ hi samare śatrūn samarthaḥ pratibādhitum
translated: For only one man is capable of resisting enemies in battle.

original: ekaḥ kurūn abhyarakṣad ekaś cāgnim atarpayat
analyzed: ekaḥ kurūn abhyarakṣat ekaḥ ca agnim atarpayat
translated: Alone he protected the Kurus, alone he satisfied the fire,

original: ekaś ca pañca varṣāṇi brahmacaryam adhārayat
analyzed: ekaḥ ca pañca varṣāṇi brahmacaryam adhārayat
translated: and alone he observed the vow of celibacy for five years.

original: ekaḥ subhadrām āropya dvairathe kṛṣṇam āhvayat
analyzed: ekaḥ subhadrām āropya dvairathe kṛṣṇam āhvayat
translated: Alone he challenged Krishna to a duel, after placing Subhadra on his chariot.

analyzed: ekaḥ kirāta rūpeṇa sthitam śarvam ayodhayat
translated: Alone he fought with Shiva, who was standing in the form of a Kirata.

original: asminn eva vane kṛṣṇo hṛtāṃ kṛṣṇām avājayat
analyzed: asmin eva vane kṛṣṇaḥ hṛtām kṛṣṇām avājayat
translated: In this very forest Krishna won back the abducted Krishna.

original: ekaś ca pañca varṣāṇi śakrād astrāṇy aśikṣata
analyzed: ekaḥ ca pañca varṣāṇi śakrāt astrāṇi aśikṣata
translated: And alone he learned the weapons from Shakra for five years.

analyzed: ekaḥ deveśvaram jitvā astrarājam avāptavān
translated: Alone, he defeated the lord of gods and obtained the king of weapons.

original: ekaḥ sāṃyaminīṃ jitvā kurūṇām akarod yaśaḥ
analyzed: ekaḥ sāṃyaminīm jitvā kurūṇām akarot yaśaḥ
translated: Alone, he conquered the army of the Panchalas and brought fame to the Kurus.

analyzed: ekaḥ gandharva rājānam citrasenam ariṃdamaḥ
translated: Alone, the conqueror of enemies defeated Chitrasena, the king of the Gandharvas,

original: vijigye tarasā saṃkhye senāṃ cāsya sudurjayām
analyzed: vijigye tarasā saṃkhye senām ca asya su durjayām
translated: and his invincible army in battle.

original: pāñcālīṃ śrīmatīṃ prāptaḥ kṣatraṃ jitvā svayaṃvare

analyzed: tam adūram upāyāntam dṛṣṭvā pāṇḍavam arjunam
translated: Seeing the Pandava Arjuna approaching from a distance,

original: nārayaḥ prekṣituṃ śekus tapasyantaṃ yathā ravim
analyzed: na arayaḥ prekṣitum śekuḥ tapasyantam yathā ravim
translated: The Narayanas were unable to look at him, as if at the sun while performing austerities.

original: sa taṃ dṛṣṭvā rathānīkaṃ pārthaḥ sārathim abravīt
analyzed: sa tam dṛṣṭvā ratha anīkam pārthaḥ sārathim abravīt
translated: Having seen that chariot division, Partha spoke to his charioteer:

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: iṣupāte ca senāyā hayān saṃyaccha sārathe
analyzed: iṣu pāte ca senāyāḥ hayān saṃyaccha sārathe
translated: O charioteer, restrain the horses within arrow range of the army,

analyzed: yāvat samīkṣe sainye smin kva asau kuru kula adhamaḥ  ratna vaiḍūrya vikṛtam maṇi pravara bhūṣitam
translated: So that I may search this army to find out where that worst of the Kuru lineage is.🔽I recognize from a distance his flagstaff, adorned with jewels and lapis lazuli, decorated with the best of gems,

original: parijānāmy ahaṃ tasya dhvajaṃ dūrāt samucchritam
analyzed: parijānāmi aham tasya dhvajam dūrāt samucchritam
translated: raised high.

original: yady enam iha paśyāmi durbuddhim atimāninam
analyzed: yadi enam iha paśyāmi durbuddhim atimāninam
translated: If I see that evil-minded, extremely arrogant one here,

analyzed: yamāya preṣayiṣyāmi sahāyaḥ sya yat īśvaraḥ
translated: I will send him to Yama, with his ally Ishvara.

original: sarvān anyān anādṛtya dṛṣṭvā tam atimāninam
analyzed: sarvān anyān an ādṛtya dṛṣṭvā tam atimāninam
translated: Disregarding all others, having seen that extremely arrogant one,

original: tasya mūrdhni patiṣyāmi tata ete parājitāḥ
analyzed: tasya mūrdhni patiṣyāmi tatas ete parājitāḥ
translated: I will descend upon his head, and then these (others) will be defeated.

original: eṣa vyavasthito droṇo drauṇiś ca tadanantaram
analyzed: eṣa vyavasthitaḥ droṇaḥ drauṇiḥ ca tad anantaram
translated: There stands Drona, and after him Drona's son,

original: bhīṣmaḥ kṛpaś ca karṇaś ca maheṣvāsā vyavasthitāḥ
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ kṛpaḥ ca karṇaḥ ca mahā iṣvāsāḥ vyavasthitāḥ
translated: Bhishma, Kripa, and Karna, those great archers are stationed.

original: rājānaṃ nātra paśyāmi gāḥ samādāya gacchati
analyzed: rājānam na atra paśyāmi gāḥ samādāya gacchati
translated: I do not see the king here, he has gone taking the cattle with him.

analyzed: dakṣiṇam mārgam āsthāya śaṅke jīva parāyaṇaḥ
translated: I suspect he has taken the southern path, intent on saving his life.

analyzed: utsṛjya etat ratha anīkam gaccha yatra suyodhanaḥ
translated: Abandoning this chariot division, go where Suyodhana is.

original: tatraiva yotsye vairāṭe nāsti yuddhaṃ nirāmiṣam
analyzed: tatra eva yotsye vairāṭe na asti yuddham nirāmiṣam
translated: There I will fight, O son of Virata, there is no battle without meat.

original: taṃ jitvā vinivartiṣye gāḥ samādāya vai punaḥ
analyzed: tam jitvā vinivartiṣye gāḥ samādāya vai punar
translated: Having conquered him, I will return again, having recovered the cattle.

analyzed: siṃhaḥ kṣudra mṛgasya iva patiṣye tasya mūrdhani
translated: Like a lion on a small animal, I will fall on his head.

analyzed: haniṣyāmi tam eva āśu śaraiḥ gāṇḍīva niḥsṛtaiḥ
translated: I will quickly kill him with arrows released from Gandiva.

original: tasmin hate bhaviṣyanti sarva eva parājitāḥ
analyzed: tasmin hate bhaviṣyanti sarve eva parājitāḥ
translated: When he is killed, all of them will be defeated.

analyzed: śaraiḥ samarpayiṣyāmi dhārtarāṣṭram sa saubalam
translated: I will torment the son of Dhritarashtra and Subala with arrows.

original: asabhyānāṃ ca vaktāraṃ kurūṇāṃ kila kilbiṣam
analyzed: asabhyānām ca vaktāram kurūṇām kila kilbiṣam
translated: And the one who speaks uncivilly, the sinner of the Kurus,

original: rājānaṃ neha paśyāmi nirāmiṣam idaṃ balam
analyzed: rājānam na iha paśyāmi nirāmiṣam idam balam
translated: I do not see the king here, this army is without meat.

original: abhidrave ha rājānaṃ vyaktam ity atra nirbhayaḥ
analyzed: abhidrave ha rājānam vyaktam iti atra nirbhayaḥ
translated: Fearlessly attack the king, it is clear here.

original: āsthito madhyamācāryo hy aśvatthāmā tv anantaram
analyzed: āsthitaḥ madhyama ācāryaḥ hi aśvatthāmā tu anantaram
translated: The middle teacher Ashvatthama is stationed next to him,

analyzed: kṛpa karṇau purastāt tu mahā iṣvāsau vyavasthitau
translated: And Kripa and Karna are stationed in front, those great archers.

analyzed: bhūriśravāḥ somadattaḥ bāhlīkaḥ ca jayadrathaḥ
translated: Bhurishrava, Somadatta, the Bahlika Jayadratha,

analyzed: dakṣiṇam pakṣam āśritya sthitāḥ yuddha viśāradāḥ
translated: Skilled in battle, are stationed, having resorted to the right wing.

analyzed: sālva rājaḥ dyumatsenaḥ vṛṣasenaḥ ca saubalaḥ
translated: King Salwa, Dyumatsena, Vrishasena, the son of Subala,

original: daśārṇaś caiva kāliṅgo vāmaṃ pakṣaṃ samāśritāḥ
analyzed: daśārṇaḥ ca eva kāliṅgaḥ vāmam pakṣam samāśritāḥ
translated: And the king of Dasharna and Kalinga have taken refuge in the left wing.

original: pṛṣṭhataḥ kurumukhyas tu bhīṣmas tiṣṭhati daṃsitaḥ
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas kuru mukhyaḥ tu bhīṣmaḥ tiṣṭhati daṃsitaḥ
translated: Behind them, the foremost of the Kurus, the invincible Bhishma, stands,

analyzed: ardha sainyena balavān sarveṣām naḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: With half the army, the powerful grandfather of us all.

original: duryodhanaṃ na paśyāmi kva nu rājā sa gacchati
analyzed: duryodhanam na paśyāmi kva nu rājā sa gacchati
translated: I do not see Duryodhana. Where has the king gone?

analyzed: utsṛja etat ratha anīkam yāhi yatra suyodhanaḥ
translated: Abandon this chariot division and go where Suyodhana is.

original: taṃ hatvā vinivartiṣye gāḥ sa ādāya gacchati
analyzed: tam hatvā vinivartiṣye gāḥ saḥ ādāya gacchati
translated: Having killed him, I will return. He is going with the cattle.

original: gavāgram abhito yāhi yatra rājā bhaviṣyati
analyzed: gavā agram abhitas yāhi yatra rājā bhaviṣyati
translated: Go to the front of the cattle, where the king will be.

original: ity uktvā samare pārtho vairāṭim aparājitaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā samare pārthaḥ vairāṭim aparājitaḥ
translated: Having said this in the battle, the undefeated Partha,

translated: Touching his divine bow, quickly went there.

analyzed: tatas bhīṣmaḥ bravīt vākyam kuru madhye paraṃtapaḥ

analyzed: cira dṛṣṭaḥ yam asmābhiḥ dharma jñaḥ bāndhava priyaḥ
translated: We have seen this one after a long time, who knows dharma and is dear to his relatives.

analyzed: atīva jvalate lakṣmyā pākaśāsanaḥ acyutaḥ  eṣa duryodhanam pārthaḥ mārgate vikṛtim smaran

analyzed: senām atyartham ālokya tvarate grahaṇe kṛtam
translated: Seeing the army, he is in a hurry to seize it.

analyzed: mṛgam siṃhaḥ iva ādātum īkṣate pākaśāsanaḥ

original: paścād ete pradātavyā iti me vartate matiḥ
analyzed: paścāt ete pradātavyāḥ iti me vartate matiḥ
translated: I think they should be given to him from the rear.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa vairāṭiḥ hayān saṃyamya yatnataḥ

original: niyamya ca tato raśmīn yatra te kurupuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: niyamya ca tatas raśmīn yatra te kuru puṃgavāḥ

analyzed: acodayat tatas vāhān yatas duryodhanaḥ tatas
translated: He urged the mounts to where Duryodhana was.

analyzed: utsṛjya ratha vaṃśam tu prayāte śvetavāhane
translated: When the one with white horses left, abandoning the circle of chariots,

analyzed: abhiprāyam viditvā asya droṇaḥ vacanam abravīt

analyzed: na eṣaḥ ntareṇa rājānam bībhatsuḥ sthātum icchati

analyzed: tasya pārṣṇim grahīṣyāmaḥ javena abhiprayāsyataḥ

original: na hy enam abhisaṃkruddham eko yudhyeta saṃyuge
analyzed: na hi enam abhisaṃkruddham ekaḥ yudhyeta saṃyuge
translated: For no one can fight in battle alone against him when he is enraged,

original: anyo devāt sahasrākṣāt kṛṣṇād vā devakīsutāt
analyzed: anyaḥ devāt sahasrākṣāt kṛṣṇāt vā devakī sutāt

original: kiṃ no gāvaḥ kariṣyanti dhanaṃ vā vipulaṃ tathā
analyzed: kim naḥ gāvaḥ kariṣyanti dhanam vā vipulam tathā

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ pārtha jale purā nauḥ iva majjati

analyzed: iti uktvā samare bhīṣmaḥ senayā saha kauravaḥ
translated: Having said this in the battle, Bhishma, the Kourava, together with his army,

translated: Vaishampayana

analyzed: anvadhāvat tadā pārtham dhārtarāṣṭrasya rakṣaṇe
translated: followed Partha in order to protect the son of Dhritarashtra.

original: trikośamātraṃ gatvā tu pārtho vairāṭim abravīt
analyzed: tri kośa mātram gatvā tu pārthaḥ vairāṭim abravīt

original: etad agraṃ gavāṃ dṛṣṭaṃ mandaṃ vāhaya sārathe
analyzed: etat agram gavām dṛṣṭam mandam vāhaya sārathe

analyzed: parikṣipya gavām yūtham atra yotsye suyodhanam

analyzed: ime tu atirathāḥ sarve mama vīrya parākramam

analyzed: kīryamāṇāḥ śara oghaiḥ tu yodhāḥ te pārtha coditaiḥ

analyzed: teṣām yuddhe na apayāne bhavat matiḥ

analyzed: gāṇḍīvasya ca ghoṣeṇa pṛthivī samakampata  amānuṣāṇām teṣām ca bhūtānām dhvaja vāsinām

analyzed: tāni anīkāni aśobhanta kurūṇām ātatāyinām

translated: Like lightning-bearing clouds moving in the sky,

analyzed: tatas rājñaḥ sutaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ prāviśat pṛthivīṃjayaḥ  saḥ bhivādya pituḥ pādau dharmarājam apaśyata

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ

analyzed: pūjanīyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca na prabādhyaḥ yam īdṛśaḥ  sa putra vacanam śrutvā virāṭaḥ rāṣṭra vardhanaḥ
translated: He is to be worshipped and saluted, not to be obstructed in this way.🔽Having heard the words of his son, Virata, the enhancer of the kingdom,

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ
